loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cooking oil

loans.name: Diana Abena Gyekyewa

texts.en:
Diana Abena Gyekyewa T. is married and has no children. She has received schooling through senior high education. Diana Abena Gyekyewa sells 'gari' (manioc grits) at Abura, which she has done for some time now. Her husband is a pastor. Diana Abena Ayekyewa uses her income to pay the utility bills and rent. Diana Abena Gyekyewa will use the loan to purchase more bags of 'gari' to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Diana Abena Gyekyewa plans to save.

The picture shows Diana preparing her 'gari' for sale.

loans.use: purchase more bags of 'gari' to sell

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
A simple and religious woman: these words simply describe Raquel P., one of the active members of ASHI ASE. She is 34 years old and from District II, Sibalom, Antique, Philippines.  She is married to Nestor P. and they are blessed with two children, Arthur and Marie Elzevir P., both of whom are still studying.

She is not only active in ASHI but she also served as a BEC (Basic Ecclesiastical Community) coordinator of Sta. Rita de Acasia Parish Church.

For almost three years in ASHI she never gave any problems to the center; instead, she was an aid to solve any problems and conflicts in the center. She is very helpful to those who are in need because she believes that what you have done to others also returns to you twice. 

The family earns their living through farming and the income that they get from this business is used to buy their basic needs. Since the rice planting season is approaching, she needs capital to buy some farm inputs like pesticides, insecticides, certified seeds and for pay for the laborers. She needs 25,000 PHP for her business.

Her dreams are to widen the land that they own, that her children will finish their studies up to college and to put up a comfortable concrete house someday.

loans.use: For farming

loans.name: Cinforosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cinforosa; tiene 59 años de edad, y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, ella prepara todo tipo de comida para almuerzos y cenas, ella atiende desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de comida. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar  como carne, pollo y verduras.

 La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate is a member of the “Los Diamantes” (The Diamonds) communal bank, located in the Cusco district, within the Cusco department and province.

Cinforosa is 59 years old.  She is married, has three children, and sells food.  She prepares typical dishes for lunch and dinner and serves customers from 7:00 AM to 5:00 PM.  She wants to expand her business and is asking for this loan so that she can buy ingredients, such as meat, chicken, and vegetables.  

Our associate appreciates those persons who help make this dream possible through this means and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To cover all wedding expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a large variety of cosmetics as well as women's clothes and underwear

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Madame Mariam S.  est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est mère de neuf enfants et vit dans une famille traditionnelle avec son époux, sa coépouse et ses enfants. Elle réside dans la ville de Fana au quartier Fana coura, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro république du Mali.
Madame Mariam S. n’a pas été à l’école. Elle fait l’achat et la vente d’articles divers de boutique dans le but de pouvoir survenir à ses propres besoins et les besoins de ses enfants. Elle vient de commencer avec l’institution.
C’est à travers ses proches et ses amis qu’elle a fait la connaissance de Soro Yiriwaso.    
Elle se propose de payer avec ce prêt: des paquets de Maggie, du sucre, de l’huile et plusieurs autres articles au marché de Fana. Elle revend à crédit et au comptant à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
Ms. Mariam S. is 51 years old and the mother of nine children living in a traditional family with her husband, her co-spouse, and her children. She resides in Fana city, in the Fana Coura district, Dioïla prefecture, Region of Koulikoro, Republic of Mali.  

Mariam did to attend school.  She buys and sells a variety of store goods with the goal of meeting her own needs and those of her children.  She just started with this micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, which she discovered through her friends and family.  Mariam intends to use her loan to purchase: packs of Maggie (bouillon cubes), sugar, oil, and several other items at the Fana market. She accepts cash or credit in her sales to a customer base composed of women and men. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit 35,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover the loan payments and to meet expenses related to healthcare, food, and schooling.  The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Buying various store goods

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en: Khiev V., 56, sells clothes making US $30 in revenue each day in the Kampong Cham province. She is married and has one child living at home to support. Her husband, Sam Ol, makes approximately US $1 every day growing rice. Khive V. would like a loan of US $1,000 to purchase a mini truck to transport clothes to sell at another village.

loans.use: To purchase a mini truck

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
The young woman in the photograph is Im A., age 26, who lives in the province of Kompong Cham, which is the best territory for farming.  Im A. is a married woman who is devoted to her two young children who attend school and depend on her care. 

Im A. owns a piece of farmland that she inherited from her grandparents over six years ago.  Besides her farming business, Im A. raises a few pigs in the cage behind her house in order to earn extra profits to support her family.  Her husband is a local farmer.  This is the dry season and Im A. wishes to grow her crop in the dry season rice field, but she lacks money to make it possible.  In order to solve this problem, Im A. has decided to ask for a loan from Kiva to purchase fertilizer and seed for planting.  With the rest of the funds, she will use it to buy a few sacks of pig feed for the pigs she is raising.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seed for planting.  The rest of funds will be used to buy a few sacks of pig feed for her pigs.

loans.name: David 3, 4 & 5 Group

texts.es:
Altagracia es una de nuestras mujeres empresarias, dedicada a la venta y elaboración de pan y dulces caseros, ella prepara dulces de coco, leche y pastas o mermeladas de frutas, con las cuales combina los dulces, y elabora el pan de harina de trigo. Su préstamo es para la compra de un saco de Harina de trigo, cientos de coco, azúcar, leche y otros ingredientes. Los cuales vende en su comunidad y en la ciudad de Romana, conocida como un mega del turismo y de la elaboración de azúcar.

Altagracia tiene 5 hijos, los cuales aun viven con ella, junto al padre de sus dos hijos menores. Es una señora mayor, que desde temprano esta en el afán de su negocio, amasando harina para elaborar los panes, y guayando coco para los dulces; pero aun así su actividad favorita es dedicar tiempo a su familia, cocinar y asistir a la iglesia. 

Altagracia esta recibiendo su sexto prestamos con Esperanza internacional, y gracias a que sus pagos han sido puntuales, ha podido reforzar su negocio y hacer buenas inversiones. Partes de sus ganancias eran utilizadas en las necesidades de su familia y también para ahorrarlas, y poder tener un buen ahorro para el futuro poder emprender cualquier proyecto. Unos de sus sueños es tener un local para sus productos.

Altagracia es una de los miembros del grupo David 3, 4 & 5. Compuesto por 15 miembros, todos dedicados a la venta de diferentes productos.
texts.en:
Altagracia is one of our entrepreneurs.  She makes and sells bread and home-M. sweets.  She makes sweets from coconut and milk, which she mixes with dough or fruit marmalade.  She makes bread from wheat flour.  

Her loan is to buy a sack of wheat flour, hundreds of coconuts, sugar, milk, and other ingredients.  She sells them in her community and in the city of Romana, which is known for a lot of tourism and for making sugar.

Altagracia has five children who still live with her and the father of her two youngest children.  She is an older lady who is enthusiastic about her business.  Starting very early she kneads the dough to make the bread, and she scrapes the coconut for the sweets. Her favorite activities are spending time with her family, cooking, and going to church.

This is Altagracia’s sixth loan with Esperanza Internacional.  Thanks to making her payments punctually, she has been able to strengthen her business and make good investments.  She used part of her earnings for family necessities.  Also they were used for savings so that she was able to have good savings.  She did this so that she would be able to undertake any project in the future.

One of her dreams is to have her own place for her products.

Altagracia is one of the members of the David 3, 4, & 5 Communal Bank.  It is comprised of 15 members.  All of them sell different products.

loans.use: Flour, sugar, coconuts, and butter, etc.

loans.name: Amada Andrea

texts.es:
La Señora Amada O. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Combate, vive por el sector de San José que pertenece a la parroquia de Baños, esta parroquia es conocida por sus aguas termales, su rica gastronomía y sus bellos paisajes.

Doña Amanda tiene 34 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 13, 12, 10 y 8 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y sus dos últimos en una escuelita del sector. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un taxi, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora. Amanda es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de calzado, actividad que la realiza hace 5 años, trabaja de lunes a viernes y sin un horario fijo, su calzado lo vende recorriendo la ciudad.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por una amiga, el dinero de su crédito lo va ha invertir en la compra de zapatos para niño. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Ms. Amanda O. is a member of the “Mujeres de Combate” Communal Bank.  She lives in the sector of San José that belongs to the parish of Baños.  This parish is known for its thermal waters, rich gastronomy, and beautiful landscapes.

Amanda is 34 years old.  She is married and has 4 children ages 13, 12, 10, and 8.  Her first two children study at the “colegio” (school) and the last two attend a small school in the sector.  Her husband is a taxi driver.  They do not own their own home so they rent.  

Amanda is a tradeswoman who sells shoes.  She has been in this business for 5 years.  She works from Monday to Friday but does not have set hours.  She travels throughout the city selling her shoes.  

This is her second loan with the communal bank which she joined at the invitation of a friend.  She will use the money form the loan to buys children’s shoes.  Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: To buy children's shoes.

loans.name: Christian

texts.es: Christian tiene 23 años de edad y es soltero. Vive y trabaja en el distrito de José Ortiz Leonardo en la ciudad de Chiclayo. Su comunidad es grande, urbana y en proceso de expansión. Desde hace un año, ofrece servicios de fotografía. Su negocio sigue creciendo de a pocos ya que utiliza herramientas de muy buen nivel de competitividad. Desea invertir su crédito en activo fijo, específicamente para comprar muebles que le permitan acondicionar mejor su negocio. Con esta inversión, podrá dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y de esta manera captar mayor clientela y aumentar sus ingresos. Para lograr su meta, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles. Christian es muy trabajador y posee muy buenas referencias laborales y personales de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Christian is 23 years old and single. He lives and works in José Ortiz Leonardo District in the city of Chiclayo. His community is large, urban and growing.

For a year Christian has offered photography services. His business is growing little by little because he uses tools that allow him to be very competitive. He wants to invest his loan in fixed assets, specifically furniture so he can better fit out his shop. With this investment, he will be able to give his customers better service and in this way get more customers and increase his income. To reach this goal, he has asked for a loan of 1000 new soles. Christian is very hardworking and has very good business and personal references from his community.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his shop

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 49 years old and is a married woman with nine children. Her oldest child is 30 years old and the youngest is 14. 

Magdalena is a farmer working in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for 30 years. She earns about 2000 PHP per month from this farming. Magdalena works hard to improve her business and earnings.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 53 years old.  SHe is married and has 6 adult children.  She has been in farming for twenty years, producing beans and butternuts.

Nancy has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost her farming activity by setting up an irrigation system consisting of a water pump, as well as to buy other farm inputs. She says the water pump will make her water supply consistent, thereby increasing her farm output. She adds that the pump will also control occasional flooding and ensure that the produce is not damaged in the field.

Nancy says that occasional flooding is the major challenge to her business.

loans.use: To set up a water pump and buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase soap, sugar, salt, orange soda, beans (and more) for retail in his shop

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is from the village of Macao, Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 47 years old, married, and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Lilian owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling green bananas in the local community. Lilian has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Lilian joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilian is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional stock of green bananas. This loan will be the first one taken out by Lilian from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue she generates to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of green bananas

location.town: Macao, Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City

loans.name: Carlos Lorenzo

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven de 19 años de edad, el es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres. Su casa esta ubicada en el distrito de San José a 45 minutos de l ciudad de Chiclayo.

Carlos se desempeña ofreciendo servicios de carpintería, en un pequeño taller que ha implementado en su misma casa, allí sus vecinos y amigos concurren frecuentemente, para solicitar su trabajo. El realiza su labor con mucha eficiencia, lo cual le ha permitido tener clientes fidelizados a su negocio. 

Carlos está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme  Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para que pueda material para su negocio, de esta manera poder cumplir con  grandes pedidos, que desea realizar.

Carlos es un joven trabajador y empeñoso, con buenas referencias por parte de las personas que lo conocen, lo describen como un joven tranquilo y responsable
texts.en:
Carlos es un joven de 19 años de edad, el es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres. Su casa esta ubicada en el distrito de San José a 45 minutos de l ciudad de Chiclayo.

Carlos se desempeña ofreciendo servicios de carpintería, en un pequeño taller que ha implementado en su misma casa, allí sus vecinos y amigos concurren frecuentemente, para solicitar su trabajo. El realiza su labor con mucha eficiencia, lo cual le ha permitido tener clientes fidelizados a su negocio. 

Carlos está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme  Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para que pueda material para su negocio, de esta manera poder cumplir con  grandes pedidos, que desea realizar.

Carlos es un joven trabajador y empeñoso, con buenas referencias por parte de las personas que lo conocen, lo describen como un joven tranquilo y responsable

loans.use: Compra de material para su megocio.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 50 years old. He is married and has four children, none of whom are currently in school. John has a small retail shop, which he has run for four years.
To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities such as sugar. With the help of his loan from BRAC, John hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for his family. In the future, he hopes to expand his business further.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities such as sugar.

loans.name: Dima

texts.fr: Jeune dame de 33ans,  Dima achète des ignames à ANIE et revend dans un marché de la place.  Elle a deux enfants et son mari est revendeur. Elle vend aussi des assiettes et des boites de conserves. Elle veut stocker des marchandises pour répondre plus à la demande.
texts.en: A young lady of 33 years, Dima buys yams in Anie and resells them in a local market. She has two children and her husband is a reseller. She also sells plates and canned food. She wants to stock more goods to better meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy yams

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 28 years old, married, and has two children aged 10 and 6. She is a farmer who tills a land in the town of Veruela, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for 10 years and now earns about 6,000 Philippine pesos per month from farming.

Janice plans to use this loan to purchase more seed and fertilizer, and to buy fuel for her tractor. She says she is thankful to have the farm because it helps her earn the money needed to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer, and to buy fuel for a tractor

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío es natural de Sicaya y en la actualidad vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa que es propia. La actividad que se dedica es la crianza de ovejas, cerdos y toros, animales que cuida y alimenta diariamente con alfalfa. Siendo este producto que siembra en terrenos que alquiló. Durante el fin de semana vende los animales y comprar otros más jóvenes y a un bajo precio para engordarlos para luego ser ofertados a un precio mayor. Otros de los productos que siembra es el maíz, pues lo hace secar al sol para venderlos desgranados en la feria local de su zona, del mismo modo vende también alfalfa. Es así como trabaja para tener ganancias y cubrir las necesidades de su familia. El sueño de Rocío es tener una granja grande de animales menores y producir mayores  extensiones de terreno en alfalfa y maíz. Tiene amplia experiencia de trabajo solidario ya que es una de las socias antiguas de su banco comunal y tiene lecciones aprendidas que le han servido mucho en su vida diaria, es responsable en sus pagos porque considera que ser puntual te abre muchas puertas. En esta ocasión el dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de ovejas.
texts.en:
Rocío is from Sicaya and currently lives with her husband and four children in a house of her own.  She raises sheep, pigs and bulls, animals that she cares for and feeds alfalfa to, that she grows on leased lands, daily.  On weekends she sells the animals and buys younger ones at a lower price to fatten up and then sell at higher prices.  One of the other things she grows is corn that she has dry in the sun to sell hulled in a local market; she also sells alfalfa.  This is how she works to have profits to cover family’s needs.  Rocío’s dream is to have a larger farm and to grow larger expanses of alfalfa and corn.

She has quite a bit of experience working in solidarity groups because she’s one of the most longstanding members of her communal bank and she’s learned lessons that have helped her a lot in her daily life.  She’s responsible with her payments because she feels that being punctual opens up many doors.  On this occasion she will use the money she’s asking for to buy sheep.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is a married man with three children aged 20, 18 and 12 years old. He has been a farmer for over 10 years. He tills land in Banga, South Cotabato and grows rice and corn crops. Abraham earns about 4,500 PHP per month doing this farming. 

Abraham is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, Abraham hopes to earn more profit and to save more.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Dalias Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “DALIAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Elvira. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de mandiles, artesanías, venta de comida

La señora Elvira,  indica que es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora en la zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costra y venta de mandiles, los que viene trabajando hace siete años.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital (compra de telas) que adquirirá de la Ceja  y posteriormente a la elaboración lo venderá en la feria 16 de Julio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la amistad, el apoyo y en salud nos reflexiona.
texts.en:
The Dalias Communal Bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Community Center.  It is comprised of six members, and it is led by its Board of Directors.   Elvira is the head of the Board.  The members of the communal bank carry out various business activities like selling aprons, handicrafts, and selling food.

Elvira points out that she is working with Pro Mujer for the first time.  She joined the institution by invitation from a loan officer in the area.  She currently has a business making and selling aprons.  She has been doing this for seven years.

The loan she is requesting is to increase her capital (to buy fabric) that she will get in La Ceja.  She will later make the aprons, and she will sell them at the 16 de Julio market.

This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family.  She lives in a common-law-marriage, and she has two children.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Delis

texts.es: Delis  de 49 años vive en la ciudad de Cartagena   con su hijo de 14 años y su cónyuge; allí tiene un negocio donde vende mercancías en general, sus clientes son vecinos del barrio y trabajadores de diferentes empresas de la ciudad, a quienes les otorga  créditos por sus compras en plazos que con ellos pacta. Con su negocio ha logrado satisfacer todas sus necesidades básicas, especialmente en momentos en los cuales se ha requerido en su hogar. Delis quiere seguir creciendo y aumentar sus clientes, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para lograr compras oportunas,  con las cuales impactarlos, especialmente en las épocas de mayor repunte comercial, como la que se acerca, el mes del amor y de la amistad, donde todos acuden a ella,  para poder obsequiar a sus seres queridos detalles   con los que muestran su aprecio. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará sabanas, accesorios femeninos, perfumes vestido y calzado al por mayor, para ganar descuentos por las compras en  volumen y de contado
texts.en:
Delis is 49 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena with her husband and their 14-year-old son. She has a business where she sells general merchandise. Her customers consist of neighbors from the area and workers from different companies throughout the city. Delis extends credit to her customers and allows them to pay in installments based on the agreements she sets up with them. Through her business Delis has been able to satisfy all of her basic necessities, especially during times when her family needed her the most. She wants to continue growing and expanding her customer base, but her operating capital is insufficient for taking advantage of buying opportunities that could have a significant impact. As a result, she will miss out on seasons when she could see a spike in her sales, such as during the month of love and friendship (the Colombian equivalent of Valentine’s Day). During this time, loved ones exchange gifts as a way of showing their appreciation for one another.

For this reason Delis is applying for a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to purchase bed sheets, women’s accessories, perfumes, dresses, and shoes in bulk so that she can receive discounts for buying in volume and paying with cash.

loans.use: to purchase bed sheets, women’s accessories, perfumes, dresses, and shoes in bulk.

loans.name: Nooretet

texts.en:
Nooretet is 31 years old, married, and has two children. Her primary business is farming.  She has been in the sector for the past three years. She learned about KADET through other women registered in her area. 

This is her second loan with KADET LTD. She will use the money to buy farm supplies such as seedlings and fertilizer. She hopes to expand her farming operation and improve her family’s standard of living. She is an industrious woman who struggles to achieve more despite a shortage of resources.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies such as seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mercedes Giannine

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Picoaza  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.

En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 10, 9 y 8 años que  estudian en escuela. El marido es militar.
 
Ella para ganarse algo por su cuenta y para entretenerse se dedica al comercio, tiene un local en su casa en el cual vende granos como: arroz, azúcar, maní, lenteja, entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00 y nos cuenta que tiene muchos clientes, allí también vende tarjetas y realiza recargas telefónicas lo cual le deja ingresos extra, dice que esta es una forma de ganarse algo sin salir de su casa y estar al tanto de las necesidades de sus pequeños hijos. Tiene dos años con su negocio  y le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar arroz, azúcar, maní, lenteja entre otras cosas. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal, es la secretaria del banco y le gusta porque con los créditos ha logrado aumentar más su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un local en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
The communal bank Picoaza meets every 15 days in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo, an area known for its commercial activities, for the traditional celebrations of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the rich cultural history found in its mountains. 

Here lives Mercedes. She is 31 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children aged 10, 9, and 8 who study in school. Her husband is in the military. 

In order to earn something of her own and to entertain herself, she works in commerce. She has a shop in her home in which she sells grains such as rice, sugar, peanuts, lentils, and other things. She works every day from 8:00am until 6:00pm. She says she has many clients. She also sells phone cards and recharges phones, giving her extra income. She says that it’s a way to earn something without leaving her house and to tend to her young children’s needs. She has had this business for two years, and it’s gone very well. 
 
This loan is to buy rice, sugar, peanuts, lentils, and other things. She is the founder of the communal bank, and she is the secretary of the bank. She enjoys it because the loans have allowed her to further expand her business. 

Her dream is to have a store in the center of the city.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, peanuts, lentils, etc

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 39-year-old lady who is married and has one child. Her husband supports their family with profits from his work as a rice farmer. For the past three years, Evelyn has run a home-based store where she sells groceries. She started her business with the investment of her own small capital. 

Evelyn is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to purchase groceries such as soft drinks, bread, cooking oil, canned goods, shampoo, detergent and other items. Evelyn is confident that her loan will generate more income and that she’ll be able to provide her family with a better quality of life through her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as soft drinks, bread,cooking oil, and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Nonilona

texts.en:
Nonilona is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Nonilona has a shop where she sells snacks like rice cakes and hot cakes. She has had this business for ten years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy the ingredients to make more snacks for sale.
Nonilona has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Nonilona hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make snacks.

loans.name: Na's Group

texts.en:
Na, a 47-year-old married mother of two, is the leader of a group with five members. A farmer who has been growing rice and other crops for 27 years, she also sells khmer noodles and fried bananas for additional income.

Now requesting her first loan with VisionFund, Na wants to buy fertilizers and plant more rice. She hopes the loan will help to increase her crop yields and therefore earn her more income to expand her business, increase her savings and help to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and plant rice.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas district

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has five children, four of whom are in school. She also takes care of her father. Betty has a business selling second hand clothes. She has been in this business for seven years, and she works seven days a week. She also generates additional income through rental houses. Betty lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.  

Betty has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of used clothes.The main business challenges for Betty include transportation, ever increasing prices of used clothes, and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop and also to buy a delivery van to ease transportation.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Newlife Group

texts.en:
Keresencia is a 60 year old lady and she is a widow. She has 4 children ages 41, 37, 35, and 32 years. She also has 12 dependants who are her orphaned grandchildren.

Keresencia operates a vegetable stall at Nyika Growth Point. She has been in the business for 20 years. She buys her products from Harare and masvingo. She has two employees who work for her. The challenge she faces in the business is that her products have a cost that is high as she can not take advantage of bulk buying. In the next five years, she would like to have a shop with a refrigerator so that the vegetables do not perish due to high temperatures. With the profits from the business she will be able to take care of her ophaned grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, apples, cabbages, and oranges.

loans.name: Chrispo

texts.en:
Chrispo is 30 years old and married with one child who is almost four years old. To support his family, he sells animal drugs and animal feeds.  He has been in the business for three years and works with two employees. He also provides veterinary services for extra income.

Chrispo desires to expand his business in order to generate more income for his family.  He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy animal feeds.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds.

loans.name: Anna Noemi

texts.es:
Anna, solicita nuevamente un préstamo para surtir el inventario, comprando mercadería  como harinas, pastas, aceite, condimentos, galletas y dulces, esto mejorara su negocio, ya que surtirá de diversos productos para la atención de los clientes.
Ella considera que el trabajo con prestamos le ha traído mejoras en su negocio y en sus ventas.
texts.en: Anna is requesting another loan to increase her inventory by purchasing merchandise like flours, pasta, oil, condiments, cookies and sweets. This will improve her business because she will have a better variety of products in stock for her customers. She thinks that working with loans has brought improvements in her business and her sales.

loans.use: to buy flour, pasta, oil, condiments, cookies and candies.

loans.name: Jean

texts.fr:
Jean fait le commerce des habits en détail.  Il a 31 ans et il est marié avec 3 enfants de 2 à 11 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

C’est son troisième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour augmenter le capital de son commerce des habits.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’augmenter continuellement son capital en fin de satisfaire toutes les demandes de ses clients. Ceci lui permettra d’être grossiste dans les années à venir.
 Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en: Jean is a clothing outfit retailer. He is 31 years old and is married with 3 children, aged from 2 to 11, two of whom are in school. He completed 6 years of primary education. This is his third successive loan with ACB. He will use this loan to increase the stock of his clothing outfit business. His strategy for growing the business is to continually add to the stock in order to meet all the needs of his customers. This will allow him to become a wholesaler in the years to come. With the profits, he plans to educate his children in school.

loans.use: to increase the stock in his business selling outfits

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 39-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan. She is the mother of seven children.

Hanan makes floral arrangements and she works from her home.

Hanan is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to to purchase materials needed in her business such as flowers and glue. 

Hanan is looking to increase her customer base and open a shop for her products.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed in her business such as flowers and glue.

loans.name: Mwenda

texts.en:
Mwenda is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She is a farmer, a business she has done for three years. She also has three children. Mwenda was introduced to Milango by her friends. 

She is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy a cow. Mwenda faces the challenge of seasonal weather, especially during dry weather when there is little fodder for the animals, and some clients don't pay on time.

She looks forward to owning a milking farm and saving the extra income from this loan.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Samson's Group

texts.en:
Samson is a member of this group in Lugari District.  He is pictured here in a group of six One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 81 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Samson has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving seeds and fertilizer for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Samson is a reliable member of the community.  He is married with six children. Samson is 40 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 21 years to support his family.  In addition to this, Samson is very active in his community and is involved in the men's group and the savings group.  He described his harvest last year as good.  He hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and to continue the success he is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.							

The 2014 Long Rains season won’t be Samson’s first season with One Acre Fund.  He first joined One Acre Fund in 2012 and has continued working with One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, fertilizer and hybrid seeds. As an active member in his community, Samson also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he wants to help more farmers.  Samson plans to use the future profits from the harvest to send his children to school, and save for the future.  His life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because he has more farm training and has more farm group support.							

Samson and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco aged 36 years. He is married with 3 children aged between 3 and 9 years. 2 of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 8 years. Also his wife is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers and pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay workers.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is engaged in various businesses. She has been running a sari-sari store for more than two years. In addition to this, she also sells crude oil and gasoline. Emily is a mother of two children ages 10 and 3 years old. Her partner works hard as a driver to provide the needs of their children and give them a good education. With this, Emily is asking for a loan to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, sugar, salt, powdered chocolate drinks, juice, soft drinks and some drinking liquor. She will also buy crude oil and gasoline to sell. In this way, she and her husband were able to enhance their livelihood and improve their earnings for their children’s education.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, sugar, salt, powdered chocolate drinks, juice, soft drinks and some drinking liquor; crude oil and gasoline

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Madam Esther Martety\\\'s hot porridge is enjoyed by lots of people in her community. She commences business early in the morning and move from home to home. She always has her customers waiting hungrily for her. Due to the small sizes of her cooking pots and pans, she is not able to prepare in large quantities. If she were to do that her porridge will not go bad, everything will be bought before she returns home. She is therefore appealing to Kiva to grant her a loan of $700.00 to help her cook larger quantities.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline D. is 48-year-old widowed woman with 5 children. She lives in Yopougon, a township in north Abidjan. Jacqueline sells cereal in the Yopougnon open market. This activity is the main revenue source for her family. She heard about AE&I from her sister and got her first loan in January, 2005. She has reimbursed all microcredits she has gotten from AE&I since then without any problem. Jacqueline wants to purchase a stock of cereal (rice and maize) in bulk to benefit from lower prices and increase her retail sales margin.

loans.use: Jacqueline Djamble will use the loan to purchase stock of cereal.

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru:
Zarrina works as a nurse in the city hospital in Isfara. Her husband is always sick and cannot work. Zarrina is 42 years old and has 4 children. A nurse’s salary is small and in her free time Zarrina sells goods at the market. She has a small business and sells perfumes. She travels to Khudzhand once a week to purchase products. Despite the small size of the business Zarrina has many regular clients and makes good profits that contribute substantially to the family budget.

Zarrina has been working with MicroInvest for 6 months. She plans to use this loan to further expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Заррина работает медицинской сестрой в городской больнице города Исфара. Ее муж постоянно болеет и не имеет возможности работать. Заррине 42 года и у нее 4 несовершеннолетних сыновей. Заработная плата медсестры маленькая и в свободное от работы время Заррина выходит на базар торговать. У нее маленький бизнес и продает она парфюмерную продукцию. За товаром она ездит в Худжанд раз в неделю. Несмотря на маленький бизнес у нее много постоянных клиентов и прибыль остается хорошая. Это вносит существенный вклад в семейный бюджет. С Микроинвест Заррина работает в течении 6 месяцев. С помощью займа Заррина собирается и дальше развивать свой бизнес.

loans.use: to expand business

loans.name: Juju

texts.en: Juju is a 30 year old mother of two children aged 8 and 1. The first one is a girl and the last one is a boy. She collects and then sells waste and scrap materials together with her husband. It is the only source of their livelihood.  She usually earns $5 per day. She very much wants to receive a $50 loan so that she can earn more income for her children’s education. She is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To increase her capital

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa belongs to the ‘Sol Naciente’ Communal Bank located at 1085 John F. Kennedy, Jr. Ave. in the A.H. Nuevo Paraíso district of the city of Calleria within the state of Ucayali, Peru. She is 61 years old and is the mother of 7 children. Her husband is a carpenter but does not earn enough to support their family on his own. Because of this Rosa, with a loan from Manuela Ramos, began crafting mats from leftover wooden scraps to help supplement the family’s income. She runs her business from a small shop where she takes scraps of wood and creates the mats. Her husband and children also help. She wakes up at 6:00 a.m. to make breakfast and then begins working in the shop. Her children then take the mats to the markets in Lima to sell. With the $425 loan she is requesting, that will be repaid within 6 months, Rosa plans to purchase 8 bundles of wooden scraps, 6.6 lbs of nails and increase her work space. Rosita is very happy that her children are willing to help with her small business and hopes that they will help it grow becoming successful entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Sol Naciente, Del Jr. Jhon F. Kenedy 1085 del A. H. Nuevo Paraíso del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 61 años y es madre D. 7 hijos, su esposo es carpintero, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza, es así que Rosa, con el primer préstamo D. Manuela Ramos deciD. hacer esteras D. desperdicios D. madera. En la actualidad cuenta con un pequeño taller donD. teje esteras D. madera, la misma que atienD. conjuntamente con su esposo y sus hijos, se levantan a las 6.00 am. Para hacer el desayuno y después atienD. este taller, sus hijos también se dedican a este trabajo logrando entrar en el mercado D. la ciudad D. Lima. Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 1,200 (US$ 400.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 8 paquetes D. residuos D. madera (tripley), 3 kilos D. clavo y ampliará el local del negocio. Rosita esta muy contenta D. tener a sus hijos dispuestos a integrarse en este pequeño negocio y tiene la esperanza que ellos hagan crecer este negocio hasta ser grandes empresarios.

loans.use:
Purchase of leftover wooden scraps. Incraese work locale.

Compra de residuos de madera (tripley). Ampliación del local.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
This is 49 year-old Zainabu Luhoza. She runs a business selling gently used clothing in the rural town of Tangini, about 30km outside Dar es Salaam. She requires a loan of $900 to purchase additional stock, which she hopes will help her to increase her modest monthly profit of about $50. Zainabu is a widow and has two children, Kidawa, 15, and Zaima, 17. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation for women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of used clothing for sale

loans.name: Mahluqe

texts.ru:
Mahluqe M. was born in 1980 in Agsu Region. She is single, but plans to get married in a near future. Mahluqe has been farming animals for 5 years. She wants to use this loan to purchase a few cows.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Манафова Махлуге,родилась 1980 году Ахсуниском районе. Не замужем. Пять лет подряд занимается скотоводством. Собирается скоро выйти замуж. Она активно управляеть своим хозяеством. В этом году она обратилась в Нормикро Ахсуниский филиал,для получение кредита. Махлуге хочеть купить еще несколько коров.

loans.use: To buy a few cows

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Mrs. Erika is a member of community bank La Amistad 2, located on Jr Libertad #820, Calleria district, department of Ucayall. She is 24 years old, mother of a minor age girl, married, and her husband is a merchant. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos of 300 Soles (about USD $100) she invested in first aid medications.

She currently works in the sale of medicines, this requires that she get up early every morning to take care of her daughter and husband and then go out to sell medicines door to door.

With the loan of 1500 Soles (USD $525) which she will repay in 5 months, she will purchase different types of medications.

Erika feels very well and also has another reason for trying to get ahead and that is the pending arrival of her second child. She wants to give the new baby all the best and bring financial security for her family. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for all the support that she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Erika pertenece al Banco Comunal De La Amistad 2, ubicado en Jr. Libertada Nº 820, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 24 años, es madre de una hija menor de edad, es casada y su esposo es comerciante. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles decide invertir en medicinas para primeros auxilios.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de medicinas, para lo cual tiene que levantarse temprano para atender a su hija y esposo y luego salir a vender sus medicinas a domicilio.

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,500 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de diferentes tipos de medicinas .

Erika se siente muy bien, además tiene un motivo mas para seguir adelante y es la llegada de su segundo bebe, al cual desea brindarle lo mejor y darle estabilidad económica a su familia, además está muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo brindando.

loans.use: Purchase of different types of medications.

loans.name: Hidaya's Sharoom. Group

texts.en:
Hidaya N. is 25 years old and single. She owns a small food store, which she opened in 2006. She works every day from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $60.

Hidaya would like a loan of $275 to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who also has a food vending business.

loans.use: To buy mora food items for her grocery store

loans.name: Fajar

texts.id:
Everyday Fajar travels from Kuta to Gianyar by motorcycle to look for second-hand goods and wrecks . He gets the goods from his regular providers who have goods that they don't use anymore. He usually has to pay upfront for those goods. After getting the goods, Fajar comes home and his wife sorts the goods according to the types of the goods and then finally the goods are ready to be sold. Fajar hopes to get the loan to add more capital for buying the second-hand goods and he hopes he can earn more profit so that he can afford his family's living expenses.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Kegiatan Fajar setiap hari adalah berkeliling mencari barang bekas dan rongsokan dengan menggunakan sepeda motor mulai dari Kuta sampai Gianyar. Biasanya barang diambil langsung dari langganannya yang sudah menyiapkan barang-barang bekas dan rongsokan yang sudah tidak terpakai lagi dan biasanya sudah dibayar terlebih dahulu. Setelah mendapatkan barang bekas, Fajar kemudian mengantarnya kerumah dimana istrinya Nanik sudah siap untuk menyortir dan memilah barang-barang bekas itu sesuai dengan jenisnya, dan setelah itu siap untuk dijual. Fajar sangat mengharapkan bantuan kali ini untuk dijadikan modal usaha membeli barang-barang bekas dan berharap keuntungan yang didapat setelah mendapatkan pinjaman kali ini lebih besar sehingga bisa mencukupi kebutuhan keluarga.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
K. Nasiba has been an organized and reliable client of MicroInvest since 2008. She first applied to MicroInvest when she heard about the open and moderate loan procedure.

Mrs. K. Nasiba makes yarn and warm yarn socks that she trades in the local bazaar. She is five years of experience in business of the yarn-making business. She is 33 year old, married, and has 5 children. She is eager to work to ensure a good future for her children. She does not have special or higher education, so she works very hard to provide a fine education for her children.

Mrs. K. Nasiba is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of 2100 STJ ($625 USD) for 8 months to develop her business.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of costume jewelry to add to a business of selling women's clothing.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is 42 years old and married with three children. Two of them are in school. She is so grateful to Sinapi for giving her a loan which saved her marriage since, before, her husband saw her to be a burden on him. She used the previous loan to start selling cooked rice for schools and children and other workers in her town. This enabled her to save to help her husband in paying the children’s school fees.

Afia wants to add to her rice business the selling of spring rolls which she says customers want for breakfast. She therefore wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice and flour, vegetables, eggs and assorted meat to expand her operation. She is a member of the group called Confidence. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, flour, vegetables, eggs, and assorted meat to expand her operation

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia has several businesses. She sells chica de jora (a corn-based drink) every day in her home. However, two years ago Florencia was very ill and a friend recommended some Chinese medicines. She tried them and they worked very well which is why now she sells them and shares information about them. Also, Florencia sells homemade desserts outside her home every afternoon. Before, she distributed bread, but she quit doing that because she was having to walk a great deal.

She has used the loans that she has requested to invest in the businesses that she has to increase business capital. Florence would like to be able to work full time selling and promoting the Chinese medicinal products that she offers.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Florencia tiene varios negocios. Ella vende chicha de jora (bebida a base de maíz) todos los días en su casa. Sin embargo, hace 2 años Florencia estuvo muy enferma, por lo que un amigo le recomendó unas medicinas chinas. Ella las probó y le funcionó muy bien, por lo que ahora se dedica a venderlas y hacerlas conocidas. Igualmente, Florencia vende postres caseros afuera de su casa, todas las tardes. Antes, ella repartía pan, pero dejó esta actividad debido a que tenía que caminar mucho. Los préstamos solicitados los ha utilizado para invertir en los negocios que tiene y para hacerse de un capital. A Florencia le gustaría poder dedicarse a tiempo completo a las ventas y promoción de los productos medicinales chinos que ofrece.

loans.use: Invest in different businesses to increase business capital.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
hola mi nombre es Ramona A. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo 61 años  de edad, tengo una pulperia ubicada en la colonia nueva Suyapa, mi negocio es mi unica fuente de ingresos para sustentar mi familia y con la cual hemos logrado sacar adelante nuestro hogar, tengo la ayuda de mi esposo para nuestos gastos. estoy solicitando ayuda monetaria para poder surtir mas mi negocio ya que las exigencias de mis clientes son muchas y quiero que todos queden satisfechos con nuestro negocio, mis clientes me escogen a mi por la atencion que les brindo, ya que para mi, todos mis clientes son especiales y todos merecen ser bien tratados.
bueno espero que se me de la ayuda para poder salir adelante. gracias
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Ramona A.. I make my living selling popular foodstuffs. I am 61 years old and have a local store in the new neighborhood Suyapa. My business is my only income source to sustain my family, and with it we have succeeded in getting our family ahead with my husband's help with the expenses. I am asking for monetary help in order to better supply my business, since the needs of my clients are varied and I want to be able to satisfy everybody in our store. My clients come to me because of the attention I give them, since to me, every client is special and all deserve to be well-treated. Well, I hope that you will give me the help to get ahead. Thanks.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products to supply her local store

loans.name: Agash

texts.en: Agash A. is 51 years old, married, and has four sons. His wife is a housekeeper, while Agash earns income as a market vendor. For the past 15 years, he has been selling men's shoes in the local market. By now, Agash has gained a lot of experience, and his business has been doing well. He has many loyal customers, since Agash makes an effort to satisfy the needs of people with different tastes and income levels. Agash works very hard to be able to give his children a good education. Currently, he would like to increase his working capital in order to purchase new winter shoes for sale. Therefore, Agash is requesting a loan of US$1,200 for a term of 15 months. He promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks everyone for supporting him.

loans.use: Purchase of new winter shoes for sale

loans.name: Eang

texts.en:
Mrs. Eang Y. is a villager in Chrouy Dang village in Kandal Province. She is a fruit seller as a way to earn her living. She faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to support her business. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy some fruit to add to her business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

Her husband, Mr. Sacnh Mao, is a blacksmith who earns only a very small salary. Mrs. Eang Y. is 39 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are attending the local school while the other two children are too young to work or study. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy some fruit to expand her business

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema M. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur and a married woman. She has run a shop and café at Makangarawe (BUZA) Ward for 3 years. She purchases the items from the various wholesale shops and then sells them to customers. She supports her family life with the business, including paying her children's school fees. She requests a loan of Tsh800,000 to meet her business demand.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma P., 42, lives with her husband Martin in Barangay Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She has been a member of Everlasting Center for eight years.  During this time, she has borrowed money from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative. Emma manages a fishing business. She has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase additional fishing nets and to buy a pumpboat.  Recently, the couple has been running two pumpboats and they can earn about PHP 700 daily.  Aside from having a fishing business, they also have a piggery to provide additional income. Mrs. P. says it is good to have dual businesses but you have to make sure that you handle them with much care. The success of her business lies in your hands, she added. 

Mrs. P.'s hopes are 1) to provide her children with a good education, 2) that the piggery will succeed, and 3) that their fishing business will flourish.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing nets and a pumpboat

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati I. is married and has 3 children. She has received no formal education. Fati makes and sells a variety of cooking oil at Mpoben in Elmina, which she has done since 1990. Her husband is a carpenter.

Fati uses her income to help her husband in paying rent, utility bills, and other basic expenses of the family. Fati will use the loan to increase her capital to buy more ingredients for the making of the cooking oil she sells. With the new profits from her expanded business, Fati plans to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: to increase her capital to buy more ingredients for making oil

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana E., 28, is married with 2 children. She has 4 years of experience in the business of planting and selling vegetables. She sells to the village people and general public 2 days per week.

Hana has no previous loans with Kiva partner SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~104 USD). SPBD loans are Hana’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Her loan will focus on her business only. She will purchase seeds for vegetables such as tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbages, and lettuce. She will also buy fertilizer, insect killer, cromozone, and other chemicals, along with some equipment for planting.

loans.use: Purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers, chemicals, and planting equipment

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa M. is a 41-year-old mother of five who is separated from her husband, but not legally divorced.  She has a live-in partner who has two children; he is a part-time fisherman and also is a butcher.

Elisa is requesting this loan in order to get the capital to start a business selling prepared food, such as roasted meat, and fish.  She plans to sell the fish and the food she makes to people in her neighborhood.

Elisa hopes to put the profits from her new business towards house repairs, and to pay for her children's school expenses.

loans.use: To purchase fish, meat, hotdogs and rice for vending.

loans.name: Kalala Falefia

texts.en: Kalala Falefia, 54, is married with five children.  She has four years of experience in the Sewing business. She sells to the village people and the public five days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Kalala Falefia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy fabric and materials for her sewing business.

loans.name: Matalena

texts.en: Matalena M. is twenty-five years old and single with no children. She has many years of experience in the fishing business. She sells to the village people and the general public three days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD, a Kiva field partner.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be about $120.  SPBD loans are Matalena’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy goggles, spears, a torch and a cooler to store the fish.

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
Eulogia es socia del Banco Comunal San Miguel de Ayacucho.
Eulogia es casada, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Eulogia junto a su esposo se dedica a la agricultura de verduras que luego transporta y vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Eulogia necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de abono y semilla.
Eulogia sueña con educar a sus hijos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Eulogia is a member of the San Miguel de Ayacucho Microfinance Institute.

Eulogia is a 31-year-old married mother of 2. She and her husband grow vegetables, which they then transport to the city of Ayacucho’s wholesale market to be sold.

Eulogia needs a 900.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing seeds and fertilizer.

Eulogia dreams of providing her children with an education and of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Felipa Eufemia

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Felipa R. se dedica a su actividad de venta de carbón el cual comercializa con mucho entusiasmo en su propio tramo donde atiende a sus clientes.

Ella se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora especialmente porque dedica mucho tiempo a su labor iniciando todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana. Hoy en día ella ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra del carbón y así salir adelante en su negocio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Felipa Rodriguez sells charcoal in Mayoreo Market in the city of Managua, where, in her own section, she tends to her clients with much enthusiasm. She characterizes herself as a very hard-working person, especially because she dedicates a lot of time to her job, starting each day at very early hours. Currently, she is requesting a loan in Ceprodel for the purchase of charcoal and thus advance her business in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa es artesana, teje manualmente guantes de lana de oveja y alpaca que  comercializa en la feria artesanal de la Ciudad  de La Paz, el esposo es empleado publico y trabaja en la policía. Tienen 2 hijos que dependen de la pareja tiene su casa propia ubicada en la Zona Villa Progreso de la ciudad de El Alto. 

El crédito lo destinará para comprar material de construcción, ya que le falta concluir un cuarto que le servirá a uno de sus hijos.
 
Es el tercer crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Felipa is a craftswoman. She knits by hand gloves made from sheep’s wool and alpaca. She sells them in the handicraft fair in the city of La Paz. Her husband is a public employee, and he works for the police. They have two dependent children. She has her own house, which is located in the Villa Progreso zone in the city of El Alto. The loan is to buy construction material since they have not finished one of the children’s rooms. This is her third loan with Impro. Her good payment history qualifies her for the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cement, stucco, and sand to finish construction on a room for one of her children

loans.name: Konyo

texts.en:
Konyo J., currently in the business of selling beans and paste, is requesting a loan to purchase groundnut to make more paste for sale. Thirty years old and married to a driver, Konyo has two children, both of whom attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy land and build a rental shop

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase groundnut to make more paste for sale.

loans.name: Hamis Said

texts.en: Hamis Said S. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur and a married man. He runs a retail shop from which he sells various items including electronic items, bags and school bags, and other business goods at Yombo Vituka ward in Dar es Salaam. He purchases the business goods from the wholesalers and retail shops at Kariakoo city shopping center and sells retail to customers at Vituka. He has been in the business for six years. Business income is used to meet his family's daily demands and for capitalizing the business. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,400,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: So

texts.en:
So O. currently makes rattan furniture. She is 55 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom province, located about 200 km from the capital, Phnom Penh. She has two children: one is married and one is single.

So O. saves up over 10 sets of rattan and then sells them to her customers for profit. Generally, her valued clients need to order a few days or a week in advance. Her husband helps her transport the finished products directly to customers' houses. Recently, So O. has run out of raw materials from her stock supply, so she would like a Kiva loan in order to buy additional rattans to better meet her furniture orders.

loans.use: To buy additional rattans

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
Rubelyn sacrifices a lot for the welfare of her child. She is 31 years old and intent on raising her child. She has two children but their elder is living with her parents since she could not support all their needs.

Rubelyn is engaged in the vending business. She sells different products like snacks and vegetables and other commodities that she can sell in order to earn a living. Her difficulties in life gave her the idea to take out a loan from Kiva lenders in the amount of PHP 5,000 that she can use as additional capital. This will give her the opportunity to improve her business.

Rubelyn is also planning to start a small poultry business in order to have another source of income aside from vending. She is not losing hope because she believes that thanks to the lenders, she can achieve her goals and provide the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Joeboy

texts.en:
“Joey” short for Joeboy is already 25 years old yet he is still single at present. After finishing his Secondary level of education, Joey decided to stop his studies and rather indulged himself into transportation business to help his parents in sending his other sisters and brothers in school. They are 12 in the family and life is too difficult for them. He is hoping that someday he could uplift their living condition out from poverty.

Joey is engage in transportation business where he operates his own passenger tricycle via Tumauini to Cabagan and vice versa. He would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP5,000 to have fund in purchasing wheels and other needed parts for his motorcycle need. He hopes to avail the loan for the maintenance of his passenger tricycle. His purpose to earn income is to help his parents in sustaining their needs in the family especially his sisters and brothers who are still studying.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en: Lucita P. is from the village of Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old, is married, and has seven adult children. Lucita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2003, Lucita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Lucita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 11th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth es una socia trabajadora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa,  región de Ucayali tiene 52 años, madre de dos hijos mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de madera en tablas y a la venta de repuestos de carros, este negocio lo realiza junto  con su esposo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valientes” desde hace dos años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que utilizó en la compra de productos para la venta de comida, pues anteriormente vendía comida en su casa, en la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado en la compra de repuestos y accesorios para autos. La meta de Elizabeth es tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hard-working and dynamic group member. She lives in Pucallpa, a city in Ucayali. She is 52 years old and the mother of two older children. She runs a lumber and car part business together with her husband. She has been a part of the village bank "Mujeres Valientes" or Brave Women for the last two years. The first loan she received was for 300 soles. She used it to buy products for a food business because previously she sold food from her home. Now, she needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy parts and other car accessories. Elizabeth's goal is to own a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy parts and car accessories.

loans.name: Pon

texts.en:
Mr. Pon P., 56, and his wife, Mrs. Yorn Horn, 52, were married in 1988 and have five  children - four sons, one a construction worker, another a farmer and another a student. One daughter stays at home. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Pon and his wife have been fishing and farming for over 20 years. Because the house where they live is small and old, Pon is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase wooden materials to make it stronger.

loans.use: To purchase wooden materials for renovating the house.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia.
Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir como camisas, polos, pantalones, etc.; los cuales produce al por mayor, pues junto a su esposo implementaron su taller y contrataron a 2 personas para lograr abastecerse con la producción. Mientras su esposo cose y corta, Rosa se dedica al planchado y a los acabados de las prendas para posteriormente entregarlas a las personas que les hicieron el pedido.
Rosa y su esposo se encuentran muy contentos porque obtienen buenos ingresos, es por ello que están pensando en agrandar su negocio, comprando más maquinaria que les facilite el trabajo.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Rosa con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más tela (al por mayor) para aumentar la producción de sus prendas y así obtener mayores ingresos para su familia y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is 37 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband and children.

For two years, Rosa has been producing articles of clothing such as blouses, polo shirts, trousers, etc. She manufactures these items in large quantities. Her husband helped with establishing her workshop and they hired two employees to help with the production. While her husband sews and cuts, Rosa is responsible for ironing the finished garments and delivering them to the customer. Rosa and her husband are very happy that they are able to generate a good income, which is why they are planning to expand their business. They will purchase additional machinery to facilitate their work.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Rosa has always been known to be timely in making her payments. The money she requested will be used to purchase fabric in bulk so that she can increase the production of garments, obtain better earnings for her family, and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Noel Ernesto

texts.es: Noel Ernesto  tiene la edad de 49 años, vive en su casa de habitación con su esposa.  Tiene 2 hijos y solamente 1  está a su cargo.  Su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que inicio ofreciendo la venta de productos básicos como arroz, azúcar, aceite y frijoles. Ya que su negocio fue una alternativa de ingresos necesarios para su familia. Por lo que el principal negocio de Noel es satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes ofreciéndoles lo que ellos solicitan. Es así como recurre a Fundación León 2000 ya que por medio ella las organizaciones amigas dan el apoyo necesario y solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, gaseosas, bisutería y leche en bolsa. El deseo de Noel es convertir su negocio en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Noel Ernesto is 49 years old. He lives in his home with his wife. He has two children and only one of them is dependent upon him. His economic activity is a general store. He has been working in this business for more than 15 years. He started selling basic products, such as rice, sugar, oil and beans. His business was needed to offer a necessary alternative income to his family. Noel's main business is to satisfy the needs of his customers offering them whatever they require. This is why he applies to Fundación León 2000 and through it its sister organizations for the support he needs, and he asks for a loan for working capital to purchase basic grains, candy, soft drinks, soda pops, costume jewellery and bags of milk. Noel's wish is to turn his store into a wholesaling business.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, candy, soft drinks, soda pops, costume jewellery and bags of milk

loans.name: Julio Cesar
