texts.es: Julio Cesa tiene 57 años de edad. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Tiene 19 años de dedicarse a este negocio. Por lo que inicio con sacos vacios propios y con un poco capital que tenía por lo que así fue que su negocio incremento en cierto momento. Su actividad económica es la venta de sacos vacios y envases plásticos. Por lo que son muy útiles ya que la mayoría de las personas los ocupa para guardar maíz, frijoles, arroz, entre otros productos y le gusta mucho su trabajo.  El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima  ya que últimamente tiene mucha demanda. El sueño de él ha sido terminar de construir su vivienda para él y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is 57 years old. He takes care of his 3 children. He has been in the business for 19 years. He started his business with his own empty bags and a little capital he had and it started to grow. His business is the sale of empty bags and plastic containers. These are very useful since most people use them to store corn, rice, beans and other products. He really enjoys his work. The goal of this loan is to provide working capital for the purchase of inventory since demand has increased lately. His dream is to finish a house for him and his children.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline I. has a restaurant where she sells mouth watering Nigerian cooked foods and drinks. She is happy because she has a new recipe that her customers love and this has helped retain her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She is 52 years-old and widowed with six children. Some of her children are already in university. Her husband died some years back and since then she has been taking care of her children all by herself. She hopes to see her business expand and attract more customers. She is seeking a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more ingredients to cook and drinks to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita, 38, is a pig grower. She has one child. She wants to grow her small piggery. In that way, she will be able to provide the basic needs for her family.

She would like to apply for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to buy feed and hog supplements.

loans.use: Feeds

loans.name: Virtues Women Group

texts.en:
Here are small scale local entrepreneurs from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. These women have come to SMT, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone, to seek a loan of SLL 2,000,000 in order to expand their businesses, make better sales and consequently improving on their standard of living.  

Marie J., second from right, is the leader of this group. She is 43 years old and married to a building contractor, and they have three children. For ten years, Marie has been selling cooked rice, vegetables and meat. With her share of the loan, she will buy cooking ingredients, such as rice, fish, meat, etc., in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients, such as rice, fish and meat

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a 30-year-old single lady who has been selling clothes for the last three years. She is also employed in an insurance agency. She started the business after she took out a loan from Faulu Kenya, which she used as capital for the new business. She has requested a loan of Kes. 30,000 to buy more clothes for resale. She hopes to open a shop for rental in the future. She dreams of creating employment for many people. She describes herself as a hard-working lady.

loans.use: To buy new clothes for sale

loans.name: Mapendo Group

texts.fr:
Mwanaidi K. est présidente du groupe de crédit Mapendo, elle lève la main sur la photo , cliente au 13e  cycle de credit,agée de 42 ans, divorcée.Elle est mère de  10 enfants  parmi lesquels   6   vont à l’école et 4 autres n’étudient  pas par manque des frais scolaires.Notons  qu’elle supporte seule la charge de ses enfants car son mari l’a complètement abandonné.
Elle a commencé son petit commerce avec son fonds propre Reçu de son mari avant leur divorce. Son Busines est de fournir  des poules aux hotels, snack bars  et restaurants  de la ville. il y a 23 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité de vente des poules. Avec  le crédit de  l’IMF Hekima, Elle souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en achetant   45 poules. Dans l’avenir, elle planifie de varier et de développer d’autres  d’activités en s’approvisionnant dans de grands centres  commerciaux comme Dubai, Kampala, etc.
Elle rémércie l’IMF Hekima pour  les crédits  qu’elle recoit sans aucune garantie materielle car grace a ces credits elle parvient a subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
Ce groupe est  composé des 14 membres. Il sied d'indiquer sur la ptoto 7 femmes sont debout et  7 hommes sont assis.
texts.en:
Mwanaidi K. is president of the Mapendo credit loan group, now in their 13th loan cycle. She is the one raising her hand on the picture. She is 42 years old, divorced, and mother of ten children, of which six are still going to school, and four no longer attend due to lack of resources for school costs. She is the sole support for her children as her husband has completely abandoned her. She started her small business with her own funds, received from her husband before the divorce. For the past 23 years, she has been selling chickens to hotels, snack bars and restaurants in town. With the credit loan from Hekima MFI, she would like to increase her turnover by purchasing 45 chickens. In the future she plans to diversify and develop other activities by getting supplies in large commercial centres such as Dubai, Kampala, etc. She thanks Hekima for the credit loans she has been granted without having any collateral, because they have allowed her to take care of her children’s needs. This group is made up of 14 members. On the picture, there are seven standing women, and seven men who are crouching.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 45 chickens

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 44 years old and married to Patrick Mutisya.  She has been selling fruits and vegetables to her clients in small quantities in the town of Naivasha since 2005.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the cash to build a kiosk from where she can operate her green grocery business.

In future, Jane's dream is to have a big grocery shop that will serve many people that stocks a variety of products that will enable her to satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: Build a kiosk.

loans.name: Suraiya's Group

texts.en:
Suraiya, 40-years old and married with four children, three sons and one daughter, is a simple and honest woman. She is a resident of Lahore, Pakistan, a city famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. Her elder son has a clothes-sewing business whereby he stitches gents' clothes. The other sons work in a local factory on a monthly wage, while her 17-year-old daughter reads in 9th standard. She is an intelligent girl and wants to get a good education.

Suraiya’s husband, M. R., is a milk seller by profession. He purchases the milk from the milk shops and sells to the community, a business he has been involved in for over 15 years. Suraiya is applying for a loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan) to purchase a buffalo so they can start selling milk from their own buffalo and earn a good profit.

loans.use: Purchase a buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fruits (bananas, watermelons and cherries) to sell

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is divorced. She lives in Kherson, southern Ukraine, with her daughter and a disabled son. She sells women’s outer clothing in one of the local markets called Dneprovskyi. The location of her vending kiosk is very favorable as it’s in a busy place.

Valentina has been in this trade for fifteen years and has proven to be an honest and communicative businesswoman. Presently, she has about 30,000 UAH worth of inventory. Her net income is about 5,000 UAH per month.

Valentina would like to borrow 14,700 UAH to increase the variety of inventory in her kiosk and to keep her business running successfully this summer season. She believes that the loan will assist her in her entrepreneurial endeavors and help her to succeed.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of her merchandise

loans.name: Rita Mercedes

texts.es: Rita Mercedes tiene 59 años, junto a su familia comparte un negocio. Que es la venta de ropa y cosméticos. Hace más de 8 años que tiene esta actividad y que ha ayudado para que todos sigan adelante. Sus compras las realiza en diferentes lugares pues todos los días viaja a diferentes comarcas y lugares para ofrecer sus productos, sabe que hay ciertos lugares donde venden ropa de buena calidad, y ella ofrece eso a sus clientes, ropa de buena calidad para que ellos y ellas estén satisfechos. Por lo que siempre está haciendo un esfuerzo por mejorar. El financiamiento es para la compra de ropa de vestir, pantalones faldas, vestidos y otras cosas.
texts.en:
Rita Mercedes, 59, operates a family business selling clothing and cosmetics. She has operated the business for 8 years and it has helped her to pull herself up by her bootstraps. She sells in different places, travelling around from day to day to different parts of town to sell her products. She knows the places where she can sell clothes of good quality so she goes there to meet her customers. She works hard to improve the business all the time. She will use this loan to buy pants, skirts, dresses and other clothing that she will then resell to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new women's clothing to sell

loans.name: Batdelger

texts.en:
Batdelger S., 49, is married, and is the father of two daughters. He and his family live together in a house, which they own, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His oldest daughter, Battsetseg, attends a local university and his younger daughter, Bat-Otgon, attends a local secondary school. His wife, Otgonchimeg, is unemployed.

Batdelger has been successfully operating his business, a small car repair business that they started in 1992. At first, the couple rented a small tire repair shop, but after a year of successful business operation, he managed to build the garage and expand his services.

Batdelger and his family have been planning to grow their business in the future. Batdelger is a helpful person with a good personality. He says, “My dream is one day to change my repair place into a large and warm auto repair service.” He is requesting a 1,600,000 tugrug loan to purchase more equipment.

loans.use: To purchase more equipment for his repair shop

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher D. is from the village of Carikkikan Norte. He is 35 years-old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Christopher owns and operates a business raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes  from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Christopher has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 40,000 PHP during harvest season.

In 2010, Christopher joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Christopher has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Christopher is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Christopher from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es:
Moisés, de 39 años de edad, es soltero y tiene dos hijos en etapa escolar. Cuenta con un techo propio y está ubicada en una localidad de la selva central llamada “Santa Rosa”. Moisés se caracteriza por ser un hombre seguro de sí mismo, se dedica en la producción y comercialización de cacao, fruto que tiene mucha demanda en su localidad, además el buen servicio que brinda le ha hecho ganarse la preferencia de sus clientes. Actualmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en temporada de cultivo y cosecha necesita de sus peones para que de esa manera agilicen con la extracción de producto final y de ese modo pueda vender en los centros de acopio de su localidad y a un precio razonable. Sus planes a futuro es adquirir nuevos terrenos para el cultivo, con la finalidad de aumentar su productividad y a la vez mejorar sus ingresos considerablemente. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus obligaciones de pago, además está conforme por el buen andamiaje de su banco comunal.
Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de cacao de otros productores, con la finalidad de lograr vender en cantidad y por ende aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Moisés, 39 years old, is single and has got 2 school-aged children. He has got his own home, which is located in the region of the central jungle called "Santa Rosa." Moisés is characterized for being a self-assured man. He works in the production and commercialization of cacao, a highly demanded fruit in his region. In addition, his clients prefer his business because of the good customer service that he provides. Currently, he works for himself but during cultivation and harvest season, he needs his laborers in order to speed up the final production so that he can sell it to the distribution centers in his area and at a reasonable price. His future plans are to acquire new cultivation terrains, with the finality of increasing his productivity and at the same time improving his earnings considerably. This is his fifth credit with MFP, and he promises to continue to fulfill his payment obligations. In addition, he agrees with the framework of his communal bank. With the credit that he is seeking, he plans to invest it in the purchase of other cacao products, with the end result of selling it in bulk and thus increasing his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase other cacao products in order to increase his earnings.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose T. is currently in the business of selling exercise books, text books, pens, etc. in a book shop and is requesting a loan to stock boxes of chalk, more exercise books, and boxes of pencils to sell.  Rose is 37 years old and is married with a husband that is a pastor. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a permanent house.

loans.use: Stock boxes of chalks, more exercise books and boxes of pencils to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy M. is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing.

Nancy has been operating a tailoring business for the last ten years. She sells her wares from her home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenges are competition and seasonality.

Nancy wishes to work with Yehu so she will have access to its loans and improve her business. With 30,000 KES she wants to purchase more cloth. She hopes to own a shop in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth

loans.name: Gibson

texts.en:
Gibson W. is a 28-year-old gentleman who is married with one child who is five years old.

Gibson runs a butchery in Thika town and he has been doing this for the last two years. He is able to take home a profit of about Kshs 9,400 every month.

Gibson is a new client at KADET and he has applied for his first loan which he will use to buy more cows for slaughter, thus adding more stock to his butcher shop.

Gibson hopes that his business will go well and that, in the future, he will be able to open more branches as well as buy a plot on which he will build rental houses. Thus he will increase his income and improve his family upkeep.

loans.use: To buy more cows for slaughter, thus adding stock to his butcher shop

loans.name: Veronica Margarita

texts.es:
Verónica tiene 33 años, reside en Santiago de María, departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposo y su hija de 7 años; se dedica a la venta de tortillas y pupusas desde hace un año, el horario de atención es de once de la mañana hasta las ocho y treinta de la noche, este negocio fue iniciativa propia siempre viendo la forma de ayudar con los gastos de la casa.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de Maíz, Chicharrón, quesillo, repollo, aceite, que son los materiales para preparar las pupusas y las tortillas. Para ella este préstamo es muy útil pues quiere contar con suficientes productos para realizar más venta y atender a muchos clientes y solo de esta manera ella los puede adquirir ya que no cuenta con los suficientes recursos.
Las proyecciones de Verónica es crecer con las ventas, clientes y aumentar sus ingresos para ir solventando las dificultades económicas de su familia y mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Verónica tiene 33 años, reside en Santiago de María, departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposo y su hija de 7 años; se dedica a la venta de tortillas y pupusas desde hace un año, el horario de atención es de once de la mañana hasta las ocho y treinta de la noche, este negocio fue iniciativa propia siempre viendo la forma de ayudar con los gastos de la casa.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de Maíz, Chicharrón, quesillo, repollo, aceite, que son los materiales para preparar las pupusas y las tortillas. Para ella este préstamo es muy útil pues quiere contar con suficientes productos para realizar más venta y atender a muchos clientes y solo de esta manera ella los puede adquirir ya que no cuenta con los suficientes recursos.
Las proyecciones de Verónica es crecer con las ventas, clientes y aumentar sus ingresos para ir solventando las dificultades económicas de su familia y mejorar la calidad de vida.

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Gaburira Bakyara Twetungure, Ntungamo Group

texts.en:
Hard-work and the social nature of A. Herode has seen him operate a thriving business handling an alcohol and soda sales business in Ikona, Ntungamo. The married, father of 4 children has been running this business for the past 15 years and earns 300,000 Ugandan shillings a week. 
His current setback is having little capital to purchase business inputs including stock of beers and soft drinks. This loan will help him to revive his business in terms of expansion and will also enable him to earn more revenue for his family's needs and his children's education.

He belongs to Gaburira Bakyara Twetungure group which insures and hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more stock

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta M. is from the village of Lapasan Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Julieta is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Julieta owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing repair services to local community members. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Julieta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Julieta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Sonia Laura

texts.es:
Sonia de 33 años, tiene una tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive con su esposa (aparece en la foto) y 4 hijos  en un cantón llamado Playas (Posorja) uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos.  

Hace 2 años por el sector donde vivía no existía ninguna tienda de víveres fue por ello que decidió tener la primera tienda del sector para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su familia. Comenzó a vender arroz, azúcar, aceite, granos en la ventana de su casa  poco a poco surtió sus víveres. En la actualidad tiene su tienda de víveres y trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm vendiendo arroz, enlatados, bebidas, granos, legumbres, frutas etc. Para seguir con el negocio y surtir más su tienda él quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, legumbres, enlatados. 

Sus sueño para el futuro es que quiere que su tienda este mas surtida y grande, y darle una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sonia is 33 years old.  She has a grocery store in the front of her home.  She lives with her husband (who appears in the photo) and their 4 children in Playas (Posorja) canton, one of Ecuador's tourist destinations which is noted for its large variety of seafood.

Two years ago there was no grocery store in the area where she lives, so she decided to have the first store in the area so that she could help her husband with their family expenses.  She began selling rice, sugar, oil and grains from the window of her house and little by little stocked her store with groceries.  She currently has a grocery store and works there from 8.00am to 8.00pm selling rice, canned goods, drinks, grains, vegetables and fruit, etc.  To continue with her business and better stock her store she would like to use her loan to buy rice, vegetables and canned goods.

Her dream for the future is for her store to be bigger and better stocked.  She also dreams of getting her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy rice, vegetables and canned goods

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella F. is from the village of Santa Felomena, Iligan City. She is 36 years old. Stella is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Stella owns & operates a business venture in the food sector butchering and selling meat in the market. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from butchering & selling pork in the market. Stella has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Stella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Stella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional pigs to be butchered. Stella is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business, for example in making and selling home-made sausage. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Stella from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business, e.g.,  making and selling home-made sausage

location.town: Santa Felomena, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Jesucito Group

texts.es:
Lorenza participa en la Alcancía Comunal “JESUCITO” como tesorera hace 8 meses y está conformada por 7 integrantes.
Lorenza se dedica a la crianza y venta de cuyes hace 10 años junto con sus padres que además se dedican a la agricultura en un anexo de la zona donde vive y para ir a aquel lugar deben caminar por el lapso de una hora viajar en burro o en auto pero estos no van  frecuentemente. En sus chacras siembran y cosechan Alfalfa. Lo cual comercializan y además alimenta a sus cuyes. Con su esfuerzo y el de su esposo que trabaja en construcción civil ha logrado realizar mejoras en su vivienda y adquirir algunos electrodomésticos, Lorenza es una persona que no le gusta derrochar el dinero o hacer gastos innecesarios ella prefiere el ahorro, nos manifiesta que si tuviera más dinero lo invertiría en su vivienda y para su negocio. Su préstamo será invertido en su vivienda junto con las ganancias de su negocio.
Lorenza y las integrantes de su alcancía Comunal son personas alegres y están muy contentas de pertenecer al programa prosperidad y están cumpliendo en sus pagos para seguir contando con su prestamos.
texts.en:
Lorenza has participated in the "Jesucito" borrower group as treasurer for 8 months.  The group consists of 7 members.

Lorenza has been engaged in raising guinea pigs for sale for 10 years along with her parents who are also engaged in agriculture in an annex next to where she lives.  In order to go there they must walk for an hour or travel by car or donkey, but these do not come frequently.  They plant and harvest alfalfa in their fields, which they sell in commercial markets and also use to feed her guinea pigs. 

Through her efforts and her husband's work in construction, she has made major improvements in her home and has bought some appliances.  Lorenza is a person who does not like wasting money or making unnecessary expenditures.  She prefers saving she tells us if she had more money that she would invest it in her home and her business. 

Lorenza and the members of her group are happy people and are very glad to belong to the Prosperity program and are making their payments in order to continue the loan.

loans.use: materials for improving her home and business

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, quartier Banankabougou, sous préfecture de Fana; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens d’amitié et font le commerce d’habillements, de légumes et du miel.                                                                                    
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire. 
DJENEBA G. s’approvisionne en habits avec les grossistes de Bamako presque mensuellement. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement à domicile et au marché pendant les jours de foires au comptant, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group Djekafo are all married and average 40 years of age and five children living in traditional extended families in Fana City in the Banankabougou district, Fana sub-prefecture, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members know one another through ties of friendship, and they do commerce in clothing, vegetables, and honey. The group members are now on their 10th solidarity loan.

Ms. DJENEBA G. gets her supplies of clothing from wholesale merchants in Bamako (capital of Mali) almost monthly. Each day, accepting cash from a customer base composed of women and men, she makes her sales out of her home.  On market days, she sells at the market.  

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA that will be used for repaying the loan and for meeting expenses related to healthcare, food, and schooling. The rest will be reinvested in her clothing business.

loans.use: Buying clothing

loans.name: Medy

texts.en:
Medy P. is from the village of Namillangan Alfonso Lista, Ifugao. She is 34 years old. Medy is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Medy owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Medy has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Medy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Medy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Medy is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Medy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for general store

loans.name: Ntokozo Group

texts.en:
Veronica is 42 years old and a single mother with five children between the ages of 2 and 23 years old; she also cares for three relatives. She runs a clothing business and sells outside a mall and at a flea market in Empangeni, South Africa (KZN). In the photo above, she is standing on the left wearing a white shirt and a black and white skirt.

She's been selling clothes for two years. She also gets income from the government's child support grant. She says the main challenge for her business is that at times she does not have enough money to order clothes to sell. She also has difficulty selling when it's raining because she does not have a shelter yet.

She requested this loan through the Women's Development Businesses and KIVA to buy second-hand clothes in bulk and sell them. She says the extra income from this loan will help her build a house for her family and feed her children. In the future, she would like to own a building or room for her business with the help of WDB and Kiva. 

She adds that she is looking forward to working with WDB and Kiva and sees her business going forward with their help.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes in bulk and sell them

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
La Sra. Nelida pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Aguerridas”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin. Está Casada, tiene 51 años y es madre de 03 hijos, todos ya independientes.

Nelida se inició en el negocio de venta de pasamanería y servicio de costura.  An la actualidad y gracias a su energía luchadora que siempre le ha identificado y las ambiciones de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes. Nos cuenta que lleva poco tiempo ejerciendo este tipo de negocio. Poco a poco fue ganando experiencia, confianza y haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.
Ahora cuenta con una clientela fija: amigos del barrio, moradores y vecinos que a diario acuden a su tienda a comprar, donde allí encuentran todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará diferentes tipos de productos como: leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, avena en paquetes, té en diferentes sabores (manzanilla y anís), verduras de la zona, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Nelida, está contenta con la actividad que realiza día a día y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nelida is a member of the "Las Aguerridas" communal bank, located in the district of Tarapoto in the province of San Martin.  She is 51 years old, married and the mother of three children who all live independently.

Nelida started out selling lace and working as a seamstress.  But now, thanks to her fighting spirit which she is well-known for and her ambition to get ahead on her own, she runs a grocery store business.  She has only been doing this for a short time but little by little she is gaining experience and confidence and is now well-known and loved among her customers.

She has a permanent customer base comprised of friends and neighbors who buy at her store daily.  There they find everything a homemaker needs and also receive her personal attention.

With this loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN she plans to buy different types of products such as milk, canned fish (in a variety of brands), packaged oatmeal, different flavored teas (camomille and anise), local vegetables, household cleaning utensils and person hygiene items in order to continue providing the best service to customers.

Nelida enjoys her daily routine and is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her realize her dreams and goals.

loans.use: To buy milk, canned fish, oatmeal, tea, vegetables, cleaning utensils and personal hygiene items

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sin is married to Mr. Sey, and they have four children, one of whom is a grocery seller who can only earn a little income, while another one is a finder of customers for taxis, and the other two are attending local public school. She is a Khmer cake seller at the local school where she can earn a little income to support her family. Her husband is a farmer who owns a 3-hectare plot of land where he plants rice. He sells part of the harvested rice and keeps the rest to feed his family. 

It is time for growing rice in the dry season, and that is why she is asking for a loan. To improve rice production, Mrs. Sin is asking for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticide. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticide

loans.name: Erdenetsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Erdenetsetseg, 46 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her eldest son just graduated from Railway College and lives separately. Her youngest son is studying in college. Erdenetsetseg is a taxi driver. She has been running a taxi business since 2001 using her family car. She transports people between Ulaanbaatar and Khandgait, a residential town located 25 km to the north. Erdenetsetseg is a very nice and sociable person who is working to provide her family with necessary income. A few years ago, she built a house for her family. The house now needs some repairs and renovation. Mrs. Erdenetsetseg is requesting a loan to buy the necessary building materials and to repair the house.

loans.use: to buy building materials and repair her house

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda U. is married and has six children ranging in age from 5 to 24.  Rosalinda is engaged in farming and hog-raising. She helps her husband till their farm. They grow rice and then sell their harvest to the market. Rosalinda also manages their small backyard piggery. Rosalinda is requesting a loan for 4,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizers and pig feeds. She hopes to have a stable business that would sustain their family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pig feeds

loans.name: Hassan

texts.ar: حسن في عمر 40 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يعمل في بيع وتركيب الستالايت له في عمله 10 سنوات يحب عمله ويعتبره مميز لأنه قليل في مكان عمله هو يتميز بكثرة الطلب ولكن حسن يريد دائما التطور والتحسن في العمل يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى تطوير المحل وشراء بضاعة جديدة ومعدات وتركيب خزان مياه للأرض حيث انه الى جانب عمله يهتم بزراعة ارضه التي تعتبر مصدر خاص لمعيشة اولاده من خلال اطعامهم ما هو طبيعي قائم على زراعته يهتم لصحة عائلته كثيرا والى تأمين العيش الكريم لعائلته وتعليمهم وتربيتهم بشكل جيد
texts.en: Hassan is 40 years old and married with three children. He works selling and installing satellite dishes. He has ten years of experience in his field. He likes his work and believes that his business is rather unique for his community seeing as there aren't many satellite dish businesses there. He stands out in his field due to the large demand for his services. Still, Hassan always likes to develop and improve his business. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to improve his store by buying new goods and equipment for it. In addition, he would like to install a water tank for his land since he farms on the side. With his farm, he is better able to provide for his children as he can grow natural foods for them to eat. He is very interested in the health of his family, and he would like to secure a respectable life for them. Moreover, he is also interested in providing them a good education and in raising them well.

loans.use: to buy goods and equipment for his satellite dish store.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. For the past three years, she has operated a water vending business, selling from her home to her neighbours. 

Binti faces the major challenge of water shortages in her business. During the hot, dry season water availability is lower than in the rainy, winter season. Binti dreams of expanding and starting a new business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase a pump and pipes for her water vending business. She decided to join Yehu because of its favorable policies which suit small scale entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase a pump and pipes for her water vending business.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Руcтам житель Кумсангирского района. Ему 24 года. Он женат, имеет двоих детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается торговлей на рынке "Дусти". У него имеется торговая точка со складом, где он продает в оптом продукты питания. В этой области он уже 5 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения нового холодильника и для покупки муки, сахара, колбасы, сосисок.
texts.en: Rustam lives in the Qumsangir area. He is 24 years old, married, and has two children. His wife is a housewife. He works trading in the market “Dusti”.  He has a shop with a warehouse where he sells groceries wholesale.  He has been doing this for five years. He is taking out a loan to buy a new refrigerator along with flour, sugar, sausages, and hot dogs.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator along with flour, sugar, sausages, and hot dogs.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 40 years old and has given birth to seven children. Five of them are studying while the others stay at home. 

Shazia is very supportive. In order to financially help her husband, she sews clothes for her neighboring clients.  She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month. Besides her sewing work, she also manages her household work efficiently. 

Her husband runs a business selling food. He sells "Nan chany" (a Punjabi dish made with chick-peas and served with bread) on his cart by visiting different streets of the city.   

Shazia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy ingredients such as chick-peas, cooking oil and spices, etc. which will help him prepare larger quantities of food and earn more profits.  

He started doing this business some time ago and it is earning good profits for him. Shazia hopes that her husband’s business will grow further after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for food selling business.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is a 36-year-old married woman with two children. She lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She has been raising poultry and farming for eight years. Her husband is a driver. 

She would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing poultry and farming stock. 

She hopes that this loan will enable her to generate more capital for her work and enough money to bring their children up.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and farming stock

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, the mother of five children, and has for three years made a living by selling snacks, detergents and beverages. She is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She is a new member of HSPFI, but hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.en:
Lazaro is 47 years old and married.  He is the father of 4 children.  His oldest child is 21 years old and the youngest is 12.

Lazaro is a farmer working in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur.  He tills his own land where he grows rice crops.  Lazaro works hard to keep his farm productive.  He also manages a small backyard piggery.  He raises hogs to sell.

Lazaro has requested a loan to purchase farm fertilizer and pig feed.  He hopes for his ventures to prosper.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizer and pig feed

loans.name: Segundo Agapito

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 58 años de edad y es padre de  3 hijos. Segundo y su familia viven en una comunidad urbana y pequeña perteneciente al distrito de Lagunas en Chiclayo. En esta comunidad se dedican al comercio y a la prestación de servicios, principalmente.

Segundo es una persona que goza de buenas referencias por ser trabajador. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte público y actualmente cuenta con una unidad vehicular.

Él solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 3000 nuevos soles para reparar el motor de su auto y darle mantenimiento al resto de la unidad, para poder seguir brindando sus servicios.

Este crédito le es sumamente importante porque no podrá realizar su trabajo si su vehículo sigue dañado. Segundo desea mejorar el servicio a sus pasajeros para mantenerlos y aumentar su demanda.
texts.en:
Segundo is 58 years old and father of 3 children. Segundo and his family live in a small urban community in the district of Lagunas in Chiclayo. In this community, people work principally in trade and services.

Segundo is a person who has good references because he is a hard worker. Since the age of 15 he has been providing transport services and currently owns a vehicle.

He is requesting a loan of 3000 new Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to repair the motor of his car and for maintenance of the rest of the vehicle in order to be able to continue providing his services.

This loan is extremely important, because he will not be able to do his work if his vehicle is damaged. Segundo wishes to improve the service to his passengers in order to keep them and increase demand.

loans.use: to repair the motor and for general maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Nazarenos Group

texts.es:
La señora Lilia es integrante de una unidad de desarrollo (UDE) la cual esta conformado por diez personas los culaes han decidido llamarla Nazareno en honor al nombre de su comunidad.
La señora Lilia tiene la edad de 37 años, solo estudio la secundaria, y esta casada con el señor Raul el cual se dedica al trabajo del campo, hace mas de 6 años una amiga la invito a trabajar con ella vendiendo antojitos Mexicanos, dulces y agua a la hora del recreo en la escuela primaria de su localidad y ella acepto ya que deseaba ganar un poco de dinero extra ya que cada dia la situacion economica esta peor, asi con lo que ganaba poder dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, ella nos dice que gracias a esta oportunidad de trabajo ha logrado tener su propio negocio y trabaja fuerte para hacerlo crecer dia a dia. 
Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de chiles, tomates, cebolla, carne, col, cilantro, maiz, crema y queso para elaboracion de su comida y posteriormente venderla, además de diversos dulces tambien para ofrecerlos.
Ella realiza sus ventas de lunes a viernes a las 11:00 de la mañana. Tambien nos comenta que desea que su negocio prospere dia a dia mas para poder en un futuro pagar la univerdad de sus hijos y darle la oportunidad de tener mejor calidad de vida.
Los demas integrantes son:

Pablo - Abarrotes
Epifanio - Taller Mecanico
Martha Graciela- Refrescos
Cristina - Refrescos
Lourdes - Refrescos
Genoveva - Molino
Ma. de los Angeles - Refresco
Julia - Abarrotos
Linda - Antojitos
texts.en:
Lilia is a member of a communal bank or development unit (UDE) which is made up of ten people, who decided to call it Nazareno in honor of the name of their community. 

Lilia is 37 years old. She studied only through secondary school. She is married to Raul, who is an agricultural worker. More than 6 years ago, a friend invited Lilia to work with her selling Mexican foods, sweets and water during recess at the primary school of their town. She accepted, since she wanted to earn a little bit of extra money, because every day the economic situation is getting worse. Thus, with her earnings, she can give a better quality of life to her family. She reports that thanks to this work opportunity, she has been able to have her own business, and she works hard to make it grow day by day. 
 
She needs this loan to invest it in buying chiles, tomatoes, onions, meat, cabbage, cilantro, corn, cream and cheese to prepare her foods to sell, in addition to various sweets which she will also sell. 

She sells her products from Monday through Friday at 11:00 a.m. She also comments that she wants her business to prosper more each day so that in the future she can pay for university studies for her children and give them the opportunity to have a better quality of life. 

The other members of the group are:

Pablo - Groceries
Epifanio - Mechanic's workshop
Martha Graciela- Soft drinks
Cristina - Soft drinks
Lourdes - Soft drinks
Genoveva - Grain mill 
Ma. de los Angeles - Soft drinks
Julia - Groceries
Linda - Mexican foods.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the food she sells.

loans.name: Ana Mirta

texts.es:
Ana integrante del Banco comunal “Adonay” perteneciente a la comuna de Cerro Navia, ciudad de Santiago. Se dedica al rubro de la amasandería desde hace 7 años. Ella prepara estos productos en su casa y los vende en el mismo lugar, sus clientes son conocidos. Los productos que prepara regularmente son empanadas de pino, marisco y queso fritas. Ella comienza a trabajar a partir de los días jueves hasta los días domingo. 
Su mercadería la compra preferentemente en ferias libres y supermercados. 
Con el crédito comprará insumos para su amasandería.
Ana sufrió una delicada enfermedad lo que obstaculizó su negocio hace un tiempo, sin embargo logró recuperarse y salir adelante por lo que ahora se dedica a disfrutar el presente sin proyectarse, por lo cual los ingresos que brinda su negocio son el sustento económico diario. 
Ella vive junto a su madre e hijo de 26 años, el se encuentra a la espera de un trabajo, por mientras le ayuda en su negocio. 
Uno de sus principales sueños es tener una buena salud, que le permita trabajar con tranquilidad. Además le gustaría viajar fuera de la ciudad de Santiago. 
Ana está muy contenta y agradecida de los créditos y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza, además comenta que la experiencia de trabajar con el grupo ha sido muy grata, ya que los demás socios son acogedores y comprometidos, por lo que no han tenido ningún inconveniente. 
Cerro Navia es una comuna de la región metropolitana (donde está Santiago, capital de Chile) ubicada en el sector poniente. Se caracteriza por ser una comuna con altos niveles de pobreza, alta densidad de habitantes por hectárea, falta de espacios para recreación y escasa oferta laboral. El desarrollo económico ha circulado en torno al sector  micro empresarial de productos básicos (alimentos, vestuario, zapatos, licores, etc.).
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the communal bank “Adonay” of Cerro Navia, Santiago. She has run a small bakery for the past 7 years, preparing items at home and selling them to local customers.  Her most popular items are empanadas with various fillings such as seafood and cheese.  Her heaviest work is from Thursday through Sunday.  She buys her ingredients in markets or commercially, and seeks this credit to buy a stock of ingredients to support her bakery.
Ana was ill for some time and unable to work, but now feels better and lives gratefully for every new day which allows her to work and sustain herself. She lives with her mother and a 26-year old son who is looking for work and helps out in the bakery.  Ana hopes to regain her full health and dreams someday of living outside of the city of Santiago.  She is very pleased with the services of Fondo Esperanza, and her interaction with the group has been a valuable experience. 
Cerro Navia is a neighborhood of metropolitan Santiago (the capital of Chile) noted for its high poverty rate, crowded urban conditions, lack of parks and high unemployment.   Small businesses sustain many in this region, and sell items such as food, clothing, shoes, licor, etc.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to support her bakery

loans.name: Gualeska Isayana

texts.es: Gualeska Isayana se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 4 años, que ella realiza este medio de vida. Ella vende sus productos de manera ambulante, ya que así obtiene clientes nuevos diariamente. Gualeska se prepara todos los días con un bolso en donde lleva cremas, jabones, perfumes, tratamientos, shampoo, lápiz labial, pintura de uñas, pintura de labios entre otros.
texts.en: Gualeska Isayana sells cosmetics. This has been her livelihood for over four years. She sells her products door to door because that way she gets new clients daily. Gualeska gets ready every day with a bag in which she carries lotion, soap, perfume, treatments, shampoo, lip pencils, nail polish, and lipstick, among other things.

loans.use: to buy lotion, soap, perfume, treatments, shampoo, lip pencils, nail polish, lipstick etc.

loans.name: Amanecer De Patamanta Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMANECER DE PATAMANTA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Reina es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, carnicería, costura de chamarras, tejido de mantas, macramé de mantas, compra y venta de ganado, venta de papa.

La señora Reina,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora en la zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que esta iniciando en la actualidad.

El préstamo que sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de azucar, arroz, aceite, etc.) que adquirirá de la Ceja y posteriormente lo comercializará en su tienda. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio.
texts.en:
The “Amanecer de (Dawn of) Patamanta” communal bank is beginning its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana office. The bank is composed of 10 members and headed by a board of directors with Reina as president. The businesses that the members of the communal association are involved in vary; among them are a neighborhood store, a butcher shop, making leather jackets, sewing blankets, weaving blankets, buying and selling cattle, and selling potatoes.

Reina reports that this is the 1st time she has worked with Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution through the invitation of a promoter in the zone. At present, she is launching a neighborhood store.

The loan she will receive is to augment her capital (buying sugar, rice, cooking oil, etc.) which she will obtain from La Ceja and, later, sell in her store. This type of work will allow her to generate resources to help her family. She is married and has 5 children.

When asked what she thinks of Pro Mujer, Reina responded that she likes the office.

loans.use: buy sugar, rice, cooking oil, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en:
Haneen is a 19 year old young woman. She is married and has one son and one daughter; her husband is a carpenter with low income. Haneen wants to help her husband in purchasing new carpentry tools, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Haneen gets the FATEN loan, which is to be repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to help her husband to purchase new carpentry tools so he can improve his work positively and provide better life conditions for the family. Haneen is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead.


About this loan product:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing new carpentry tools.

loans.name: Enhtsetseg

texts.en: Enhtsetseg is 38 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Govisumber province of Mongolia.  Her children go to school and her husband works with her.  She operates a scrap metal trading business and a frozen buuz(Mongolian traditional food) sales business.  She makes the frozen buuz in her home.  She gains recognition from her clients and customers.  Enhtsetseg is a hardworking and diligent woman who says "I have a plan to expand my business by upgrading the work environment."  She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase more scrap metal to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more scrap metal

loans.name: Naimajon

texts.ru: Наимаджон замужем имеет четверых детей. Бизнесом она занимается на протяжении многих лет. Муж занимается торговлей. Она мастер на все руки умелая рукодельница. У нее свой цех по вышиванию и пошиву национальной одежды. Займ она хочет получить для оптового закупа фурнитуры, тканей и золотошвейных ниток. Она надеется на одобрение займа для улучшения условий труда и увеличения объема производства рукодельев.
texts.en: Naimajon is married and has four children.  She has been involved in business for many years.  Her husband is involved in sales.  Naimajon is masterful working with her hands and a skilled craftswoman.  She has her own factory of embroidering and sewing national clothing.  Naimajon wants to obtain this loan for the wholesale purchase of accessories, fabrics and gold embroidery threads.  She hopes that her loan will be approved in order to improve her working conditions and increase the volume of production.

loans.use: to purchase accessories, fabrics and gold embroidery threads

loans.name: Uchi

texts.en:
Uchi is a married woman with 5 school going children.  She owns a house with piped water but no electricity.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Uchi has operated as a farmer for the past 5 years; her potential clients are local residents. She faces a major challenge of pests attacking her crops. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan Uchi wants to purchase seeds for planting on her farm.  She decided join Yehu Microfinance to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for planting on her farm.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah has operated his tailoring shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years. He is 35 years old, and he and his wife Beatrice have two children attending school.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of their existing clients, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy a new sewing machine and more materials for use in his tailoring shop.

In the future, Elijah hopes to expand his business, open many branches, and even offer tailoring training to other youths in the Ndunyu Njeru area, thereby  improving his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy breakfast cereals for Chevron Hotel.

loans.name: Wangnime Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNIME est composé de sept personnes qui cohabitent ensemble. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Jeanne est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Jeanne est âgée de 33 ans et vit au Bénin. Jeanne n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Jeanne est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Grégoire. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Jeanne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin d‘assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Jeanne exerce depuis une dizaine d’années, la culture du piment et du maïs dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Jeanne vend des céréales dans une ville du Bénin. Jeanne exerce ses activités dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Jeanne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNIME, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les quatre premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
WANGNIME Group is made up of seven women who share a home. This is the fifth time that the members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.
 
The group's representative, named Jeanne, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 33 years old and lives in Benin. She never attended school. She's married to a cultivator named Grégoire. The couple has two children it has to support. Some children attend school.

Jeanne lives together with her husband and children. The couple covers the various household expenses together. In order to provide for the various expenses of the family, Jeanne has been growing chili pepper and corn for about ten years in her region. 

As a secondary business, she also sells cereals in a town in Benin. Eager to meet customer demand, and to increase her revenue and income, Jeanne, together with the other members of the group, is seeking her fifth loan from ALIDé. The first four loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy sacks of chili pepper and corn

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth l is 34 years old and lives in Buchanan.  She is married and her husband is a journalist.  The couple has three children between 2 and 10 years old,  two of whom attend school.

For the past five years, Ruth has been selling used clothes.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business.  She plans to give her children a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a 31-year-old single businessman. He has been running a barber shop for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to cater for his basic needs.

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Isaac will use the loan to buy a shaving machine for his business. With the anticipated profits from the business he plans to expand his business. 

He hopes to buy commercial land in the future.

loans.use: To buy a shaving machine for his business

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
Eliasi, who is in his early 30s is married with on son who still goes to school. He has been having chips and chicken selling business for four years now.  He works from 9.00 am to 9.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy more Irish potatoes, increased on the chicken stock, household expenses, school fees and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to start selling rice at whole sell price.  His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.  

He will share this loan with his loan group "Unity" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to start selling rice at whole sell price.

loans.name: Lesly Rubenia

texts.es:
Doña Lesly de 53 años de edad, ella vive sola en su casa ubicada en San Lorenzo  al sur de Honduras, tiene tres hijos de edades 33,32,28 años todos ya están casados, y ella ya no tiene hijos que dependen de ella.
Maneja su negocio de venta de ropa y calzado ubicado en un barrio en San Lorenzo, pues ahí ella atiende a sus clientes que a diario le visitan, esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar calzado de damas, blusas, y otros artículos para la venta con el préstamo pretende surtir mas su negocio y así lograr mejores ganancias que mejoraran su calidad de vida y vivienda.
Las expectativas para su negocio es crecer mas y con respecto a  su vida es vivir cómodamente y comprar un vehiculo para  ir a comprar la mercadería y transportarse todo los días para su negocio.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de calzado de damas, blusas, y otros artículos para su negocio

loans.name: Frodouard

texts.en:
Frodourd aged 52 years. He is married with 4 children aged between 8 and 117 years. They go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 30 years. Also his wife is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers of maize and pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to improve his savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers of maize and pay workers.

loans.name: Musulmankul

texts.ru: Мусулманкул 51 летный ответственный муж и трудолюбивый отец двоих детей. Детям 25 и 18 лет. Он из района Шахритус. Мусулманкул во дворе имеет не большой земельный участок. Он занимается растениеводством. Мусулманкул 15 лет назад научился правильно заниматься земледелием у своего отца. Он вперед посева урожай обрабатывает почву с минеральными удобрениями, потом посадить семена урожай. Минеральные удобрения помогает получить качественный и здоровый урожай. Он всегда так делает. Мусулманкулу не хватает денежных средств для купли достаточного количества минеральных удобрений. Он верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку. Вы можете помочь Мусулманкулу приобрести минеральные удобрения.

loans.use: Для купли минеральные удобрения.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Madam Comfort M. trades in sewing accessories. A lot of fashion designers buy from her. She wish she could increase stock in her shop but lacks financial assistance. Madam Connie is seeking a loan of $500.00 from kiva to help expand her shop.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Connie is 56 and married with 6 childern who attend school. Her husband is no longer earning any income, thus placing a greater burden on Connie.

It was during the KRABAN 'TEACH' learning facilitation that she decided to take advantage of the KIVA facility to change her fortune. All along she been faced with high credit payments to her supplier. She hopes to buy the maize with cash in her "kenkey" business and thus increase her profit margin substantially.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Leontine

texts.en: Léontine G. is 36 years old and has 3 children. She lives in Marcory in the south of Abidjan District. Leontine is a fruits and legumes gross seller. She is dynamic and has consistently developed her activities since March, 2005 when she started getting loans from AE&I. The months of June and July are fruits production season in Cote d'Ivoire and Léontine wants to purchase goods directly from production fields to make a better margin. Léontine will then be able to pay for her children's school fees next September.

loans.use: Leontine Gah wants to purchase a stock of fruits and legumes

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Mrs. Yin M. is 46 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their child. She works selling brooms, a good business that gives her $20/day in revenue. Her husband helps with the broom business, but also works renting rooms to garment factory workers. This loan will be used for Mrs. Yin M. to purchase more brooms for her inventory.

loans.use: Yin would like to purchase brooms to sell.

loans.name: Kurnaesih

texts.en: Kurnaesih is 44 years old and is married. She prepares and sells coconut milk rice, and some fried snacks. She usually earns $4 per day. Her husband Samsudin is a driver with a small salary. She needs a $50 loan to complete her business and wants to earn more income to pay for her child's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To complete her business

loans.name: Rosa Haydee

texts.es:
Rosa Haydee is married and has five children, two of whom are school-age. Her children have given her a reason to work hard to maintain a stable family and have enough money for their education.

Over 24 years ago, Rosa sold pork. Still, she was able to find and take advantage of a good opportunity. This resulted in her beginning her own dairy products business.

This business is now one of the best in her area. Her sales have increased substantially over the years as she has expanded her business and improved its structure. Her initial capital was 80,000 Cordobas, which came from her saving and those of her husband.

Rose Haydee has worked with CEPRODEL for 2 years now and has a good credit rating.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa Haydee es una mujer casada con cinco hijos de los cuales dos se encuentran en la edad escolar. Sus hijos han sido su razon de vivir y por ellos es que ella se ha esforzado, brindandoles asi una familia estable y una educacion para el futuro de ellos.

Hace mas de 24 años Rosa Haydee se dedicaba a matar cerdos y venderlos, sin embargo logro encontrar una mejor oportunidad en su camino y fue asi que ella da inicio a su local de venta de productos lacteos.

Este negocio es uno de los mas destacados hoy en dia en su sector, sus ventas incrementaron considerablemente al paso de los años, ya que ella ha ido ampliando su local y mejorando la estructura del mismo. Su capital de inicio fue de C$80,000 (cordobas) los cuales una parte eran sus ahorros y otra aporte de su esposo.

Rosa Haydee trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 2 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los creditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando asi a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de 9 creditos.

loans.use: Purchasing products

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
This is 28 year-old Jenifer N.. She runs a pharmacy in the rural town of Kiluvya, about 30km outside of Dar es Salaam. She established the business in 2005 and now requires a loan of $725 to purchase additional stock. She is married to husband Edward and has two children, Ester, 7, and Samwel, 1. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are deemed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To increase her pharmacy's inventory of drugs

loans.name: Mounir

texts.en:
Mounir is a 53 year-old man who lives and works in south Lebanon, in the region of Saida. Mounir has four children.

He owns a sweets store and at this time, needs a loan to buy provisions for his business. Mounir needs to generate enough revenues to help him pay his children's school tuition fees. He hopes that this initial loan will help boost his business to fund his children's much-needed education.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Mrs. Natividad belongs to the "Women towards Progress" communal bank, located in Callería, Ucayali in Peru. She is 48 years old, has one dependent child, and is separated from her husband. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for 300 soles, she decided to invest in a small sweets shop.

Currently, Natividad has a very well-stocked grocery store. She gets up very early to go to market and buy what she needs for her store, while at the same time dedicating herself to her household work and attending her customers.

With this loan for $350, which she will repay in five months, she will purchase one sack of rice, one sack of sugar, one box of milk, one bag of detergent, one box of soap, one case of oil, sweets, sodas, etc.

Natividad told us that she began selling caramels in a small board she had, and with a lot of hard work and dedication she made her business grow. She is very pleased to be able to contribute to her home's economic well being, and her family is very happy for her.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Natividad pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso, ubicado en Jr. Luís Escavino Nº 161, distrito de Callería, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 48 años, es madre de 1 hijo que aún depende de ella y es separada. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles, decide invertir en una pequeña venta de golosina. En la actualidad Natividad tiene una bodega muy surtida. Se levanta muy temprano para ir al mercado y comprar lo que le hace falta para su bodega, simultáneamente se dedica a las labores del hogar y a la atención a sus clientes. Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 caja de leche, 1 bolsa de detergente, 1 caja de jabón, 1 caja de aceite, golosinas, gaseosas, etc. Natividad nos contó que empezó vendiendo caramelos en un pequeño tablero que tenia y con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación hizo crecer su negocio. Está muy feliz de poder contribuir a la economía de su hogar y su familia está contenta por ella.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries (rice, sugar, milk, etc)

loans.name: Mirzo

texts.ru:
Mirzo Sobirovich A. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 43 years old, married and has six children. He has secondary education and is in the retail business. He has own vendor point on the market where he sells spare parts. He brings in the merchandise from Dushanbe (capital of Tajikistan) which he buys from wholesalers. He has been in this business for the past five years. Mirzo wants to increase the variety of his merchandise and also increase sales by getting a loan. This will help him increase his profits and also supply the markets with necessary spare parts for the locals residents. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Азизов Мирзо Собирович проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 43 года, женат , имеет 6 детей.Образование среднее . Занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли . Имеет торговую точку на рынке.Торгует запчастями. Завозит товар из города Душанбе ,приобретая у оптовых реализаторов. Занимается этим видом бизнеса клиент уже 5 лет. Хочет увеличить ассортимент товара , а так же увеличить товарооборот , путем получения кредита.Это поможет клиенту увеличить доходность , а так же обеспечить рынки необходимыми запачастями, не выезжая для этого в город. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Pream

texts.en: Pream H., of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, is 42 years old and employed by a local golf course, making $3 U.S. per day while her husband, a construction worker, makes $2 U.S. per day. The couple has five children. one of whom works with his father in construction, adding $3 U.S. per day to the family income. Because Pream H.’s work is an appreciable distance from her home, she is requesting  a loan of $500 in order to purchase a motorbike to use for commuting.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Sulikanah

texts.id:
Sulikanah has been sewing since many years. Every day from morning till evening she is busy with this work. Her husband's job as a transportation driver is not enough to pay for family needs expenses, therefore she is working too. Her income from sewing is enough to help family economic situation. Now with husband and child, Sulikanah is living in Laksamana street Denpasar, by renting a room for Rp150,000 (about US $ 19)/month. She hopes with the loan she could expand her seamstressing business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Kegiatan menjahit sudah dijalani oleh Sulikanah sejak bertahun-tahun. Setiap hari dari pagi sampe sore dia disibukkan dengan pekerjaan ini. Pekerjaan suaminya sebagai sopir angkutan kota belum cukup memenuhi kebutuhan hidup keluarga, karena itu dia juga ikut bekerja. Penghasilan yang didapat dari menjahit cukup untuk membantu ekonomi keluarga. Saat ini bersama suami dan anaknya, Sulikanah tinggal di Jl.Laksamana Denpasar dengan menyewa kamar Rp.150.000 per bulan. Dia berharap, pinjaman kali ini bisa dipakai untuk mengembangkan bisnis jahit-menjahitnya.

loans.use: To increase business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Further business development.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said, 54 years old, lives with his wife and four children in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. His work includes the maintenance and repair of home electronics and the installation of satellite dishes. The income generated by his work is not sufficient to cover more than basic living expenses for his family. Therefore he needs a loan fof US$1,000 to repair his car.

This is the second time Said has requested a loan from Al Majmoua and he successfully repaid his previous one.

loans.use: Car repairs

loans.name: Kamila

texts.en: Kamila (her brother is pictured) is 51 years old and is the mother of three children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Lachin region in the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan.  Eight years ago Kamila and her brother started a food market business. They need a loan of  $1200 to buy more food items to help improve their business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
La señora Nelly pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, ubicado en Jr. Atahualpa Nº 1030, distrito de Callería, departamento de Ucayali. Nelly tiene 36 años de edad, 4 hijos, es casada y su esposo es comerciante, Tiene trabajando 6 años con el banco comunal Manuela Ramos. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300, decidió invertir en la compra de fierros de nombre “cáncamo”

En la actualidad, Nelly, continúa con diversos negocios, como la venta de cáncamos (fierros). Tanto ella como su esposo se dedican al negocio, así como también cuentan con una pequeña bodega de abarrotes.

Con el préstamo de S/.1,300, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de 100 cáncamos (fierros) y abarrotes como 2 sacos de arroz 1 saco de azúcar 2 paquetes de fideos, 1 paquete de aceite, ½ caja de leche, etc., para la bodega
