Nelly se siente muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por brindarle la oportunidad de surgir en la vida y poner su propio negocio y así mismo poder apoyar a su familia y darle educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nelly belongs to the “Talented Women” community bank, located at No. 1030 Jr. Atahualpa, district of Calleria, Ucayali. Nelly is 36, has four children, is married to a vendor and has been working with the community bank for six years. With the first loan of US $100 (S/. 300) that she received, she decided to invest in purchasing “cancamo” irons. Currently, Nelly continues with different businesses, like the sale of “cancamo” irons, in which both her and her husband work. They also have a small general store. With the loan of US $450 (S/.1,300) to be repaid in four months, she will purchase 100 irons, groceries such as 2 sacks of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 2 packages of pasta, 1 package of oil, half a box of milk, etc for the general store. Nelly is thankful to Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity to emerge in life, have her own business, support her family and provide education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase irons and merchandise for general store

loans.name: Mrs. Sok Yin's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people in Trapeang Anchan Village in Kampong Chhnang Province have formed a village bank loan group. Each member plans to use the loan for a different purpose. 

Mrs. S. Y., the village bank president, owns a small store where she sells rice soup to villagers and passers-by. Her business is going well and she wants to expand it, so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice and other ingredients used to cook delicious rice soup for her customers. 

Her husband, Mr. Phin Veoun, has a plot of land where he cultivates rice for a living. Mrs. S. Y. is 43 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory. The others are attending the local school. 

One of the members of this village loan group has an end-of-term loan. The rest have monthly payment loans. The member with the end-of-term loan is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. 

End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. The terms allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more rice and other ingredients for her delicious rice soup

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima A. is 30 years old and married with 3 children. Fatima sells foodstuffs and baby things. She sells foodstuffs like rice, beans, garri, etc. Her store is located at the front of her house on Textile Mill Road, Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. Fatima is a client of LAPO [Kiva's Field Partner]. She needs the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and baby things to sell. She wants to expand her business. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support and to LAPO MICROFINANCE for their business training.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and baby things to sell

loans.name: Kate Joy

texts.en: Kate is a tailor. She also sells tailoring materials to her customers. She makes lovely designs and her customers like her work. Kate is happy because this festive season will increase the demand for her tailoring skills. She is 36 years old and married with 2 children. She needs a loan of N40,000 ($350) to purchase more tailoring materials like zippers, threads, needles, buttons, etc. to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Mrs. Long N. lives in the village of Krodas Kor in Kampong Cham province. She is a pig breeder. She is 51 years old and has seven children. One child works in a garment factory and another is a construction worker. The rest attend the local school.

Her husband, Mr. Urn On, is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which he cultivates rice. He faces a problem because his field is infertile. To solve this problem, Mrs. Long N. decided to request a loan so that her husband can buy fertilizer to enrich the soil and make it more productive. Her husband is shown on the left of photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Jiovanni

texts.es: Jiovanni tiene 35 años, vive con su pareja y sus 3 hijos en la casa de su padre. Ella tiene un negocio de venta de pan en las instalaciones de su vivienda, inició esta actividad hace 3 años y le va muy bien, se encuentra ubicada en un sitio muy acogedor y bastante concurrido. Jiovanni quiere surgir y salir adelante, le pone mucho entusiasmo a sus actividades, le gusta tratar directamente con sus clientes. Lo bueno de este negocio es que ingresos diarios. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a construir un kiosco, y desde luego adquirir más panes.
texts.en:
Jiovanni is 35 years old, lives with her partner and their three children in her father’s house. She has a business selling bread on the premises of her house. She started this activity three years ago and is doing very well. They are located in a site that is very friendly and quite busy. Jiovanni wants to emerge and move forward. She brings much enthusiasm to her activities, and she likes to work directly with customers. The good thing about this business is the daily income. This is her third loan with MFP. With the money, she wants to build a kiosk and then buy more bread.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct a kiosk for her business

loans.name: You

texts.en: You S. is 28 years old and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham, Cambodia. This couple has two young children. Mrs. You Seanghaiy has been operating a CD shop from her home and earns about $3 profit every day. Her husband (pictured here) has a business making jars and earns $7 per day. Mrs. You Seanghaiy is asking for a loan of $400 to purchase construction materials so her husband can make more jars to sell.

loans.use: Construction materials to make glass jars

loans.name: Kurbon

texts.en:
Kurbon is 49 years old and lives with his wife and their 3 children. He is a man who, from an early age, was characterized as a hard worker who was very dedicated to his agricultural work, raising cattle. He saw this as an activity that would enable him to have additional income due to the high demand for these animals in the markets. His challenge is to improve the breed, but to do so he would have feed them properly. Kurbon has the best intentions for his children, which allows him to continue improving as a father and farmer. This farmer yearns to expand his business so that he will be able to improve his family living. In order to do so he is asking for a loan that will allow him to buy animals of a better breed to improve their quality.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase better quality cattle

loans.name: Ramzidin

texts.en:
Since he was young, Ramzidin has known how to work. His parents taught him how to get by as an agriculturalist, and he learned very well. Now that he is the father of a family, he still works as an agriculturalist. Thanks to his parents, Ramzidin now has the opportunity to move forward as a farmer, and he hopes to increase his agricultural products so that he can bring his loved ones a more promising life. Despite being a good agriculturalist and worker, he needs help to move forward and improve his production. This is why he is asking for a loan; so that he can buy more of the seeds and fertilizer he needs. These are very expensive, but without them, his production will not improve. You can help Ramzidin keep moving forward with his development plans.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the Fourth millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen  es socia del Bancomunal Teresa de Calcuta.
Carmen es conviviente  tiene 33 años, cuatro hijos de 14, 13, 12 y 10 años que están en la escuela estatal. 
La familia del esposo de Carmen tiene negocio de confecciones y le animaron a que ella entre en el negocio, con un dinero ahorrado compró maquinas y se puso a trabajar ella da servicio de remallado a diferentes tiendas en gamarra; va a gamarra ofrece su servicio y lleva la mercadería a su casa.  
Desde que esta en Finca, los prestamos le han ayudado para poder invertir.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de  800 soles, para la compra de tela para hacer polos, para el colegio.
El sueño de Carmen es tener su propia empresa de confecciones.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the “Teresa de Calcutta” community bank. She is 33 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their four children, who are 14, 13, 12, and 10 years old and who all attend public school. Carmen’s husband’s family has a sewing business and they encouraged her to work there as well. With money she had saved, she bought the machines and began working for various stores in Gamarra. She goes to Gamarra to offer her services and then takes the projects to her home. Since she has been working with FINCA, the loans have helped her invest in her business. Carmen needs a loan of 800 soles to buy material to make polo shirts for the high school. Carmen would love to one day have her own sewing business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy material

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: La señora Ana R.,  tiene la edad de 38 años, habita en el bario Laureles Norte en la ciudad de Managua, tiene 3 hijos, su compañero le ayuda económicamente. Los planes de doña Ana es mejorar su nivel de vida. Se desempeña como operadora en  una empresa textilera desde hace un año. El préstamo que solicita en Afodenic lo invertirá en la realización de mejoras en su vivienda con la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, piedra y ladrillos. Con estas modificaciones en su vivienda le ofrecerá a su familia mayor seguridad y protección, da las gracias ala institución  por los beneficios adquiridos el cual espera seguir trabajando ya que es su séptimo ciclo y espera poder seguir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana R. is 38 and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the city of Managua. She has 3 children and her partner helps her out financially. Her plan is to improve her quality of life. For the past year she has worked as a laborer at a textile company. She plans to use the loan she is seeking from Afodenic to buy construction materials, including cement, iron, stone and bricks for home improvements. The changes to her house will provide her family greater safety and security. Ana is grateful to Afodenic for the benefits they offer her, which she hopes will continue. This will be her seventh loan and she hopes to be able to continue improving her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials for improvements to her home.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela tiene 56 años, es una mujer muy luchadora y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Pedro D. 46 años, quien es su compañero desD. hace mucho tiempo, tienen 3 hijos; Nely D. 30, Edwin D. 28 y Elizabeth D. 25 y lo que más desea es vivir una vejez tranquila a lado D. su esposo. El negocio al que se dedica es la venta D. polleras (faldas), mantos y mandiles, su puesto está ubicado en el mercado San José (mercado importante D. la ciudad D. Juliaca), el cual es muy concurrido por los clientes, ya que las prendas que venD. son D. muy buena calidad y tienen costos muy accesibles. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas D. venta, quienes siempre la mantienen bien informada D. las cosas que suceden en el mercado. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro D. su puesto sin poder realizar otras actividades. Adela anhela para el futuro tener una tienda D. ropa más granD. donD. pueda vender con más comodidad, sabe que su trabajo es sacrificado, pero se siente muy segura D. poder continuar y alcanzar sus metas. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, en su primer crédito fue muy puntual y espera serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es una socia muy activa y siempre participa en todas las reuniones. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más polleras para aumentar el stock D. su puesto, así dará más variedad a su mercadería.
texts.en:
Adela, 56, is a fighter and a hard worker. She lives in her own house with her husband, Pedro, who is 46. They have been together for a very long time. They have three children; Nely, 30; Edwin, 28; and Elizabeth, 25. What she wants most of all is to live her old age tranquilly by her husband’s siD.. She sells polleras (skirts), shawls, and aprons. Her stand is located in the San José market (an important market in the city of Juliaca). The market is very well attended by customers since the articles she sells are a very good quality and a reasonable price. What she likes best about her work is talking to the neighboring vendors who always keep her well informed of what is happening in the market. She has been doing this for fifteen years. What she likes the least if having to stay all day insiD. her stand without being able to do anything else. Adela aspires to have a bigger clothing store in the future. Then she could sell more comfortably. She sacrifices a lot for her work, but she feels very secure in being able to continue and reach her goals. This is her second loan with MFP. She was very punctual with her first loan, and she expects to do the same this time as well. She is an active member of her community bank who always participates in the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Bendicion Group

texts.en:
The committee Bendicion has been together for six cycles.  The members live in the Reducto zone of San Lorenzo and have a group savings of 4,700,000 PYG, or almost $1,000.  All of the women are very responsible and hard working.  They have weekly meetings in which they share their preoccupations.  They have been working with the Fundación Paraguaya for two years.  

1	Luisa Elizabeth D..	Small grocery store
2	Maria Elena D..	General store 
3	Laura A..	General store
4	Justa A..	Food sales 
5	Olga G. F..	Food sales 
6	Rossana B..	Hair salon 
7	Julia G..	General store 
8	Maria Francisca A..	Fruit and vegetable sales 
9	Maria Francisca D..	General store 
10	Maria Agusta G..	Food sales 
11	Maria D. S. O..	Clothing sales 
12	Fatima F..	Diner 
13	Maria Elena A..	House wares store 
14	Mirtha O..	Clothing sales 
15	Tomasa R..	Small grocery store

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise for sale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. is a fish monger. She sells smoked fish. She sells the fish on a tabletop at the market square. She also supplies retailers and food vendors in her community. Agnes buys cartons of fresh fish from big cold stores in Kumasi and smokes the fish herself. She has been in business for over 15 years and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk.

Agnes is 60 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: two sons and two daughters. She lives with her husband and some of her children in a family house in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Agnes wants to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Зухро уже 7 лет кредитуется.За это время она показала себя как порядочный клиент. За период кредитования у неё улучшалось семейное положение.Она на кредит закупает муки и уголя для производство и продажи лепёшек. У неё очень много клиентов так как её лепешки вкусные.Лепёшек она реализует на базаре Костокоз.
texts.en:
Zuhro has been getting financing for 7 years already. During this time, she proved to be a model client. Her family conditions improved during this time as well. She uses loans to buy flour and coal for making and selling flatbread. Zuhro has many customers because her flatbread is delicious. She sells the flatbread at the Kostokoz market.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour and coal

loans.name: Murodchon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
     Муродчону 30 лет, женат и отец 4-х детей. Занимается продажей мужской обуви на рынке Фаровон города Гафурова, а также ездит по районам Ашт и Лохути. Жена Муродчона домохозяйка. Она смотрит за своими детьми и делает домашнюю работу, а также откармливает домашний скот. Муродчон как глава семьи должен работать, чтобы прокормить свою семью, обучать детей и развивать свой бизнес. Муродчон закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Он ездит за товаром 2 раза в месяц. Так как начинается школьный и осенний сезон, Муродчон  хочет закупить осеннюю партию обуви.
texts.en:
Murodchon is 30 years old, married and is a father of 4 children. He sells men's shoes at the Farovon market in the city of Gafurov and also goes to the Asht and Lohuti districts. Murodchon's wife is a homemaker. She looks after their children and does domestic work, and also feeds livestock. As the head of household, Murodchon has to work in order to support his family, teach the children and develop his business. Murodchon buys his merchandise at a wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan. He goes there twice per month. Due to the start of the school and autumn season, Murodchon wants to purchase a stock of autumn shoes.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of autumn shoes

loans.name: Enkhbat

texts.en:
Enkhbat S. is 50 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in Chingeltei, a district of Mongolia's capital city, Ulaanbaatar. His oldest daughter currently attends the State Education University and his youngest son is a 5th grade student. His wife, Enkhtuya, has worked as a surgery nurse at a maternity hospital for 20 years. Enkhbat operates a small food store business at a shop in his khashaa (yard) beside his home.

He named the store "Enkh-Uud" and explained that this is because both he and his wife's name include "enkh" in them. Enkhbat started his food store business in 2007 and it has been very successful. Today, his business capital exceeds 2.0 million Tugrugs. In the future, Enkhbat and his wife hope to grow their business to a level of sustainable activity. "Don’t worry about the loan repayment. I am good at record keeping", he said with a smile. He is requesting a 3.000.000 Tugrug  loan to buy food products and stationery goods to sell as the new school year quickly approaches..

loans.use: To buy food products and stationery goods.

loans.name: Aldrin

texts.en:
Aldrin is already 25 years old and is engaged in operating a passenger tricycle.

Aldrin is married to Mary Jane, who is now 23 years old, and they are blessed with three children. Their eldest is Shera May, 6 years old, followed by Kyla who is 5 years old and their youngest is Aldrin Jr., who is barely 6 months old. As head of the family, Aldrin is hoping to provide for the needs of his family by working hard in his present business.

Aldrin would like to request a loan from Kiva lenders of PHP 5,000 to be able to maintain the operation of his motorcycle transport business. Some of the spare parts that he needs to buy are gaskets, bearings, sprockets, and other materials for his motorcycle. He hopes that his loan will be granted because this is his chance to further improve his daily transport business.

loans.use: To maintain his motorcycle transport

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia used to believe that “it is better to give than to receive”, that helping other people in simple ways is showing a good attitude towards others and to God. She manages a bakeshop business located along the National Highway of Cordon, Isabela.

Lydia is happily married to Arnolfo, her business partner. The couple are gifted with two children: Arlan Jay - 12 years old, an elementary student, and Ashie Jhaira - 4 years old, already in preschool.

Lydia dreams of having a successful life. However, her business capital is not enough and that is why she is asking to borrow PHP 50,000 in financial assistance from Kiva lenders as additional capital for the progress of their bakeshop business.

Lydia also wants to have her own retailing business that she could manage, to help generate additional income for their family. According to her, they are doing all these things to give their two children a better future and also to provide employment to some of their neighbors.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Salmo 91 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario compuesto por tres personas, tiene 3 créditos y es uno de los grupos que han sido muy responsables con su cuota y son buenas clientes.

Doña Ivett L. vende ropa de manera ambulante en sus alrededores desde hace mas de 10 años, con la cual ha apoyado el sustento familiar, goza de buena reputación entre su vecindario. 

La  señora Marta Lorena S. su actividad es la de comercializar ropa de manera ambulante Vive con su familia, cónyuge y tres hijos, a pesar de no tener muchas comodidades su cónyuge trabaja como conductor de una moto taxi y con su salario ayuda al sustento  de la familia.

La señora Lesbia Carolina U. Chávez se dedica a la venta de comida en su casa de habitación desde hace 5 años, realiza sus compras de contado en el mercado ya que los precios son más bajos y le generan más ganancias, su esposo trabaja reparando bicicletas y con lo que recoge diariamente ayuda  a su hogar. Por lo que juntas se han unido para realizar este financiamiento.
texts.en:
This solidarity group consists of three people who are very responsible. They have three previous loans and are good clients. Doña Ivett L. has been selling clothes door-to-door in her area for more than 10 years as a means of supporting her family. She has earned a good reputation in her neighborhood. Sra. Marta Lorena S. also sells clothing as a traveling merchant. She lives with her family, which consists of her husband and three children. Despite not having many conveniences, her husband works as a motor taxi driver and his salary helps with supporting their family. Sra. Lesbia Carolina U. Chávez has been selling food out of her home for 5 years. She purchases her supplies at the market with cash so that she can get a lower price and generate more earnings. Her husband works as a bicycle repairman and his daily income helps with the household expenses. Together they are responsible for the finances.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra es una socia trabajadora y dinámica, vive en el distrito de Yarinacocha, región de Ucayali, tiene 42 años, es madre de dos hijos mayores de edad. Sandra se dedica a la compra y venta de madera(listones, tablas, tucos) negocio que lleva a cabo con su esposo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Gotitas de Amor” desde hace ocho meses, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 500 soles que lo invirtió en la compra de  productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos), en la actualidad Sandra necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado para comprar madera en el puerto para posteriormente vender. La meta de Sandra es tener una fuente de soda.
texts.en:
Sandra is one of our dynamic and hardworking members. She lives in the district of Yarinacocha in Ucayali region. She is 42 years old and the mother of two adult children. Sandra buys and sells wood (strips, boards, and planks) and manages her business alongside her husband.

She joined the Communal Bank “Gotitas de Amor” (Droplets of Love) eight months ago. Sandra used her first loan of 500 soles to buy basic necessities (rice, sugar, milk, and noodles). She is now requesting a loan of 1000 soles to acquire wood at the port for resale. Her goal is to open a soda fountain.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood in bulk

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is 37 years old and is married with four children. She sells groceries at the front of her house. She is happy because she does not have to pay stall rent but she hopes to own a supermarket in the future.

Roseline is a hard working woman and has been in this business for four years. She hopes for a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell.

This is the high season for Roseline’s business and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Yulia

texts.en:
Yulia is married with two children. She sells jeans and clothing from a rented space at a department store. Yulia has been in this business for six years. She started it because her family was in need. Little by little she gained experience, increased the assortment of products and attracted repeat clients. Today her income is 3,500 Ukrainian grivna per month. That enables Yulia to take care of her family.

Yulia would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to increase her assortment of products. She hopes to increase sales and make additional income for her family.

loans.use: To increase product assortment

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
La señora Mariluz, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santo Cristo de Bagazan”, Distrito de Rioja, Provincia de Rioja, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 29 años y es madre de 03 hijos, los 03 que aun dependen de ella.

Mariluz, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa. Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00 y empezó comprando 05 paquetes de gaseosas, vio que le iba muy bien, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Mariluz, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente muy motivada, así poder hacer realidad  sus sueños y lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Sra. Mariluz is a member of the Communal Bank “Santo Cristo de Bagazan”, which is located in the District of Rioja, Rioja Province, Department of San Martín. She is 29 years old, single, and the mother of three dependent children.

Mariluz is a hardworking determined woman who decided to start her own soft drink business in her home, which provides a well-suited environment. She manages her business without a set schedule and does not report to a boss. With 300 soles, she started her business by purchasing 5 packs of sodas. Her initial investment went very well and she gradually bought more merchandise. Today she continues in the same business and is known among her customers, which consist of her neighbors, relatives, and friends.

With this loan of 2500 soles, she will purchase sodas in different flavors, sizes, and brands. In addition, she will buy carbonated and non-carbonated mineral water. Mariluz has many goals ahead of her and is very motivated to fulfill everything she wants to achieve. She is very thankful to Manuela Ramos for helping her when she needed assistance. Mariluz is responsible with her payments and promises to continue in the same manner.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas & mineral water

loans.name: Keilyn

texts.es:
Keilyn T. N. tiene 21 años, es soltera, y no tiene hijos. Ella vive en China Kicha con su familia. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de abarrotes para surtir, mercandería como arroz, frijoles, azucar, galletas, pan y refrescos. Ella quiere obtener mas ganancias con su pulpería. Es la primera vez Keilyn se financia con FUDECOSUR y no ha tenido otra experiencía con credito.  Ella espera que pueda estudiar y ayudarle al papá ya que está un poco enfermo. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Keilyn T. N. is 21 years old, single and has no children. She lives in China Kicha with her family. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her grocery store, such as rice, beans, sugar, biscuits, bread and beverages. She hopes to improve her business and increase her revenue. This is the first time that Keilyn is requesting a loan to FUDECOSUR and it is her first experience with microfinance. She hopes to be able to complete her education and support her father, who has some health problem. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grocery store restocking (rice, beans, biscuits, bread, beverages).

loans.name: San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
El banco de Emprendimiento "SAN SEBASTIAN  " es uno del los grupos  màs antiguos de la agencia , se encuentra en su octavo ciclo., el cual esta conformado por personas responsables y trabajadoras, este Banco  esta representada por las siguientes socias: 

La Sr. Carol es la lider del grupo tiene 2 hijas pero que ya son independientes, como negocio tiene la venta de carne en la Av. Siles. 

Como Tesorera esta la Sra. Primitiva quien es casada y tiene su negocio de venta de velas en la Esteban Arce es una de las socias mas antiguas y que ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos y la Secretaria es la Sra. Casilda Maria  quie es soltera y vende carne en la Av. siles junto a la presidenta, es una persona responsable  y activa.						
						
Estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The "San Sebastian" Entrepreneur bank is one of the oldest in the agency. It is in its eighth cycle. The bank is formed by responsible and hardworking people. The bank is represented by the following partners:

Carol is the Leader of the group. She has two daughters who are already independent. She sells meat in the Siles Ave.

Primitiva is the Treasurer. She is married and sells candles in the Esteban Arce. She is one of the oldest members and has shown responsibility and punctuality with her payments.

Casilda Maria is the Secretary. She is single and sells meat in Siles Ave. along with the Leader of the group. She is a responsible and active person.

They are very thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie C. is from the village of Digkilaan in Iligan City. She is 38 years old. Rosemarie is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Rosemarie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells a variety of daily-use products and beverages in the local community. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Rosemarie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Rosemarie's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
Marilu es socia del Banco Comunal Guadalupe.
Marilu es soltera, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, Marilu vende ponches (bebidas calientes con maca, quinua) de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Magdalena actividad que realiza por las noches.
Marilu necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, quinua.
Los sueños de Marilu son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y tener un negocio en su casa.
texts.en:
Marilu is a member of the Communal Bank "Guadalupe." Marilu is single, is 37 years old, and has two children. She has a stall at the market where she sells "ponches" (warm drinks with maca root or quinoa) at night. Marilu needs a loan of PEN 1,000 in order to buy sugar and quinoa. Marilu's biggest dream is that her children finish school and to have a business at home.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sugar and quinoa

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn A. is a 50-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy San Jose, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling all kinds of footwear (shoes and sandals) and operating a cafeteria.

Marlyn’s husband, Nonoy, manages the cafeteria, and they have five children who are between 13 and 22 years old. The children are currently going to school and help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Marlyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family's income by engaging in selling footwear at retail and running a cafeteria business. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 3,000 from her business activities.

Marlyn is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 was used to fund operation of her retail footwear business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing PHP 19,000 for her 12th loan, which she intends to use as additional capital for her footwear and cafeteria businesses. Marlyn is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Tope

texts.en:
Tope owns a boutique where she sells women's bags, shoes and clothes. She manages the business herself and her children sometimes assist her after school hours. Tope has been in the business for 12 years. 

Tope wants to expand the size of her business so as to increase sales in future. She is requesting a loan of NGN 60,000 to purchase more bags, shoes and clothes to sell. This will enable her meet her customers’ demands and maximize profit.

Tope is 35 years old, married and blessed with three children between the ages of 13 and 18. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more women's bags, shoes and clothes to sell

loans.name: Nikanou Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Nikanou (cinq femmes mariées dont deux dans des familles polygames) ont en moyenne 40 ans, 5 enfants et résident toutes dans le quartier Bagadadji de la ville de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et font l’achat et la vente d’articles divers (céréales, habillements, du lait frais et parures). 
Tata C., un des membres du groupe excelle plutôt dans l’habillement avec l’achat et la vente de pagnes wax, des draps de lit, des couvre lit etc.
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce et de diversifier les articles à vendre, elles ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 2ème  prêt solidaire, après avoir bien remboursé le premier. 
Tata C. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 7 pièces de pagnes wax et une douzaine de draps brodés auprès des grossistes du grand marché de Ségou. Tata effectue sa vente en ambulant dans les quartiers, à domicile et au grand marché de Ségou, à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes qui achètent au comptant et parfois à crédit. 
Tata C. à l’instar des autres membres du groupe espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 14.500FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et prendre en charge les petits besoins de la famille en condiments. 
Elles ont pour ambitions d’acheter  chacune un lot à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The women of the group Nikanou (five married including two in polygamous families) average 40 years of age and five children each.  They all reside in the Bagadadji district in Ségou City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women of the group know one another through community ties, and they buy and sell various goods (grains, clothing, fresh milk, and fine accessories).  Tata C., one of the members of the group, rather excels in clothing with her commerce in wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), bed sheets, blanket, etc.  With the goal of increasing their working capital and diversifying the items for sale, the members of the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan after having repaid the first one.  Tata C. intends to use her loan for buying seven bolts of wax pagnes and a dozen embroidered bed sheets from wholesalers at the big market of Ségou.  Tata sells door-to-door in the area, out of her home, and at the big market of Ségou.  Her customers are generally composed of men and women who buy with cash and sometime on credit. Like the other members of the group, Tata C. hopes to make an average monthly profit of 14,500 francs that will be used for repaying the loan and for meeting the sundry needs of the family in terms of condiments.  They each have the ambition to buy a residential plot of land. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cloth and embroidered bed sheets

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie E. is from the village of Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Virgie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Virgie owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as candies, snacks, shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Virgie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Virgie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Virgie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Virgie is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Virgie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional daily-use products to sell, such as candies, shampoo, and soap

loans.name: Kambeng Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KAMBENG composé de 13 membres est un des 09 groupes de solidarité qui constituent le Banc Villageois de TEREMBASSE situé dans la région de Ziguinchor. Il est créé en octobre 2002 lors de l'inauguration dudit Banc Villageois. Elles ont une moyenne d'âge de 40 et son mère d'au moins 4 enfants. Elle s'habitent toues le même village de TEREMBASSE.

le leader du groupe, Awa M. est âgée de 33 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants et tutrice de 03 autres qui sont ses neveux. C'est un membre très dynamique et engagé dans l'organisation du Banc Villageois. Elle fait du maraîchage et se charge de la vente de ses produits dans la capitale régionale, Ziguinchor. Et comme activité secondaire elle développe un petit commerce de poissons frais dans les marchés hebdomadaires.
Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille par l'achat des fournitures scolaires des enfants, leur nourriture et leur habillement.

Leur activité principale est la vente de poissons frais et des crevettes. Et comme activité secondaire elles développent un petit commerce d'huile de palme et de balais faits à partir des feuilles de palmiers. Leur lieu d'approvisionnement est leur village et elles écoulent en général leurs produits dans les marchés hebdomadaires de leur localité.  

Et pour la pérennité de leurs activités elle ont voulu augmenter leur capacité d'autofinancement en acceptant, pour la plus part d'entre elles, d'intégrer le Banc Villageois en octobre 2002. Et depuis, leur performance ne cesse d'augmenter.

Ce nouveau prêt leur permettra de mieux développer leurs différentes activité afin de se procurer des bénéfices pour pouvoir répondre aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
The group KAMBENG, composed of thirteen members, is one of nine solidarity groups of the Banc Villageois de TEREMBASSE, located in the Ziguinchor region.  It was establish in October 2002 during the inauguration of the aforementioned Banc Villageois.  The members average 40 years of age and four children and all live in the same village of TEREMBASSE. The group leader, Awa M., is 33 years old, married, and the mother of five children.  She is the guardian of three others, who are her nephews.  A very energetic member and devoted to the Banc Villageois organization, she has a market garden business. And she takes on the responsibility to sell her produce in the regional capital, Ziguinchor.  Secondarily, she is developing a small business selling fresh fish at the weekly markets.   Her goal is to take part in improving her family's living conditions by buying school supplies for the children, their food, and their clothing.  The group members' main work involves selling fresh fish and shrimp.  On the side, they are developing a small business selling palm oil and brooms made from palm fronds.  Their supply location is their village, and in general, they sell their goods at the weekly markets in their town. For the sustainability of their businesses, the group members wanted to increase their ability to self-finance.  To do so, most of them were willing to join the Banc Villageois in October 2002.  Since then, their performance has been increasing non-stop. This new loan will enable them to develop further their different businesses in order to obtain the profits for responding to family needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering their ability to self-finance the group for developing their businesses further

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie A. is 30 years old and lives in the town of Sta. Josefa. He is married, has a five-year-old child and makes a living as a farmer, growing mostly rice.

Julie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. He has successfully repaid seven previous loans from CEVI and is applying for an eighth, for 12,000 PHP, to buy fertilizer for his farm. He plans to use the additional revenue generated by his business to make improvements to his house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, es una agradable mujer, muy dedicada al trabajo, tiene 55 años y lleva 13 años separada de su pareja, con quien tuvo 2 hijos, sin embargo sólo vive con uno de ellos, en su vivienda propia. Desde hace 10 años, se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles y verduras en su  tienda, ubicado en su propia casa. Paralelamente a este trabajo, prepara comida en especial parrilla de pollo, vendiéndolo los fines de semana durante las tardes. Es así que desde muy temprano su  bodega es el primer establecimiento en abrir sus puertas, en ocasiones la ayuda de su hijo. Antes  de emprender este negocio, observó que era muy concurrido y no se equivocó, ahora le es muy rentable, sus ganancias le permiten vivir cómodamente, es por eso ahora que quiere ampliar su local, además se abastecerá de más productos, ya que sus vecinos y clientes le solicitan diferentes productos e incluso pretende vender útiles de escritorio, mercería, perfumería y adornos para el hogar. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y confiesa que le gusta trabajar en su grupo  comunal, porque sus integrantes son comprensivos y responsables. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará artículos descartables (plásticos), además de verduras y productos comestibles para la tienda.
texts.en:
Norma is a friendly woman who is very dedicated to her work. She is 55-years-old and has been separated from her partner with whom she had two children for 13 years. Now she lives with one of her children in her own house. She has worked for ten years selling food products and vegetables in the store located in her house. In addition to this work, she also prepares food in a special grill for chicken that she sells on the weekends during the afternoon. From very early on, her store has been the first establishment to open its doors. Occasionally her son helps her. Before opening this business, she observed that it was very busy there and she wasn't wrong, now it is very profitable. Her earnings permit her to live comfortably, this is why she wants to expand her location. She would also like to supply more products as her neighbors and customers request different products and she would even like to offer office supplies, hats, perfume, and home furnishings. This is her third time getting a loan from MFP and she admits to liking to work in a communal group because its members are caring and responsible. With the loan that she is requesting, she will buy disposable plastic items, vegetables, and food products for the store.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various products to supply her store.

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr:
Femme commercant de 49 ans, mariee avec 6 enfants dont l'age varient entre 23 ans et 8 ans, et tous vont au lycee, au college et a l'ecole primaire, connaissant sa charge , pour palier a la misere elle s'est lancee dans la vente de vaiselles en 2000 pour aider a ameliorer les conditions de vies de sa famille .
Elle vend en moyenne 10000f a 20000 f par jour; avec le pret qu'elle souhaite recevoir elle tient a renforcer so commerce en achetant de la porcelaine de Chine; de Sevres; des flutes a champagnes, des verres en cristal; des produits qui marchent bien , puisque sesclients lui demandent ses produits durant les festivites de mariage et differentes ceremonies.
Tres strategique,elle est parfois ambulante ou fait des depots dans les administrations pour accroitre ses revenus, malgre la crise , elle s'efforce a trouver de nouveaux creneaux de vente pour joindre les bouts du mois; et aider sa famille pour subvenir aux etudes des enfants qui sont a l'universite: tres connu dans le marche, elle a une bonne reputation.
texts.en:
This is a 49-year-old merchant, married and the mother of six children whose ages vary from 8 to 23 years. All attend school, be it primary, secondary or university-level. Given her family responsibilities and to avoid empoverishment she started selling dishes in 2000 to improve her family’s living conditions. Her daily sales range from 10,000 to 20,000 francs. With her foreseen loan she wants to bolster her business by purchasing porcelain dishes from China and Sèvres (France), champagne glasses and crystal glasses. These are articles that sell well, because her customers request these articles for weddings and other festive occasions. She shows good marketing strategy, as she also sells as an itinerant vendor and by leaving depots at administration offices to vary her sources of revenue. Despite the financial crisis, she keeps trying to find new sales outlets to make ends meet and support the tuition costs of her children attending university. She is well known in the marketplace and holds a good reputation.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy dishes, pots, glassware, cutlery

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 35-year-old married woman from Lebanon who has two school-aged children. She worked for eight years as a cook in a restaurant. She has been running her own restaurant since 2008. Her restaurant specializes in serving the most delicious fajitas in town. People from the neighboring villages also visit her restaurant to taste the delicious food she offers. 

In order to help with her family’s expenses, she is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase materials needed for the restaurant. She hopes that the loan will positively impact her business and, therefore, increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase restaurant materials

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en: Dolores M. is from the village of Estefania, Amulung, Cagayan. She is 39 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Dolores owns and operates a general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Dolores joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Dolores is requesting a new loan of 27,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her seventh from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es:
La señora Felicidad vive en la zona las lomas de la ciudad de La Paz, en casa propia; esta casada y tiene 4 hijos todos casados, el esposo trabaja como chofer de transporte libre con su  minibús, ella tiene en la parte inferior de su casa una pensión donde ella vende almuerzos todos los días; es clientes de Impro desde hace más de tres años y son casi 10 créditos  los que se le han concedido durante este tiempo; también fue cliente de kiva en tres oportunidades. 
El crédito que solicita ahora es para comprar papa, fideo, arroz al por mayor para abaratar los costos, y también para comprar carne, aceite y verduras.

Ella esta satisfecha con su relación con Impro y con Kiva, pues abarata mucho el crédito, y por el carácter social del mismo puede acceder a un crédito nuevo.
texts.en:
Felicidad lives in her own home in the Las Lomas neighborhood of the city of La Paz. She is married and has 4 children who are all married. Her husband works as a public transportation driver with his minibus, and in the back of her house, Felicidad has a home-based restaurant where she sells meals every day. They have been clients of IMPRO for more than 3 years, and they have taken out about 10 loans over this time. They have also had 3 loans funded by Kiva. The loan that she requests now is to buy potatoes, noodles and rice at wholesale to reduce her costs, and also to buy meat, cooking oil and vegetables. Felicidad is pleased with her relationship with IMPRO and with Kiva, since it reduces the cost of her credit, and with her good character and reputation she can qualify to access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy potatoes, noodles and rice at wholesale, and also to buy meat, cooking oil, and vegetables for the home-based restaurant where she prepares and sells meals

loans.name: Sonya

texts.en:
Sonya is a resident of Kasur which is a small city in Pakistan. It is located in Punjab province and is famous for its leather industry.

Sonya is 28 years old and is a seamstress. She supports her family by sewing clothes for her neighborhood clients. She is married to M. F. and is the mother of three daughters and a son. Currently she is not able to send her children to school but she’s hopeful that, with increased income, she will be able to provide education facilities for her children very soon. 

Sonya’s husband has a milk-selling business. He operates his business from his home and has been doing this for the last six years. Sonya has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount he will buy another buffalo to expand his milk-selling business. Sonya is hopeful that her husband will utilize the loan money in a proper way and will be able to get positive results from his business.

Sonya is one of Asasah’s regular loan users and is on her 2nd loan. With her previous loan she proved that she is very responsible, always paying her installments on time and never missing any meeting.

loans.use: To enable her husband to purchase another buffalo for his dairy business

loans.name: Abenawa

texts.en: Abenawa A. is married and takes care of six dependents. She has received junior high education.  Abenawa prepares 'banku'  (a food staple consisting of fermented corn dough) for sale at Elmina. She has been in this 'banku' business for six years. Abenawa uses her earnings from her sales to help her husband in providing the basic needs of her family. Abenawa will use the loan to purchase extra bags of corn and other ingredients for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abenawa plans to save to invest into the sale of provisions.

loans.use: purchase extra bags of corn and other ingredients for sale

loans.name: Bikamwa Plus Group

texts.en:
Serge is the chairman of a Community bank named “Bikamwa Plus”, which is composed of 20 micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Serge is 28 years old and single. He runs a telephone booth and is a money changer. He started his business in 1996 with a beginning capital of US$ 150. With hard work and determination, his business prospered.  Serge’s business is located in the west of the city of Kinshasa. He has already received  Hope DRCongo’s loans three times and repaid them correctly. He intends with the next loan to purchase more prepaid cards and increase his inventory in order to reinforce his working capital. He makes US$ 65 in profit each week. His ambition is to purchase a generator to rent out and to become a card provider in his area.

loans.use: to purchase more prepaid cards and increase his inventory to reinforce  working capital

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es:
La Asociación  Comunal “Unidas” está solicitando crédito por primera vez, en el Centro Focal de Los Andes.  Está compuesta por   diez  integrantes, 9 mujeres y un varón, esta asociación se reunirá cada quincena.  El verse dos veces al mes les permitirá conocerse y fortalecer los lazos que las une como asociación.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por la señora Evangelina como presidenta, la señora Julia como tesorera y como secretaria de actas la señora Benedicta.

La señora Benedicta es una mujer joven de 28 años de edad, casada, con un solo hijo y ha sido elegida como Secretaria de Actas de la mesa directiva por sus habilidades para el cargo.  Con relación a su negocio, es la venta de muebles, desde hace seis años.  Ella aprendió de su esposo, él tenía el negocio de elaboración de muebles y venta, desde que era soltero.

 Los negocios  que llevan adelante las integrantes de la asociación comunal, son variados: tienda y servicio de teléfono público, venta de carne, venta de comida, costura de cueros, venta de pescados, venta de sopa de fideo, venta de muebles, costura de chamarra macramé, chofer.  Este primer crédito, de la señora Benedicta es por Bs 2000.- y la finalidad es de comprar material para la elaboración de los muebles, es decir madera y venesta. 
Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, responde el apoyo médico.
texts.en:
The “Unidas” (United Ones) communal bank is asking for its first loan in the Los Andes Focal Center.  It has ten members, 9 women and one man.  They meet every two weeks.  Meeting twice a month makes it possible for them to know each other better and strengthen the bonds that unite them as an association.  The governing board is composed of:  Evangelina, President, Julia, Treasurer and Benedicta, Recording Secretary.

Benedicta is a young 28 year old, married woman.  She has a son and has been elected Recording Secretary of the governing board thanks to her abilities for the position.  With respect to her business, she has sold furniture for the past six years.  She learned from her husband.  He has had a furniture making and sales business since he was single.

The businesses that the other members of the communal bank have are varied.  There are stores, public telephone service, meat sales, food sales, leather sewing, fish sales, noodle soup sales, furniture sales, macramé jacket making, and a driver.

This is Benedicta’s first, Bs2000, loan.  She will use it to buy supplies to make furniture, that is lumber and venesta (pressed wood).

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answers: the medical services.

loans.use: To buy venesta (pressed wood) and lumber.

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es:
María Esther es una madre de familia de 39 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo en el caserío Quemazón, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque. Aproximadamente a una hora de camino de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace doce años a la preparación y venta de pan. Ella cuenta con un horno artesanal instalado en su domicilio donde prepara diariamente panes, bizcochos y galletas para venderlas al público en general y distribuirlas en las bodegas de la zona. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores. Con estos ingresos ella y su esposo sostienen la economía de su familia.

María desea adquirir algunos insumos al por mayor para poder almacenarlos y ahorrar dinero, ya que el precio de estos productos, como la harina y la levadura, son bastante inestables y muchas veces se elevan. Por ello ha decidido solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante tranquila y responsable. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien honrada y de confianza.
texts.en:
María Esther, 39, is a mother living with her husband and minor son in Quemazón, a rural area in Mórrope district, located in Lambayeque province about an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been a baker for 12 years.  She has an artisanal oven in her home where she bakes bread, cookies and pastries daily to sell to the general public as well as to area grocery stores.  In addition she raises small farm animals.  Income from these activities makes it possible for her and her husband to support their family.

María wants to acquire some ingredients at wholesale to store them and save on costs because the price of these products, like flour and yeast, are quite unstable and often rise.  This is why she decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 1000 new sol, loan.

She is quite a calm, responsible woman.  People who know her consider her to be honest and trustworthy.

loans.use: To buy bread making ingredients.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is a 26 year old mechanic.  He does vehicle repairs to earn a living.  Having been in the business for eight years, he hopes that someday, he will open his own vehicle maintenance company. Benson also makes detergents to earn extra income.  With his income, he is able to provide for his family as well as educate his two children, ages five and two year.  He has requested his first loan of 20,000 KES to buy a laptop for motor vehicle diagnosis.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for motor vehicle diagnosis.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with an 8-year-old son, Igor. She is a farmer from Kamenka which is a predominantly rural agricultural region of Ukraine. Yelena owns two big arch greenhouses where she grows early spring vegetables like tomatoes and radishes, for further wholesale and retail sale. Yelena is relatively new to this sphere of business. She built her first greenhouse only 2 years ago. However, she has already invested 90,000 Grivnyas in her venture. She spends 25,000 Grivnyas on seeds and polyethylene film every year. 

Yelena is requesting a 15,000 Grivnya loan to construct a greenhouse and buy good quality plastic film for extra durability and good light transmission in her greenhouses.  Yelena is hoping to continue expanding her enterprise and re-invest profit in further growth of her business. She is planning to build one more greenhouse in the nearest future, thus having four greenhouses altogether.

loans.use: to construct a new greenhouse and purchase polyethylene film

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine A. is from the village of Santa Felomena, Iligan City. She is 30 years old. Christine is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Christine owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling dried fish like "pinikas & tamban" in the local community. Christine has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Christine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Christine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Christine is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional dried fish such as  "sapsap & bolinaw". This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Christine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish

location.town: Santa Felomena, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Giovanna Consuelo

texts.es:
Giovanna tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola bastante  comercial que se encuentra situada a más de una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a la comercialización de prendas de vestir y calzado para todo público. Ella cuenta con un stock permanente de mercadería la cual ofrece a sus vecinos y clientes tanto al crédito como al contado. Su negocio siempre cuenta con muy buena acogida debido a la calidad de los productos que ofrece y al buen trato que brinda, los ingresos que obtiene de estas actividades los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de su familia.

Giovanna desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería, de modo que pueda obtener mayores ingresos y rentabilidad por sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo. Ella es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante y de mejorar la calidad de vida en su familia.
texts.en:
Giovanna is a 33-year-old married woman who lives with her family in the Olmos district, an agricultural and commercial zone located one hour and forty-five minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been selling apparel and footwear for 3 years. She has permanent inventory, which she sells to her neighbors and customers both for cash and on credit. Her business is popular because of the high-quality products that she offers, as well as her great customer service. She uses the income from the business to help her husband support the family.

Giovanna would like to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise so that she can obtain bigger profits from her sales. For this reason, she thinks that it is worthwhile to request a 500.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can reach her goals. She is a woman with a strong desire to get ahead and to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.ru:
Huseyn A. 29 let. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. On projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoimi roditelyami. 

Seychas Huseyn nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit  testi i knigi dlya svoix uchenikov kotoriye sobirayustay postupat v universiteti, tak kak eti testi stoyat dorogo ne kajdiy uchnik imeyet vozmojnosti pokupat ix. Huseyn uje 2 qoda kak rabotayet uchitelem.
texts.en:
Huseyn A. is 29 years old. He is single, without children. He lives in the Absheron Region together with his parents.

At present Huseyn needs 2000 AZN in order to buy tests and books for his students who plan to apply to college, because these tests are expensive, and not all students can afford them. Huseyn has been working as a schoolteacher for two years.

loans.use: Purchasing tests and books for his students

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
If you do not have much education as a foundation to build on, try banking on experience instead. This is what one person did to overcome life's adversities. Lolita D. S., 63, reached only elementary school, but is now working hard on making her business grow. Being a Community Partner in CCT*, she applies to her business what she learns from her entrepreneurial training and Bible fellowships. She presently lives in Baseco, Manila, with Noviros, her husband who is also a sari-sari (variety) store vendor. 

Lolita co-manages the sari-sari store with Noviros. It is a residential business which has been in operation for fifteen years now. Their family mainly runs the store, catering to the immediate needs of their community, such as rice, milk in sachets, and instant food sold in pouches. Monthly they earn an average income of Php 10,500.

To further help her grow her business, Lolita decided to borrow Php 24,000. She wants to add more groceries to her store and also start selling beverages amd retailing charcoal which is widely used as household fuel in her community. A big part of the loan will go to these purchases, while Lolita intends to use part of the money for the improvement of their house. 

Life is as hard as a rock, but with the wisdom Lolita has gained through her experience, she claims that life can be smooth sailing for her. She hopes to maintain a savings account and dreams of a flourishing grocery business.


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: purchase of merchandise for the store

loans.name: Kiv

texts.en:
Kiv R. is a 29-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Tom province. She and her husband work together in the farming business, growing rice. They have experience in this sector since 2007 and are earning a profit of about $4 per day. 

This couple has only one child, who is studying in local school. 

Kiv R.’s husband wants to buy a trailer to connect with his motorbike in order to pick up merchandise and use for the family. This is why she has decided to look for lenders on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a trailer for their motorbike

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Erika pertenece al Banco Comunal “María Auxiliadora” del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 29 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun depende de ella.  

Erika se dedica a la venta de refrigerios (Desayunos). Lleva varios años en el negocio y esta muy contenta con lo logrado ya que le va muy bien.

En la actualidad cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada, siendo sus principales clientes moradores del barrio y amigos conocidos, que saben de su buena sazón e higiene en la elaboración de sus productos, a quienes  ella los atiende con el carisma y amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este crédito de S/. 1,300.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará: insumos como harina, huevos, mantequilla, leche, panes, pollos, y otros para la preparación de kekes, empanadas, sanguches. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de frutas de la región  para la preparación de sus jugos y refrescos. 

Está preparada para todo y aun se siente con muchas fuerzas para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante con su negocio. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por hacer realidad sus sueños y metas
texts.en:
Erika is a member of the “María Auxiliadora” community bank which is located in Tarapoto district, in San Martin province and department.  She is 29 years old, single, and has two dependent children.

Erika's business is selling light refreshments (breakfasts).  She has been in the business for several years and is very happy with what she has achieved as her business is going very well.

Erika currently has a loyal customer base.  Her main customers are people who live in the neighborhood, friends and acquaintances, who know that she makes tasty food and employs good hygiene practices in making her products.  She serves her customers with her characteristic charisma and kindness.

Erika will use this loan for 1,300 Peruvian soles to buy supplies such as flour, eggs, butter, milk, bread, chicken and other products that she needs to make her cakes, empanadas and sandwiches.  She will also invest part of her money in buying local fruit for making her juices and soft drinks.  She is ready for anything and feels that she has a lot of strength to continue working and get ahead in her business.  She is grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for making her dreams a reality and helping her achieve her goals.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as flour, eggs, butter, milk, bread, chicken and other products for making her cakes, empanadas and sandwiches

loans.name: Mrs. Ma Leap Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ma Leap is the village bank president who has been selected by the thirteen members of this village bank loan. They will use their portion of the loan in various ways to improve their family's standard of living. 

Mrs. Ma Leap was born in 1981. She is a knitter and a tailor who can earn some income to support her family while her husband, Mr. Sokuntha, is a construction worker and a farmer who owns a plot of land where he can grow rice to feed his family. Presently, Mrs. Ma Leap needs some money because she wants to buy a cow to raise to start a new business. So Mrs. Ma Leap would like to request a loan to add to her savings to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en:
Pheng K. is a 53-year-old farmer who lives in Prey Chhor district, Kompong Cham. Pheng K. is married to Horng Va, age 54. Her husband is a chief villager as well as a local farmer. 

This couple always work together in the farming business. They have five children: two of the children are married three are single. Recently, the family's living conditions have not been comfortable because their toilet is surrounded by pollutants, which is harmful to their health. Therefore, Pheng K. is requesting a loan to build a restroom for her family's sanitation, and to dig a well.

loans.use: To build a restroom for her family's sanitation, and to dig a well.

loans.name: Silvina

texts.en:
Silvina is a married woman with six children. She is 48 years old and has had a sari-sari (variety) store for two years.
