Silvina sells items like sugar, canned goods, and coffee to the people in her community. She usually earns about 2000 PHP per month with her store. Silvina's husband is a farmer. She also helps him till their land for planting rice crops.

Silvina is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP to buy more items to sell, such as sugar and canned goods.

In the future, Silvina hopes to have a better house.

loans.use: to purchase items to resell such as sugar and canned goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more plastic buckets and bowls for her business

loans.name: Pierre Seyni

texts.fr:
MONSIEUR PIERRE SEYNI EST COMMERÇANTE SPÉCIALISÉ DANS LE DOMAINE DE LA COUTURE(ACHAT ET LA PRODUCTION).
il a eu a capitaliser une expérience de 8 ans dans le domaine. Face a une demande forte de ses clients il sollicite un prêt.
texts.en: Mr. Pierre Seyni T. is a businessman specialized in sewing (purchase and production). He is capitalizing on an eight-year experience in this domain. Faced with a strong demand from his clients, he is requesting a 200,000 CFA francs loan.

loans.use: to buy clothing material to respond to strong demand for his clothes

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is from the village of Lusot, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Nora is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $70 a month for these activities.

Nora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase sugar, dried fish and bagoong (fish paste) for resale. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, dried fish and bagoong (fish paste) for resale.

loans.name: Jonaliza

texts.en:
Jonaliza, is 33 years old and is a married woman living in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur.

She is engaged in farming and has been growing rice for 6 years. She sells her harvest at her town's local market. She plans to use her loan to purchase two bags of certified seeds, four bags of fertilizers, and other farm inputs. 

In the future, Jonaliza hopes to improve her business and to earn a bigger income for her family.

loans.use: to buy two bags of certified seeds, four bags of fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр проживает в городе Худжанд. Он женат. Имеет двоих детей. Ему 47 лет. У него среднее образование. Он занимается продажей овощей на рынке "Фаровон". Этим видом деятельности он занимается 14 лет. Бахтиёр хочет расширить свою деятельность. Поэтому он берет кредит в Хумо. Он берет кредит в основном для покупки в оптом картошки и лука. Его жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве, она занимается растениеводством.
texts.en: Bakhtiyor  lives in the town of Khujand. He is married, with two children. He is 47 years old. He has completed secondary education. He sells vegetables at the “Farovon” market. He has been in this line of work for 14. Bakhtiyor would like to expand his business. This is why he is taking out a loan from MLO Humo. He is taking out a loan mainly to buy potatoes and onions wholesale. His wife works at a collective farm. She  grows crops.

loans.use: to buy vegetables in order to expand his business

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en: Elnur is a responsible father of two children. He started his business seven years ago. Thanks to his valuable knowledge of the livestock trade, he has been able to obtain good results from his sales. His wife, a housekeeper, actively helps him in his business. This young man wishes to invest more capital in young animals. With the help of loan from KIVA he was able to improve and expand his business. Elnur hopes to continue his dedication to his work, believing that by improving his stock and feed, his cattle will bring better prices. For this reason, he haas applied for 1500 AZN  to continue developing his business.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle and 5 sheep.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a 28-year-old woman and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

She has been selling baby items for five years and she generated her initial capital to start her current business from her previous job as a teacher. 

Her challenge is bad debtors and her vision is owning a baby center.

Rehema needs the loan to buy baby items to sell.

loans.use: To buy baby items.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es: Ana Patricia tiene 40 años, su actividad es la venta de productos varios. Tiene más de 9 años en la venta de bolsitas, golosinas, galletas, paletas entre otros.  Inicio este medio de vida con fondos propios, pues su esposo se encontraba enfermo fue así que ella decidió establecer un negocio que le proporcionara ingresos diariamente para su familia. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de bolsas, frutas, azúcar leche, galletas entre otros productos. Sueña con incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en: Ana Patricia is 40 years old and sells various products. For more than 9 years she has sold little bags, sweets, cookies, lollipops and more. She started this business with her own funds, since her husband was sick, which is how she decided to establish a business that would provide daily income for her family. The financing she is seeking is to buy bags, fruit, sweetened milk and cookies as well as other products. She dreams of increasing her working capital.

loans.use: to buy bags, fruit, sweetened milk, cookies and other products.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn, a married woman living in the land of her birth, has four children residing with her and her husband. Both farmers, she and her husband work hard to support their family by raising livestock and growing crops. They arise at dawn everyday to cut grass to feed the cows and check the fields to ensure optimal crop growth and guard against insect infestations. Occasionally, Jocelyn sells the offspring of her cows, especially if they are males. Now requesting a loan of P 15,000 to buy sacks of rice, fertilizer and corn seeds, she plans to improve their crop production.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her food business.

loans.name: Ana Isela

texts.es:
Ana Isela  es de una colonia que está muy cerca del pueblo que se llama coapilla, es un lugar muy bonito, ella es soltera  tiene diesi nueve años  de edad y vive con sus  padres.

     Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  ropas para luego venderlo  fuera de su colonia en la que comenta que le  va bien ya que con ello ha mejorado sus ingresos para poyara su  familia.

     Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó  por una tía  ya que necesita tener sus propios ingresos para poyar a sus papas  con en la educación de sus hermanitos.

      Lo que desea es que con ello  pueda  ir teniendo sus propios ahorros para  comprar algunas cosas que le hacen falta para ella.
texts.en:
Ana Isela is from  neighborhood that is very close to a town called Coapilla. It is a very beautiful place. She is single and nineteen year old and lives with her parents.  

She asked for the loan to invest in buying clothing to later sell outside of her neighborhood. She tells us that it has gone well for her and she has improved  her income to support her family.      

She was inspired to do this activity by an aunt, since she needs to have her own income to help her parents with her siblings education.   

What she wants is to have her own savings to buy a few things she needs.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Vital

texts.es:
Carlos, es empleado, vive solo porque sus hijos se han trasladado hacia otra zona por estudios, él trabaja ejecutando proyectos, hoy tiene 7 meses en la ejecución de un trabajo.
Actualmente quiere comprar equipo de estudio para sus hijos que les sirva de apoyo para el curso de sus materias, este préstamo le servirá para tener la facilidad económica para la respectiva compra.
La aspiración de Carlos es finalizar la construcción del proyecto, realizarse en su área y estar siempre al pendiente de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carlos is employed and lives alone because his children have moved to another area because of their studies.  He works carrying out projects.  He has worked on one project for seven months.

He currently wants to buy supplies for his children's education that will support them with their classes.  This loan will let him have the economic flexibility he needs to buy these things.

Carlos's aspiration is to finish his project, to be accomplished in his field, and to always take care of his children.

loans.use: to buy supplies to support his children (like books and a printer).

loans.name: San Valentin Group

texts.es:
San Valentin es el comité integrado por 10 mujeres de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas ellas son vecinas y amigas de esa ciudad. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, las cuales la ayudan con el sustento de su familia. Lograron formar un grupo que trabaja en equipo, siempre dentro de un marco de respeto y mutuo apoyo.
Una de las miembros es la señora María, ella se dedica hace un tiempo a la cría y posterior venta de animales. Este ha sido el sustento de su familia por un tiempo, con el mismo logra darles las condiciones mínimas para una vida digna y sin privaciones. Comenta que es un trabajo muy duro y sacrificado, pues requiere mucho esfuerzo físico.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de animales pequeños para la posterior venta y como así también alimento para los mismos.
texts.en:
The 'San Valentin' committee has ten [female] members who all come from the town of Santaní.  They are all neighbors and friends from this town.  All of the members have their own individual business activities which help them to support their families.  They managed to create a group where they work as a team, within a framework of respect and mutual support.

One of the members of this committee is María, who raises and sells animals.  This has been the source of support for her family for some time.  Through her business, she manages to provide her family with the minimum conditions for a decent life without hardship.  She tells us that it is very hard work as it requires a lot of physical effort.

María is requesting this loan to buy animals which she will later sell.  She will also buy feed for the animals.

loans.use: to buy animals and animal feed

loans.name: Sharifbek

texts.en:
Sharifbek is a 36-year-old man married to a housekeeper, and they have four children. A farmer for 10 years, the biggest problem Sharifbek faces are insects that have affected his crop yield, as he lacks sufficient funds to deal with the problem. He is requesting this loan in order to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

Because agriculture is his family’s source of income, Sharifbek gives thanks to IMON and Kiva for the support it will give him through this loan. His plans include expanding his crop production so that he can support his children’s studies.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Tsagaanhuu

texts.en: Tsagaanhuu is 55 years old and lives with her husband and children in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband is taxi driver; her two elder children are employed and the youngest is a student. Tsagaanhuu does multiple things for a living. She plants vegetables, feeds six cows and milks them and does tailoring from home. She is very passionate about her work. Lately, she is experiencing a shortage of basic materials for her tailoring business. She is a hardworking and diligent woman. She says: "Some people ask me, "how do you maintain all these things?" I say to them, 'I love to work and that's it.'" She is requesting MNT 1,500,000 to buy materials for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To buy materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Jesus Johana

texts.es:
Jesus D. 37 años D. edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo D. luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito D. TambogranD. que pertenece al departamento D. Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería y artesana.

Jesus desD. hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta D. ganado caprino (cabras), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior D. su casa, los cuales son apropiados, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados D. la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios D. su casa.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1300 nuevos soles para realizar la compra D. más alimento balanceado y sanidad D. su ganado, con los ingresos que adquiera por la venta pueD. cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.  Jesus es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia tenga lo mejor para salir adelante en la vida.
texts.en:
Jesus is 37 years old and lives with her husband and children in her own house, which has electricity and is located in the rural zone of TambogranD. district, in Piura department. This zone is known for its agricultural, livestock-raising and artisan activity.

Jesus has been dedicated to raising and selling goats for some years now. A quite appropriate corral is located at the back of her house. Jesus feeds her goats properly formulated feed and natural grasses so they will enjoy optimal growth and can be sold in the zone's different markets and thus, help her to obtain very good earnings and cover daily household expenses.

Jesus is requesting a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for 1,300 new sols to buy more feed and raise healthy goats. With the earnings she acquires through sales, Jesus will repay the loan and improve her family's quality of life. She is a hard-working and very responsible person who only wants her family to have what it takes to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy more feed for the goats she raises.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Thumu

texts.en: Thumu is taking another Kiva loan of KES 20,000 to boost her business. With the loan she wants to add more stock of hair weaves, cosmetics and oil. She dreams of expanding her business to satisfy her customers' needs in the future. Thumu is giving thanks to Yehu and Kiva lenders for giving her this loan to boost her business and to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and hair weaves.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 28-year-old entrepreneur from Othoo area of Migori County, on the shores of Lake Victoria. He is married to Jane and they have a young child.

Richard operates a motorcycle transport business (locally known as Boda Boda) and has done so for the last two years. He is taking his second loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy a second-hand motorcycle. He will use the profits to carry out repairs on his motorcycles and also provide for his family.

His dream is to own a fleet of motorcycles.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
Erlinda, se dedica a la venta de carne de res, en su hogar le acompaña únicamente un nieto, ella lleva tres años dedicándose a la venta de carne, éste lo aprendido por cuenta propia cuando era joven ya que quería mantenerse ocupada y le gustaba mucho el comercio.

Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para mantener disponible dinero y comprar carne a sus proveedores, ya que ella la obtiene de aquellas personas que son ganaderas y que destaza sus reses, además quiere comprar ropa nueva para ofrecer en la temporada que se acerca, este préstamo alentará para darle continuidad al negocio e iniciar con uno nuevo.

Su aspiración es mantener siempre actividad y con ayuda de los préstamos es espera fortalecerse y darle vida para más tiempo , también quiere apoyar a su nieto en todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Erlinda sells beef. She lives alone with her grandson. She has been selling meat for 3 years something she learned on her own account when she was young and wanted to keep busy as she liked the business a lot. 

She is asking for a loan to have disposable income and buy meat from her suppliers as she obtains her meat from cattle breeders whose meat is of excellent quality. In addition she wants to buy new clothes to sell in the coming season. This loan will serve to give her business continuity and start a new one.

Her aim is to always have a business and with the help of the loans to become stronger and live longer. She also wants to support her grandson with everything he needs.

loans.use: to buy beef to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 56-year-old business lady married to Mulondu who is a businessman. They are blessed with five children aged 25, 19, 16, 13 and 9 years old, respectively. She has been in the livestock trading business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Mary will use the loan to buy more livestock for selling. With the anticipated profits from the business, she will educate her children. 

She hopes to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy more livestock to sell

loans.name: Santos De Jesús

texts.es: Santos de Jesús de cincuenta y cuatro años de edad vive con su compañera de vida en casa propia. El se dedica al cultivo de maíz y adicional a eso tiene un transporte de alquiler, es muy conocido en la zona y es por eso que últimamente se ha aumentado la clientela, además lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y todo su negocio lo maneja con excelentes precios para las personas; Santos es un hombre muy dedicado a su trabajo, es muy activo y siempre se mantiene adelante de la competencia, piensa que hay que creer y esforzarse en las metas trazadas pues solo así se lográ el triunfo y él está muy dispuesto a creer, es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz, material de cultivo, etc. Santos de Jesús tiene fe que así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Santos de Jesús is 54 years old and lives with his life partner in his own home.  His business is growing corn.  In addition to this, he also has a rental vehicle.  He is very well known in his area and, for this reason, his customer base has recently increased.  The produce that he sells is very good quality and he runs his business offering excellent prices to his customers.  Santos is a man who is very dedicated to his work.  He is very active and always keeps ahead of the competition.  His opinion is that you must believe in yourself and work hard towards achieving your goals as this is the only way to be successful.  Santos is very much ready to believe in himself and so he decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow him to buy corn, farming supplies, etc.  Santos believes that this will enable him to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn and farming supplies

loans.name: Vos-Sa Group

texts.fr: Le groupe VOS-SA est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Julienne, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 37 ans est mariée à un certain Philippe. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Julienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par Julienne et son mari. Julienne a très peu fréquenté l’école. Depuis douze ans, Julienne vend des chaussures ce qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Julienne s’approvisionne à Lomé au Togo. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Julienne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe VOS-SA un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des chaussures.

loans.name: Mahugnon 11 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUGNON 11 est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Adonaï, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 21 ans célibataire sans enfants. Adonaï vit ensemble seule et assure toute seule ses différentes charges. Adonaï n'a pas fréquenté l’école, pour y arriver Adonaï vend des savons et des détergents de façon ambulante depuis trois ans. Adonaï s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Adonaï sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUGNON 11 un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des savons et des détergents.

loans.name: Didas

texts.en:
Didas aged 58 years. He is married with 5 children aged between 14 and 28 years. 4 of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 8 years. Also his wife is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers of maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers of maize.

loans.name: Zawadi Kigogo Group

texts.en:
Mwanne,who is in late 30's is married with three children. She has been running clothing shop for eight years now. She works from 6 am to 6 pm daily and she's able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock her shop with stylish clothes to meet customers demand. She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group which is now proceeding well. 

She used her profit to take care of her family, to repay loan, reinvest in business and pay school fees. She will use this loan to increase on the volume of latest outfit to match with the Christmas festivals.

She dreams of expanding her business into a whole selling store and Build a house. Joyce, will share this loan with her loan group ” zawadi” which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan

loans.use: to increase on the volume of latest outfit to match with the Christmas festivals

loans.name: Mohtaram

texts.en:
Mohtaram is 41 years old. He was born in Gazax region of Azerbaijan. After wedding he settled with his family in Sumgait city. Now he has 3 children and he is the only breadwinner in family. In the beginning his business he rented a small tea-house. Now he has rented cafe. On a dinner break workers have dinner here and clients are very happy with the given dishes.
He applies for the loan $600 to built his own cafe.

loans.use: To built his own cafe

loans.name: Flor Idalia

texts.en:
Flor is originally from the town of Monclova in the state of Coahuila, she is married and has two small children. Three years ago, when her husband found himself unemployed and it was very hard for him to find work, the family went through a very difficult economic situation. In order to support her family, Flor started selling cosmetics and ceramic figurines, and in that way she was able to provide food to her family during that crisis. Today, her husband works in a fruit store, but Flor continues with her business because it has gone very well and her customers have increased. She hopes her business will get bigger so she can help her family and contribute to the education of her children.

Presently Flor needs a loan in the amount of $175.00 which she will use toward the purchase of merchandise to meet the demands of her customers and to grow her business. Today is the day to help someone who really needs it. Flor and her family thank you sincerely.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Khom

texts.en:
Khom has been married more than 17 years with 3 children, all sons. The oldest son is 16 years old. He is currently studying I. year 7. When free from school he assists his mother I. weaving silk. The other two sons are still young and do not attend school yet. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor nearly 20 years ago and she started silk production after that. Her husband had also been assisting her to weave silk, but I. 2002, he was employed to work at the garment factory.

She has borrowed loans from MAXIMA for 3 cycles. The current loan amount is $300. She will use this loan to buy silk materials and thread and she also will use some money to repair her house’s wall. So far she has not had any problem with repayment. She has the ability to repay the loan.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials &  thread.

loans.name: Uche

texts.en: Uche O. is married with four children. She is 32 years of age and hails from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been a member of LAPO for 4 years. She sells provisions and is requesting a loan of $325 so that she can further expand her micro-business. Uche is hard-working and has about 4 years' experience in running her little grocery store.

loans.use: To expand the inventory of her little grocery store

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Mrs. Seng, 35, is a housewife. She assists her farmer husband to work a plot of farmland to grow vegetables. She earns $5 per day in revenue. She has 5 children, one of whom is a student while the other 4 are employed. Two of her children earn $5 per day selling water, and two are construction workers earning $4 per day.

Mrs Seng is requesting this loan in order to dig a well and purchase a water pump to water her family's crops. She will also use the loan to buy seeds. Her husband is pictured in the photo on their plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and a water pump for a newly dug well.

loans.name: Silvestre Juan

texts.es:
Silvestre comes from a large and humble family who, due to their low economic resources, found himself needing to abandon his higher studies to dedicate himself to artistic vocation and craftsmanship. Now with his family established, he devotes himself to creating incomparably beautiful works of clay. The wish of this exemplary father and unbeatable son is to increase the quantity and variety of his merchandise in order to ultimately expand his production and market presence to exportation. He hopes to obtain the economic benefits to offer a higher quality of life to his beloved family. To achieve his objectives, this hard-working family man is requesting a loan, promising to repay your important help in a span of eight months. Let’s work together toward this noble goal so that Silvestre can develop his work with talent and love.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Silvestre proviene de una numerosa y humilde familia, quién debido a los bajos recursos económicos que tenía su familia se vió en la necesidad de abandonar sus estudios superiores para dedicarse a la labor artesanal por su especial vocación artística.Ahora con su familia ya establecida se dedica a la elaboración de hermosos e incomparables trabajos hechos de arcilla. El deseo de este ejemplar padre e insuperable hijo es aumentar la cantidad y variedad de su mercadería, con el fin de expandir su producción aún más en el mercado hasta lograr su exportación y obtener mayor beneficio económico para ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su querida familia.Para cumplir con sus objetivos este trabajador padre de familia solicita un préstamo con el compromiso de retornar vuestra importante ayuda en un lapso de ocho meses. “ Colaboremos con este noble afán para que Silvestre siga desarrollando su labor con mucho talento y amor".

loans.use: Increase quantity and variety of his products

loans.name: Chukiluoda Shg Group

texts.en:
Teresa A. is an average Kenyan housewife, kept busy by the demands of caring for three children of her own, three young relatives, and one child orphaned by HIV/AIDS. To help her husband out with the costs of daily life, she started a fruit stand in 2000. Seasonal fruit prices meant it was difficult for her to regularly stock her fruit stand, and she had to give up on the business. Her husband gave her the start up capital to begin another small business, this time selling charcoal. 

Most people in the rural parts of Kenya buy charcoal or kerosene on a regular basis as they have no access to electricity. Teresa now sells ten large bags of charcoal per day, each one with a retail value of about ten US dollars. The profits from her charcoal business have enabled her to start selling kerosene, which she buys in bulk from the oil companies and sells in small quantities to rural households. The capital from her loan will enable her to buy larger quantities of kerosene from the oil companies, which gives her a reduced price per liter. Currently she purchases 40 liters for one week of sales. With the help of her loan, she will be able to purchase 160 liters per week.

loans.use: To purchase kerosene in bulk

loans.name: Vick

texts.en: Vick owns a restaurant where she sells food and drinks. She is 34 years old and married with one child. She is from Uromi in Edo State, Nigeria. Vick needs the loan of $875 to buy a fridge and small generator. She has been an LAPO member for 3 years.

loans.use: To buy a fridge and a small generator

loans.name: Francelia 1 Group

texts.es:
Oralia is 48 years old and has three children. For the past three years she has worked selling perfumes and sandals. She distributes this merchandise in the state capital. The income gained from this business is allocated to supporting family expenses and investing in merchandise. With the requested loan Oralia would like to purchase more merchandise and thus spend less on the commute to the city. The other members of her group -- Normayda P. and Yuridia P. -- also work with Oralia. Juanita P. runs a butcher's shop.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

ORALIA TIENE 48 AÑOS , TIENE 3 HIJOS, DESDE HACE 3 AÑOS SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PERFUMES Y DE SANDALIAS MERCANCIA QUE DISTRIBUYE EN LA CAPITAL DEL ESTADO, LAS GANANCIAS LAS DESTINA AL APOYO EN EL GASTO FAMILIAR Y A LA INVERSION DE SU MERCARCIA, CON EL CREDITO QUIERE REALIZAR UNA COMPRA MAYOR DE MERCANCIA Y ASI GASTAR MENOS EN EL TRANSPORTE HACIA LA CIUDAD DE TUXTLA GUTIERREZ LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO NORMAYDA PÉREZ Y YURIDIA PÉREZ SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO, JUANITA PÉREZ TIENE UNA CARNICERIA.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise in order to obtain more income

loans.name: Assi

texts.en:
Assi A. is 36 years old and the married mother of 3 children, the oldest of whom is enrolled in primary school. With difficulty she supports the needs of her children and gives what is left to her husband, who is a night guard and cannot cover the expenses of his family. Mrs. A. sells peanuts, manioc flour (an underground plant that is indigenous to Togo), and sugar from a stall that she opened in Avetonou, a village located 120 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With her loan, Mrs. A. would like to buy 10 bags of peanuts, 5 sacks of powdered sugar, and 2 sacks of manioc flour. These purchases will permit her to increase her sales, earn more money, and respond to the needs of her children.

Assi A. est âgée de 36 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont la première sur les bancs de l’école primaire. Elle supporte difficilement les besoins de ses enfants étant donné que la rémunération de son mari qui est gardien de nuit n’arrive pas à couvrir les charges de la famille. Madame A. est revendeuse des arachides, de la farine du manioc (une plante à tubercule qui est indigène au Togo) et du sucre qu’elle installe sous une baraque à Avetonou, un village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle désire acheter avec ce crédit 10 bols d’arachides, 5 sacs de sucres en poudre et 2 sacs de farines de maniocs. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses ventes, gagner plus et répondre aux besoins de ses enfants.

loans.use: To buy 10 bags of peanuts, 5 sacks of powdered sugar, and 2 sacks of manioc flour

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en: Naseem M. was born in a small city, known as Vehari in Pakistan, but some twenty years ago moved to another small city, Mian Channu, with her family. She owns a small, one room brick mud house here in Mian Channu. She has ten kids: five boys and five girls. She has been Asasah’s client for two years, and this year, she requires a loan to buy her son a donkey cart. Naseem’s husband makes hand-embroidered clothes to make a living. There are few other women who have also joined Naseem in her loan group. They are Halima B., who wants to expand her cosmetics shop; Hanifa B., who wants to buy a donkey cart; Naseem B., who has a pickle business; Zahida B., who is borrowing for her family’s furniture business; and Zahida Z., who will invest her share of loan in her clothing business.

loans.use: Buy her son a donkey cart

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
R. Muhabbat is 29 years old. She is divorced, though she has a wonderful son from her marriage. Currently she is living with her parents. Muhabbat is a market vendor: she sells clothing for men, including sport suits, shirts, trousers, suits, and other such clothes, in the local market. Muhabbat has been in this business for 8 years already, and she is proud to say that she works very hard to provide her dear son a quality education and to make him happy. Over the course of the past 8 years, she has managed to stabilize her business and to generate considerable profits, thereby providing the main source of income for Muhabbat’s family and supporting her parents.

At present, Muhabbat is planning to expand her business and, in order to do so, she will need to increase her working capital in order to purchase new clothing to sell. With this purpose in mind, Muhabbat is requesting $600 over a 4-month term. As a repeat client of IMON with a positive credit history, Muhabbat promises to repay the current loan promptly and thanks all for supporting her.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing new goods to sell at the market.

loans.name: Anju Kumari

texts.en:
Mrs. Anju Kumari T., 26 years old, is a tailor in the town of Kuleshwor. Her husband's name is Hari Bahadur T.. She has two sons, both of whom are studying in primary school. Anju opened her tailoring shop 3 years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies' dresses like the Kurta Sulwar, which are very popular with Nepali women. Before starting her own business, Mrs. T. took a 6 month training course in tailoring from a tailor shop near her.

Anju is requesting for a Rs 15000.00 loan to use to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. She wants to use the shop's income for self improvement and for her sons’ education. In Nepal the cost of good education is very high and Mrs. T. is saving her income to provide good education for her sons.

loans.use: Anju would like to buy raw materials for her work as a tailor and seamstress.

loans.name: Providence Group

texts.en:
Abdul A. K. is 30 years old and married with three children. He sells soft drinks in the Sierra Leone town of Magburaka, and has been running his business for four years. With his previous loans from SMT, he has increased his stock and profits. Abdul's business is the main source of income for his family, and he is requesting another loan to further expand his business.

Abdul is the leader for "Providence" group, which has been working together for two years. The group also includes: Aminata C., who sells second hand clothes; Hannah K., who sells cosmetics; Foday K., who runs a general store; and Alex T., who sells clothes. The group is requesting a loan so each can increase inventory and profits for their business.

loans.use: Increase stock of soft drinks, cosmetics and clothes

loans.name: Wema

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Wema is a twenty-nine-year-old woman from Dar es Salaam. As she is divorced, she is solely responsible for supporting her nine-year-old son, Ally. She is a new entrepreneur who established a business selling traditional African cloth called batik only six months ago. Tanzanian women buy her cloth to wear as vitenge, which is the traditional outfit worn by local women.

Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with wax print, printed by using rotary printing machines. Most often, it is a multicolored, dark wax print on a lighter background. Kitenge is also a communicating textile - the various colors, patterns, writings and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people.

Wema currently earns about US$ 60 per month from the sale of her cloth. She is requesting a loan of US$ 275 to purchase for her store additional stocks of cloth in bulk, which she will then retail for a profit. She is hopeful that this loan will enable her to increase the quantity and stock of her business.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence the poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client.

The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase supplies of cloth in bulk for her store

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
La Señora Juana Maria M. tiene 39 años de edad, habita en el Barrio Villa Reconciliación del distrito seis de Managua, su compañero de vida trabaja como conductor y ayuda para las necesidades del hogar, tiene 2 hijas en edad escolar, (a esta señora en el crédito anterior de Kiva, se le falleció uno de sus hijos) 
Doña Juana Maria tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación, donde ofrece productos básicos para el hogar, su mayor clientela la tiene en todo su entorno, inicio su negocio hace quince años con capital propio  e inventario muy poco, su mayor anhelo es ver crecer su negocio para una mejor atención a sus clientes, es por eso que solicita este préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de consumo básico y poder ampliar la diversidad de su oferta.
texts.en:
Señora Juana Maria M. is 39 years old and lives in the Villa Reconiliación neighborhood of the 6th district of Managua. Her life companion works as a conductor and helps with the necessities of the house. She has 2 daughters of school age (since the previous loan from Kiva, one of her children passed away) Señora Juana Maria has a store in her house, where she offers basic products for the home. She gets most of her clientele from her local area. She started the business fifteen years ago with her own capital and very little inventory. Her greatest wish is to see her business grow to give better attention to her clients. Therefore she requests this loan to invest in the purchase of basic consumer goods and to be able to expand the diversity of her offerings.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic consumer goods for her general store.

loans.name: Geck Taing Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Geck T., 42, sells food. She sells rice and and other food products to students at a secondary school in her village, earning approximately around US$3.00 a day. She has been selling since 2005. Her husband, Mr. Chanbo Chring, 43, is motorcycle-taxi-driver. They have two children, all of whom attend school. Geck lacks capital to cover her business operation. Hence, she decided to ask for a loan of US$250 to buy food ingredients to improve her business. The loan will help increase their income to support the daily expenses.

Geck is group leader with three members who will use the KIVA loan and are responsible to pay it back. Mrs. Sophorn C., 41, also sells food products and is requesting US$250 to purchase additional food products for resale. Mrs. Rin Heng, 43, sells food and rice at the secondary school in her village. Rin is requesting a loan of US$250 to purchase food ingredients to stock her shelves for resale.
     
They all live in the Rattanak Commune, Battambang Province.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients for resale

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate O. is 43 years old and married with 5 children. Kate lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She sells eggs and chicken. She has been in this business for a long time. Kate loves this business because she makes a lot of profit from it. She needs the loan amount of N52,000 to purchase more eggs and chicken to sell. She is a client of LAPO (Kiva's Field Partner). She expresses her appreciation to Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs and chicken to sell

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe danaya sont des femmes mariées vivant en général dans des foyers polygames avec en moyenne quatre (4) enfants. Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et résident toutes à selingué.

Spécialisées dans la vente de céréales, elles s’approvisionnent sur les marchés de selingué et ceux des villages environnants chaque semaine. Ensuite le stock ainsi constitué est cédé à des grossistes venant de Bamako.
Avec ce prêt de 50.000FCFA par femme, elles comptent acquérir  500  kilogrammes  de céréales et de grains d’arachide. Le bénéfice moyen mensuel est estimé à 15.000 FCFA qui leur permetra de régler leurs dépenses quotidiennes familiales et de payer les interets du prêt..
texts.en:
The members of this Danaya group are married women living in general in polygamous families with on average 4 children. They met because they are neighbors, all residing in Selingué.

Specialized in selling cereals, they do their buying every week in the markets of Selingué and those of neighboring villages. Then the stocks that they have put together are turned over to wholesalers coming from Bamako (the capital of Mali).

With this loan of 50,000 F CFA per member, they expect to be able to buy 500 kg of cereals and peanuts. The average monthly profit is estimated to be 15,000 F CFA which will allow them to cover their daily family expenses and make repayments on the loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy peanuts, condiments, and cereals

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a 51-year-old widow who lives in Tyre, in southern Lebanon, with her five children. Sabah has been selling clothes and underwear from her house since 1983. She sells clothes, underwear, bridal outfits, and pajamas. 

Sabah has requested a loan of $1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase winter pajamas, socks and other merchandise. Sabah has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time. 

Sabah is the breadwinner of her family. Sometimes, she receives financial support for her son. Her other children are also helpful. For example, they take her place in her store when she is away. 

Sabah's business is distinguished, because she has low prices, she works from home, and she also provides credit  for her clients, who are friends, family and neighbors. When she first started her business, some of her family members helped her reach out to retail stores. She decided to start her business to support her family after her husband's death.

loans.use: Sabah needs the loan to purchase winter pajamas, socks and other merchandise.

loans.name: Maritza Natividad

texts.es:
Maritza D. como toda mujer nicaragüense es muy trabajadora con el propósito de llevar el sustento a sus tres pequeños hijos. Ella se desempeña en el mercado la Estación de la ciudad de León por medio de la venta de verduras las cuales las inicia a comercializar desde muy tempranas horas por la mañana.

Hoy en día ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito  que le permita la compra de las verduras para su respectiva comercialización en el mercado y de esta forma continuar con el mantenimiento de su familia e hijos que tanto requieren de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Maritza D., like every Nicaraguan woman, is very hard-working with the aim of supporting her three young children. She works in the Estación market in the city of León selling vegetables, which she starts to sell starting very early in the morning. Today she is seeking support with Ceprodel for a credit so she can buy vegetables to sell in the market and in this way continue to support her family and children that need her support so much.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy has owned a small grocery store in the Tengeru neighborhood of Arusha for 9 years. She belongs to the Utii loan group (group code 2040). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $185. Every day she works at her business from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more grocery items for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Teddy is married, and has two children, ages 15 and 10.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for her business

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es:
Braulio es chofer de una camioneta en la cual reparte cerveza trabaja con su cuñado, su esposa tiene una carnicería donde vende carne de vaca, carne de pollo y refrescos y con ambos ingresos mantienen a su familia y cubren los estudios de su hijo; vive en alquiler en la casa de su prima que esta ubicada en la calle 7 de octubre de la zona de Rió Seco de la ciudad de El Alto. 

El crédito lo destinara para la compra arroz, azúcar, verduras y demás que nenecita para la tienda y así subirá sus ingresos. 

Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Braulio drives a beer distribution van; he works with his brother-in-law. His wife has a meat market where she sells beef, chicken and soft drinks. With their combined incomes they support their family and pay for their son's education. Braulio rents his home, which is located in the Rio Seco section of the town of El Alto, from his cousin. The loan will be used to buy rice, sugar, vegetables and other items needed for the store thereby increasing their profits. His evaluation shows that he qualifies for this, his first loan with Impro.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, vegetables and other items for his wife's store.

loans.name: Wema Group

texts.en:
Veronica has been a clothes (Vitenge) seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for four years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $350. Each day she works at her business for 10 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so she can buy more clothes to sell. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Veronica is married, and has five children: ages 25, 22, 18, 16 and 3. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Lucy, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: Buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.es: Emperatriz tiene 20 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en casa de su suegra. Desde hace un año se dedica la venta de productos lácteos mediante viajes que realiza a la ciudad capital (Lima) cada quincena de mes, llevando quesos, leche, yogurt, entre otros productos a pedido de su clientela. Emperatriz se ha provisto de un puesto de ventas hace 2 meses en Lima donde vende estos productos y la atención que brinda es durante todo el día. Ella realiza este negocio individualmente y su centro de abastecimiento es una tienda que vende al por mayor y le ofrece menores precios. Para más adelante, Emperatriz está planeando mejorar y agrandar su puesto de ventas. Es la primera vez que viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, ha sido invitada a formar parte de un banco comunal porque vieron en ella a una persona muy emprendedora y capaz de trabajar en equipo. El dinero que requiere es para la compra de más productos lácteos, los que le servirán para seguir y potenciar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Emperatriz is 20 years old and lives with her husband and son in her mother-in-law’s home. She has been selling milk products for a year, traveling to the capital city (Lima) the 15th of each month, taking cheeses, milk, yogurt, and other products according to her customer’s orders. Emperatriz has had a sales stand for 2 months in Lima where she sells these products and she works her stand all day. She began this business by herself and her product source is a store that sells wholesale and offers her low prices. In order to succeed, Emperatriz is planning to expand her sales stand. This is the first time that she is seeking a loan from MFP; she has been invited to be part of a communal bank because they saw in her a hard-working person capable of working in a team. The money will be used to buy more dairy products which will allow her to continue and increase her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more dairy products

loans.name: Francy

texts.es:
Francy  es socia del  bancomunal Virgen de las Mercedes.
Francy es conviviente tiene 40 años, cuatro hijos de 23, 15, 14 y 9 años, los tres menores están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Francy  trabajando en una tienda con su tío, le enseño el negocio hasta que se independizó, empezó haciendo presupuestos  sin compromiso y fue formando su cartera de clientas, ella  se contacto con clientes que tienen hoteles, los cuales le da servicio de decoración de cortinas y otros, también  hace decoraciones cuando hay eventos, tiene dos personas que trabajan para ella cuando es temporada alta.  
Francy necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de accesorios para las cortinas, rieles, soportes, cordones.
Desdés que esta en Finca cuenta con  más capital de trabajo, antes ella no daba crédito a sus clientes, es una entidad que se preocupan por que ahorres con un propósito. 
El sueño de francy es  ver a sus hijos perfecciónales  y poner una tienda de decoraciones.
texts.en:
Francy is a member of the Virgen de las Mercedes community bank. Forty years old, she is a common-law wife. She has four children, ages 23, 15, 14, and 9. The three younger children are studying in the public school. When she worked in a store with her uncle, he taught her the business. She began to give free estimates and establish a base of customers. She has contact with hotel owners, for whom she decorates with curtains and other items. She also decorates for special events. She has two part-time employees who help her when she has a great deal of work. Francy needs a loan of $350 to purchase assessories for curtains: rods, brackets, and cords. Since she began to work with FINCA, she counts on more capital for her business. Previously, she did not grant credit to her customers. Her need for capital is worrisome because the capital is needed for her business. Her dream is to see her children become professionals and to have a store devoted to interior design.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Francy needs a loan of $350 to purchase curtain accessories: rods, brackets, and cords.

loans.name: Nhoem

texts.en:
Nhoem M. was born in 1952 and is a resident in the rural area of Pursat Province, Cambodia. His wife, Chim Morn(pictured) is aged 56. The couple are rice cultivators and they will use the loan money on Kiva to purchase a cow to plow their farmland in order to grow crops during the farming season. 

Beside the farming business, Nhoem M. also catches fish to sell and to cook for the family’s meals. The family now have three children: one is single and two are married and live independently. One of their sons is employed as a local construction worker.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to plow their farmland

loans.name: Elvis Jose

texts.es: Elvis, acompañado con la Sra. Guadalupe U., ambos trabajan en la Universidad Agraria (UNA) con 8 años de servicio, tienen una niña la que todavia no esta en edad escolar, él tiene una hija de su matrimonio anterior quien vive con su mamá, esta estudiando 1er año de secundaria, le apoya con los utiles escolares, medicamentos, ropa y una cuota mensual, ambos tienen horario de 8 a 5 p.m. de miercoles a Domingos, ademas brinda servicios de contabilidad a Reposteria Hoblan y Hermandad Gogar de anciandos donde le pagan U$.150.00.  Esta solicitando su 8vo credito el que utilizara para las reparacion del piso de un anexo que hizo para la cocina en su vivienda, el cual  mide 6m x 1.80 mts, ya habia sido construido con el credito anterior, aunque no fue por el fondo KIVa, este quedo en pesimas condiciones con un desnivel que cuando llueve el agua del patio se mete a la casa, por lo que le urge realizar la reparacion. Expresa que garacias a AFODENIC posee una vivienda digna para su familia y piensa seguir trabajando porque esta institucion ofrece a los asalariados mejores beneficios.
texts.en:
Elvis and señora Guadalupe U. have both worked at the Universidad Agraria (UNA) for eight years. They have a daughter who is not yet old enough to attend school. Elvis also has a daughter from a previous marriage who lives with her mother and is in first year of high school. He provides her with school supplies, medicines, clothing, and a monthly allowance. Both Elvis and Guadalupe work from 8am to 5pm Wednesday to Sunday. He also provides accounting services to the Hoblan Bakery and Association Gogar for Seniors who pay him US$150. This is his eighth loan, and he will use it to repair the floor in a room adjacent to the kitchen in his house. The floor measures 6m x 1.80m and was built using a previous loan, although not with Kiva. It is now in a dreadful condition; the uneven floor allows water from the patio to enter the house when it rains, so repair is urgently needed. Elvis says that because of Kiva partner, AFODENIC, he now has a decent house for his family, and he intends to continue working with this institution because it offers good benefits to working people.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Floor repair

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Ii Group

texts.en:
The committee Mujeres Unidas II formed on November 4, 2008, thanks to the director of the group, Mrs. Elba S., who works selling jewelry and accessories. She contacted a loan officer who worked in the area in order to find out more about the program Women Entrepreneurs. She was then able to group 17 women who liked to work together.  They are now in their third loan cycle, and work together in a supportive way. 

The credit for each woman goes toward her respective small business. They all participate in additional activities in order to save as a group, and to mutually help each other achieve their common goals, both individual and as a group. 

1.	Elba S.-	Accessory and jewelry sales 
2.	Amelia C.-	Food sales
3.	Lourdes Fernández-	Accessory and jewelry sales 
4.	Luciana M.-	General sales
5.	Rafaela  E.-	Fruit and vegetable sales 
6.	Segunda R.-	Food sales 
7.	Juliana A.-	Cosmetics sales 
8.	Sara R.- 	Cosmetics and undergarments sales 
9.	Zulma F.-	Fruit sales 
10.	Emilia S.-	Food sales 
11.	Luisa R.-	Food sales 
12.	Marta C.-	Food and candy sales 
13.	Bernarda R.-	Food sales 
14.	María Martínez-	Fruit sales 
15.	Michel C.-	Accessory and jewelry sales 
16.	Sebastiana P.-	Candy, oil and CD sales 
17.	Regina D. P.-	Food sales

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise for sale or of raw materials

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam S. is a micro-entrepreneur and a Tanzanian married woman with three school-aged children.

Mariam runs a food retail shop at Yombo Buza Ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells a variety of produce at her shop including wheat flower, maize flower, beans, sugar, cooking oil and other items. She purchases the business goods direct from the producers and others from Kariakoo and from Buguruni city market food shopping center. Her business has employed one worker.

Mariam has been in the business for six years and the business income is used to meet her daily family needs including paying school fees.  Her future plan is to run a wholesale food shop. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 800,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Anorchon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
    Анорчон - 26 лет. Недавно вышла замуж, детей пока не имеет, но она беременна и готовится стать матерью. Её муж занимается скотоводством. Анорчон занимается продажей женской и детской одежды на рынке Фаровон города Гафурова. Она не ездит за товаром сама, ей привозят соседи по бизнесу. Она заказывает определенный вид товара, на этот раз она заказала школьную форму и для этого просит займ. Анорчон хочет поработать хотя бы до родов, чтобы накопить деньги для расходов будущего ребенка.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Anorchon is 26 years old. She has recently married, does not yet have children, but she is pregnant is is getting ready to become a mother. Her husband does animal husbandry. Anorchon sells women's and children's clothing on the Favoron market in the town of Gafurov. She does not travel to buy merchandise, her business neighbors bring it to her. She orders a specific type of merchandise and this time she ordered school uniforms and is asking for a loan for this reason. Anorchon wants to work until she gives birth so she can save money for the expenses of future baby.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school uniforms

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky A. is from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 36 years old, and is married with six school-aged children. To make a living, Vicky owns and operates a clothing business. The main source of income for the business comes from peddling new clothes to local community members. Vicky has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Vicky joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vicky has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes B. is married and has three children. She has received senior high school education. Agnes bakes and sells bread at Abrodzirum near Shama-kedzi, which she has been doing since 2004. Her husband is a trader. Agnes uses her income for payment of fees and for the welfare of her family. Agnes will use this loan to purchase more flour and other ingredients to increase production at her bakery. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to save to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase flour and other ingredients for a bakery

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy D. C. is a rice grower on a 1.5-hectare (3.75-acre) rice farm in Norala, South Cotabato in Mindanao. The income he makes from growing rice has evidently helped his family to buy food, clothing and other basic needs.

Jimmy would like to ask for a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to help grow his rice plants well and to buy farm necessities. The loan will really help him so that he no longer needs to go for loans to loan sharks who put high interest rates on their loans.

loans.use: To use for farm financing

loans.name: Holman Antonio

texts.es: El señor Holman Hernández de 36 años de edad, casado y con tres hermosos hijos que su esposa procreo, estudiantes para sobresalir en la vida con mejores oficios. Reside en el bario Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, su oficio es de conductor con ocho años de experiencia trabaja mas de las ocho horas para lograr tener un mejor ingresos con las horas extra. Con este financiamiento comprara materiales como: cemento, arena y otros para repellar las paredes de su vivienda y lograr una mejor vista en su casa ya que espera poderla pintar en este mes de diciembre para que este bonita y que su familia este contenta. Espera seguir haciendo aumento en su casa es por eso paga en fecha y tiempo para conservar el record crediticio en la institución el cual agradece por la oportunidad a través de estos prestamos.
texts.en:
Señor Holman Hernández, age 36, is married with three beautiful children that his wife gave birth to. His children study in order to excel in life with better jobs. He lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. He has eight years of experience working as a driver. He works more than eight hours a day in order to succeed in obtaining higher earnings with the extra hours.

With this loan he will buy cement, sand, and other materials in order to plaster the walls of his house. He wants to provide a better surface in his house because he hopes to be able to paint it in December so that it is beautiful and his family is happy. He hopes to continue making improvements to his house and to make his payments on time in order to preserve his credit record with the institution. He is thankful for the opportunity offered by these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials for plastering walls

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua is 50 years old. She is divorced and the mother of four children with two currently pursuing education in primary school. She lives with her children in an old family house. She sells plantain, rice, maize and groundnuts in the community market. She buys her goods from the farmers in the surrounding villages. She has been in business for four years. She wants a loan to buy stock in bulk so that she can cut down on costs such as the frequent trips to procure her supplies. Akosua wants to maximize her profits to support her children in school.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuff in bulk.

loans.name: Duger

texts.en:
N. is 47 years old and lives with her husband and two of her four children in a house in the Zavkhan province of Mongolia. Her two older children, ages 22 and 20, live and work in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her third child, who is 18 years old, attends the university, while her youngest child, 8 years old, attends a local secondary school.

Her husband is a construction worker in the summer months, and he helps N. with her business during the winter months. She operates a mobile food business in her town, selling food to office staffs. She began her business in 2000 and is now planning to open a café. N. is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (Mongolian Tugrik - MNT) loan so that she can furnish the room which has been added onto her house recently, and will serve as a café. XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest micro-finance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To furnish the new cafe room

loans.name: Antonieta Albertina

texts.es:
La señora Antonieta es socia del  Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”, en el distrito de Pomata, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 19 años de edad y actualmente es conviviente;  está estudiando Enfermería Técnica. Ella se dedica la venta de alimentos.

Este es su primer crédito, ella rquiere S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, para comprar chuño, papa, truchas para la elaboración de sus platos.

Su deseo es terminar sus estudios de enfermería técnica, además tener un puesto propio ya que el puesto en el que está es de su tío, y tiene que cambiar de turno con su suegra.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la responsabilidad, la unión entre las compañeras ya que no existe la discriminación y el trato es por igual.
texts.en:
Antonieta, 19, is a member of the “Medalla Milagrosa” (Miraculous Medal) communal bank in the Pomata district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She lives with her life partner and is studying to be a vocational nurse. She sells food. This is her first loan; she needs 500 new soles to buy chuño (dehydrated potato), potatoes and trout for her dishes. Her wish is to finish her nursing studies and to have her own stall because the one she uses is her uncle's and she has to share shifts with her mother-in-law. What she most likes about the communal bank is the responsibility and the unity among her group members because there is no discrimination and everyone is treated equally.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chuño (dehydrated potato), potato, and trout.

loans.name: Orfelina De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Orfelina D. Jesús, socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Creativas”, Distrito D. Moyobamba, Provincia D. Moyobamba, Departamento D. San Martín, es Viuda, tiene 62 años y es madre D. 06 hijos, todos ya independientes.
Orfelina D. Jesús, lleva varios años dedicándose a la venta D. verduras, se encuentra ubicada  en el Mercado Central D. su Distrito, donD. cuenta con un ambiente, muy bien acondicionado, para  atender a sus clientes. Las ventas que diariamente realiza, le ha valido para ir mejorando su negocio y aumentando sus productos.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500.00, comprará verduras regionales como: Lechugas, zanahorias, hierba buena, paltas, ojos y cebollas en kilos, Plátanos en racimos, así satisfacer el exigente pedido D. su clientela.
Orfelina, se siente muy orgullosa por el trabajo, que realiza día a día, el buen producto que venD. le ha proporcionado clientela fiel que compra todos los días. 
Pese a su edad se siente con mucho valor D. seguir trabajando y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por el apoyo incondicional a mujeres como ella, que quieren salir adelante y generar sus propios ingresos.
texts.en:
Ms. Orfelina D. Jesus is a member of the Mujeres Creatives (Creative Women) Communal Bank in the Moyobamba district and province, department of San Martin. She is a 62-year-old widow with 6 grown children. Orfelina D. Jesus has been selling produce for several years. Her stand is located in her district’s Central Market, where she has a business space that is well-suited for attending to customers. Her daily sales have helped her improve her business and increase her inventory.

With this 1,500.00 PEN loan, she will purchase local produce like: lettuce, carrots, spearmint, avocados, garlic and onions by the kilo, and plantains by the bunch so that she can meet customer demand.

Orfelina feels very proud of her daily work. Her quality products have earned her customers’ loyalty. Despite her age, she feels that she has the courage to continue working, and she is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for the unconditional support that they give to women like her who want to get ahead in life and earn their own living.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more produce

loans.name: Fany

texts.es:
La socia es natural de la ciudad de Urcos de la provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco. Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qori Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa. El nombre del banco es de origen de la lengua Quechua que traducido al español significa “Cerro de Oro”. Cusco antiguamente, fue la capital del Imperio Inca y una de las ciudades más importantes del Virreinato del Perú. Declarada Patrimonio de la Humanidad y capital arqueológica de América 

Nuestra socia FANY tiene 43 años, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos y son: Giovanna tiene 23 años y estudia para técnico de computación e informática y Andy tiene 15 años y esta en el cuarto grado de secundaria. La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de cerveza en su domicilio. La socia también es promotora de espectáculos folclóricos contrata artistas musicales como “Sonia Morales”, “Dina Paucar” y muchos más artistas. Ya son varios años que tiene el negocio y le ha ido muy bien, gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más gaseosas y cervezas. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

La ciudad de Urcos se encuentra ubicada a 45 km del Cusco siguiendo la carretera asfaltada a Puno, es un pequeño poblado con una hermosa laguna donde, según la leyenda, Huascar lanzó una enorme cadena de oro para evitar que los españoles se la llevaran.
texts.en:
The member was born in the town of Urcos, province of Quispicanchis in the provincial department of Cuzco. She belong to the "Qori Orcco" Community Bank of the Arariwa Association. The name of the bank means "Golden Hill" in the Quechua language. Cuzco was once the capital of the Inca Empire and one of the most important cities of Colonial Peru. It was declared Heritage of Mankind and Archeological capital of the Americas.

Our member Fany is 43 years old and a single mother. Her children are Giovanna, a 23 year old who is studying towards her technical degree in IT and Andy, a 15 year old who is in the 10th grade. The member alternates her household chores with the sale of beer from her house. She is also a promoter of folk shows and hires musical artists such as Sonia Morales, Dina Paucar among many others. She has had this business for several years and it is going very well thanks to all hard work. Our member is a working mother and an interpreneur who provides for her family. She requests the loan to buy more sodas and beer.

The member is thankful for this opportunity and will comply with the scheduled repayments.

The city of Urcos is located 45km from Cuzco through the highway to Puno. It is a small village with a beautiful lagoon where, according to the legend, Huascar threw an enormous gold chain to prevent the Spaniards from taking it.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sodas and beer

loans.name: El Mamón Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Mamón está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedoras y luchadoras que laboran arduamente. Una de ellas es la señora Filena del Rosario N. N.  quien elabora zapatos.

Este oficio lo aprendió desde muy temprana edad y es una tradición que ha pasado en generación en su familia. Aun recuerda el primer zapato que izo el cual  dice que dodo muy mal pero con la práctica fue mejorando mucho hasta convertirse en una maestra en este trabajo.

Sus compañeras de grupo realizan distintas actividades María Petrona G. tiene una modesta pulpería la cual sueña en convertir en distribuidora y Modesta P. hace y vende cobertores desde su infancia cuando le ayudaba a su madre.
texts.en:
The group El Mamón is made up of three hard-working, enterprising, and strong-willed women who labor arduously. One of them is Mrs. Filena del Rosario N. N., who makes shoes. She learned this trade at an early age, and it is a tradition that has been passed down from generation to generation in her family. She still remembers the first shoe that she made, which she says turned out poorly, but with practice she got better and better, eventually becoming a master at the job. Her group partners perform different activities. Maria Petrona G. has a modest store, which she dreams about turning into a wholesale distribution company. Modesta P. makes and sells blankets, which she has done since her childhood when she would help her mother.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase leather, glue, nails, thread, soles, etc.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora D. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 56 years old. Leonora is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Leonora sells seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Leonora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Leonora from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
El señor Ignacio B. tiene 27 años de edad es soltero y vive con su madre en la ciudad de Carapeguá. 

Desde los 14 años empezó a salir a vender las colchas que su madre fabrica, al cabo de 6 años se independizó, trabajó  por cuenta propia, hoy día  lleva otros artículos de la zona a venderlos por las ciudades de Villa Elisa y Asunción, transportándose en su camioneta que gracias a este trabajo logró comprar además  servirle de un respaldo económico importante a su madre.
                  
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías (hamacas, frazadas y sábanas) puesto que tiene muchos pedidos de estos productos.
texts.en:
Mr. Ignacio B. is 27 years old, is single, and lives with his mother in the city of Carapeguá. At 14, he started selling the bed covers his mother makes. After six years, he started working on his own and today, he takes products from his region to sell in the cities of Villa Elisa and Asunción, driving himself in the pick-up truck he's been able to purchase thanks to this job and which serves as a financial back-up for his mother. Ignacio requests a loan to buy hammocks, blankets, and bed sheets, products for which he has received many orders.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying hammocks, bed sheets, bedspreads

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
