Fe D. is a married woman who supports her family by fattening pigs to resell and also by selling rice grain. She lives in Bungyod, Cabacungan La Castellana Negros Occidental with her husband and their 8 children who are 23 to 42 years old.  Some of their children have their own families and the single ones are working to help the family.

Fe has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1993 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her pig fattening and selling rice grains business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000.

Fe is now borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she could continue with her pig fattening and rice grains businesses. This will be her 18th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Fe aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and to ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Phuong's Group

texts.en:
Phuong T. X. N. was born in 1978 and lives in Le Phap village with her husband and two children. She is a tailor and also has a store where she sells cake, sweets, beer, etc.

Phuong T. X. N. has taken part in SEDA for five years and has always repaid on time. She is now requesting a new loan of 7,630,000 VND (approximately 400 USD) which will be used to buy a sewing machine and to invest in her store with the hope of a better life.

About the other borrow in her group:

Nhuong T. N. was born in 1958. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VDN to buy scrap iron to resell.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and to invest in her store

loans.name: Isaack Njoroge

texts.en:
Isaack C. is a gentleman who is 31 years old and married to Ann Njoroge, who is 29 years old and a housewife. They have two children: Naomi (5 years old) and Daniel (2 years old). Isaack runs a mobile hawking business moving from market to market selling his commodities which include watches, hair accessories and others. Most of his clients are women. He started this business six years ago.


Isaack was introduced to KADET by an existing client and he does not have a previous credit history. He has borrowed 20,000 Kenyan shillings which he will use to purchase commodities that are in very high demand in the market right now. These include pots "sufurias", cups, trays, etc. He plans to use the extra profit to expand his mobile business. 


Isaack hopes to expand his business so that it becomes a one stop business shop and not a mobile business. He wants to repay all the borrowed money and ask for a bigger loan. He describes himself as a person whose future is in business.

loans.use: To buy some more goods for his hawking business with items like pots, cups, trays and others

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn P. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Rosalyn is married and has five grown children. To make a living, Rosalyn operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling fish to the local community members. Rosalyn has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 15,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosalyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Rosalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Rosalyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rosalyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her fishing business

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.fr: Née en 1980 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, B. Suzanne est mariée à KEGNIDE Boniface, un revendeur. Suzanne est mère de deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé. Suzanne vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari au quartier Lokokoukoumè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Il y a environs huit ans que Suzanne s'est installée dans ce quartier. Suzanne n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer ses multiples besoins et subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants, Suzanne vend depuis cinq ans déjà, des mèches et divers produits de beauté dans sa boutique à Lokokoukoumè. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Suzanne achète ses produits. Suzanne a obtenu antérieurement, deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a tous bien remboursés. Suzanne désire renforcer son activité et élever le niveau de son activité ; ce qui lui permettra de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et aussi d'assurer un bon train de vie à ses enfants. Pour ce faire, Suzanne sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1980 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Ms. B. Suzanne is married to Mr. KEGNIDE Boniface, a retailer.  She is the mother of two children, one of whom is in school. Suzanne lives together with her children and husband in the Lokokoukoumè district in the town of Seme-Podji. She settled in this district about eight years ago. Suzanne never attended school. To meet multiple needs of hers and to provide for her children, she has been selling hair extensions and various beauty products for five years now in her shop in Lokokoukoumè.  Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, is where she purchases her supplies. Suzanne previous obtained two ALIDé loans, both of which she repaid.  She would like to bolster her business and to raise her level of activity.  This will enable her to satisfy her customers further and also to ensure good living conditions for her children.  To do so, Suzanne is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying hair extensions and hair care product

loans.name: Davaajamts

texts.en:
Davaajamts P., 55, is married and the father of two children. He and his family live together in a ger (the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent) in Hovd province, Mongolia. His youngest son, Luvsansharav, is a university student.

With his wife's help, Davaajamts operates a cafe at a local market. He has been operating his business since 2001 and has gained significant experience and built a loyal customers over the past nine years. With his business profit, he has been providing for his family expenses.

Davaajamts has also been paying his son's university fees with the profits from his business. In addition, he was able to purchase a truck for his oldest son, who lives separately from his parents.

Davaajamts has been planning to expand his cafe in order to provide his services to more customers. He is an open person and has many plans for the future. He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to expand and repair his cafe.

loans.use: To expand and renovate his cafe

loans.name: Choum

texts.en: Mr. Choum B. is a 39-year-old married man. He has a school-aged child who depends on him. He lives with other family members in his own small family home in Siem Reap province. Choum B. owns a piece of land that he inherited from his parents. He grows different kinds of crops on his land, such as green beans and potatoes. He sells his crops to buyers every two or three months when the plants mature. In addition, Choum B. and his wife take time to fish around the river for additional profit. As he hopes for a good result in this cultivation season, Choum B. is applying for assistance from Kiva to grow green bean crops.

loans.use: To grow green bean crops.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina M. is currently in the business of selling earrings and necklaces in a shop and is requesting a loan to stock more ornaments to sell.  Regina is 41 years old and is married to a husband who is a driver. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more ornaments to sell

loans.name: Ségni Gbessounde

texts.fr:
C. est âgée de 46 ans, elle a ouvert depuis 2005 un salon de coiffure, pour accroître ses recettes  elle  a associé à son activité la vente de produits de beauté. La demande de sa clientèle en produits de beauté est de plus en plus élevée raison pour laquelle elle voudrait gonfler son stock, elle sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de mèches, tissages, crèmes, défrisants et autres.
Elle est mariée avec un enfant.
texts.en:
Mrs. C. is 46 years old. She opened a hair salon in 2005 and combined cosmetic sales to her activity to increase revenues. Her customers' demand for cosmetics is getting higher and higher; for this reason, she would like to increase her inventory, for which she is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase hair extensions, hair weaves, creams, straighteners and more. She is married and has one child.

Translated from French by Charlotte Buecheler, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita A. is from the village of Mangidkid, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Teresita is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a business selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste, canned goods, noodles, eggs, and soft drinks in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 18,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Teresita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Teresita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 36 años, comparte su vida con su esposo y sus tres hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 3 años que tiene una bodega, actividad a la que se dedica con mucho esfuerzo, además de ser muy estricta y ordenada a la hora de administrar sus ingresos. Su firma de trabajo le ha dado mucha satisfacción, y cada vez que puede lo implementa de más productos, siempre pensando en la necesidad del cliente y en su economía. En un futuro ha pensado en ampliar su tienda e instalar una librería y artículos para el hogar, para así lograr mejores ventas, pues esta actividad es de gran ayuda para la economía familiar. Es su onceavo crédito con MFP y se compromete de a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más productos para así aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Maria is 36 years old. She shares her life with her husband and with their three children, and they own their own home. For more than 3 years she has been running a grocery store. She invests herself in this business with all her strength and she is very organized and disciplined when it comes to administering the business. Her business has provided her with a great deal of satisfaction. Whenever she can she incorporates even more products, all the while trying to anticipate the clients' needs and on the financial situation. In the future she would like to expand the store to also sell books and products for the home. All of this will improve her sales and it will help the family's finances. This is her eleventh loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is committed to the obligations of this loan. With this loan she is requesting she will invest in the purchase of more merchandise to increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to restock her store.

loans.name: Hausilagzam

texts.en:
Hausilagzam S. is 42 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger--a traditional nomadic housing tent--in the Bayan-Ulgiy province of western Mongolia. His eldest, a son, is a student and the younger two children attend a local middle school while his wife manages a food retailing business at a local market called Ahdam. 

He started his transportation business in 2001 with working capital of 500,000 MNT and a Russian-brand small car. For nine successful years in business, Hausilagzam has been able to afford his elder son's tuition fees. He is a modest, hard-working, helpful businessman.  He says, “My only wish is to cover my children's education and have them become good people.” Hausilagzam is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to increase his working capital for their grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase more products

loans.name: Irma Janeth

texts.es: La señora Irma Yaneth  trabaja en una farmacia de la localidad y su esposo el Señor José Ángel trabaja como Taxista, ellos tienen tres hijos, y viven en una casa de interés social, lo que ellos quieren es ampliar la casa para la mayor comodidad de sus hijos, ya que cada uno requiere de su privacidad, ellos han logrado reunir con ahorros una cantidad para empezar la constricción de un cuarto mas en la casa, pero saben que con ese dinero no van a terminar la construcción, es por eso que requieren de este préstamo y de su ayuda.
texts.en:
Irma Yaneth works in a pharmacy in her region and her husband, Jose Angel, is a taxi driver. They have three children together and they live in a house acquired through social housing. What they would like to do is to expand their home to provide greater comfort to their children, each one needs their privacy. With their own savings they have managed to start the construction of a room in the house but they know that they will not be able to complete with their own funds. For this reason they are requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bedroom.

loans.name: Lukundo Group

texts.en:
Flora Kinjami is in her early forties, married, and has 6 children. She has a business selling brooms, potatoes, and onions from Iringa to Moshi which she has been operating since 2005. The business runs between 4am and 10 am and earns Flora quite a low monthly profit.

This will be Flora's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Flora aims to use this loan to increase her capital, buy more products, say twice a month, and to reduce moving upcountry every week. Flora's dream is to one day open a charcoal shop and sell at wholesale price.

Flora will share this loan with her loan group Lukundo, which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. 

In the photo, Flora can be seen in the middle front row wearing a purple and red dress.

loans.use: Increase capital in order to buy more products

loans.name: Elia

texts.es: La Sra.Elia C.  vende ropa usada y elabora platillo los cuales vende el fin de semana, el credito lo solicito para construir un baño para comodidad de sus hijos, el esposo de la señora Elia labora en una compañía de maquinaria pesada, ambos se apoyan mutuamente para mejorar su casa.
texts.en: Mrs. Elia C. sells used clothing and she also makes foods that she sells on the weekends.  The loan she requests will be used to install a bathroom, for her kids' comfort. Her husband is an employee of a heavy equipment company. They both contribute to the maintenance of their household.

loans.use: To install a bathroom in her house.

loans.name: Odhuu

texts.en:
Odhuu B. is 42 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Uvs province in western Mongolia. He lives with his family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent, in a permanent location for the past 7 years. His two children both attend a local secondary school.

He sells firewood and barley flour which he produces in his home, with help of his wife in their town. He started his firewood trading business in 2008, after working as a flour packer in the flour company in Uvs between 2007 and 2008. He has managed to save 1,500,000 MNT in the bank by working in the construction field with help of his son this summer. With his loan plus his bank savings, he is planning to purchase a new car in order to operate a taxi service in his town. For the future, he hopes to plant seabuckthorn. Odhuu is a hardworking and organized man and says, " I want to provide a good education for my children". He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a car that will be used as a taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a car.

loans.name: Elpedio

texts.en:
Elpedio P. is from Prenza Tangub City. He is 21 years old. Elpedio is single. To make a living, Elpedio owns and operates a transportation services business. He has been engaged in his business for more than two years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elpedio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. He is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to repair his vehicle for better service. This will be the second loan taken by Elpedio from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more blouses and slippers

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida L. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Kaungkod, Madredijos, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: pig fattening and a frozen foods business. Her husband, Bernardo L., who is 50 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's businesses. They have four children aged between 15 and 26.
Nida joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past ten loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nida has been gradually lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 22,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 3,000 PHP, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing 29,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase feed and other supplies for her piggery. In this way, she hopes to continue to save up for the future and to sustain their daily needs and give their children a good education.
Nida L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase feed and other piggery supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To produce more rice to sell

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en:
Dominador A. is from the village of District 4. He is 47 years old. Dominador is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Dominador owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Dominador has been engaged in his business for over 11 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Dominador joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dominador is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for services to increase his crop yield. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Dominador from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase his crop yield

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen lives in Mian channu, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, and is known for its agriculture industry. She came here sixteen years ago with her family. She is 47 years old and married to H. M., who has an animal selling business. He purchases young goats from the animal market, raises them up and then sells to his customers. His clientele base is butchers. He sells the goats at a good profit. He also operates a donkey cart and offers loading services to his customers. 

Nasreen herself is a housewife who prefers to stay at home and take care of her household responsibilities. She makes the utmost effort to give comfort to her family by taking care of them. She has two sons. Her elder son works as a helper in a nearby hospital while her younger son is studying in 9th grade.
  
She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy some goats to sell for a profit. Nasreen hopes that after the loan investment her husband’s business will be in a more profitable position and will result in a better financial situation for her family. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she established good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy some goats for selling

loans.name: Amer

texts.ar:
عامر في عمر 22 سنة غير متزوج يعمل في بيع ونقل الخضار والفاكهة له في عمله 6 سنوات دائم الطموح يريد دائما
زيادة اعماله وتوسيعها فهو دائما التجدد وحب العمل يتميز يالجد والصدق في المعاملة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى صيانة البيك اب الذي يعمل من خلاله في نقل الخضار والفاكهة له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه واصدقائه يقصدونه في المواسم
خاصةله خبرة واسعة في هذا المجال ويحلم بأن يصبح صاحب متجر كبير خاص به
texts.en: Amer is 22 years old. He is single and for six years, Amer has been selling and transporting vegetables and fruit. He is ambitious and seeks to expand his business. He constantly seeks development and loves his job. Amer is known for his seriousness and honesty. Through a loan from A. Majmoua, Amer would like to maintain his pick-up truck, which he uses to transport vegetables and fruit. His clients are his acquaintances, neighbors and friends. They seek his products over the different seasons. He aspires to own a large shop through which he can sell his products.

loans.use: Maintenance of his pick-up truck

loans.name: Monica Maribel

texts.es:
La Sra. Mónica Maribel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 38 años y es madre de 01 hijo.
	
Ante la necesidad de aportar a los gastos de su hogar y motivada por ella misma, emprendió su pequeño negocio de Venta de Cosméticos por catálogo (Unique, Avon, Esika, Natura) obteniendo muy buenos resultados desde un inicio. Su negocio se encuentra  ubicado en su misma casa, desde allí ella puede atender los pedidos y también los ofrece casa por casa a sus amistades y conocidos. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y esta muy orgullosa de alcanzar poco a poco sus metas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2500.00, comprará  mas productos de belleza, para tenerlos en stock como: colonias, perfumes, talcos, desodorantes y cremas para damas y caballeros, lápiz labiales y para contornos de ojos , polvos compactos,  y otros productos  mas, todo esto para mantener contenta a su clientela. 

Monica Maribel, se siente muy feliz del negocio que realiza y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por el apoyo que brindan a mujeres que quieren salir adelante,  espera que sigan así siempre y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Mónica Maribel, 38, is a member of the “Los Eucaliptos” communal bank in Tarapoto district, San Martin province.  She is single and has a son.

Due to the need of providing for her household expenses and self-motivated she started her small catalogue cosmetics sales business (Unique, Avon, Esika, Natura) obtaining very good results from the very beginning.  Her business is located in her house.  She takes orders there but also visits house to house to offer her goods to friends and acquaintances.  She is still in the same business and is very proud to have reached her goals little by little.

She will use this 2500 new sol loan to buy more beauty products to have in stock like: colognes, perfumes, talc, deodorants, creams for men and women, lipsticks, eyeliner pencils, compact powders and other products in order to keep her customers happy.

Mónica Maribel feels very happy with the business she’s in and appreciates the Manuela Ramos Movement for the support they give to women who want to get ahead.  She hopes they stay that way always helping many families and enterprising women.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Karla Yanira

texts.es: Karla Yanira P. de 35 años de edad, es una persona muy responsable, la cual cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de las personas que la rodean. Ella reside en el departamento de La Libertad, en donde vive junto a su única hija de 10 años de edad. Karla es muy trabajadora, y se dedica a múltiples actividades para poder llevar el sustento a su mesa, ella elabora tortillas y pupusas, y así mismo todas las tardes se dedica a hacer platillos típicos, de esta manera es como Karla ha logrado contar con todo lo necesario para su hogar, razón por la que solicita un préstamo a Integral, por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima entre las cuales están: maíz para la elaboración de más tortillas y pupusas, queso, frijoles y todo lo necesario para aumentar la producción de su negocio y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Karla Yanira P. is 35 years old.  She is very responsible person who has very good references from the people around her. She lives in the department of La Libertad with her only daughter who is 10 years old.  Karla is very hard-working and is engaged in multiple businesses in order to be able to put food on the table.  She makes tortillas and “puposas” (a popular El Salvadoran dish made of a thick, corn tortilla filled with meats, cheeses, refried beans, and/or pork rinds) In addition, she makes local dishes every evening. This is how Karla has managed to have all she needs for her home.  The reason she is requesting this loan from Integral is to buy a large quantity of premium ingredients such as corn for making tortillas and pupusas, cheese, beans, and all that is necessary to increase her business production and so,  improve her income.

loans.use: To buy premium ingredients for making food.

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Mrs. Pha J. (pictured here) is 32 years old and her husband, Mr. Lekh Lonh, is 31 years old. They have been married since 2001 and have two young children: one son and one daughter. They are living on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Pha is a weaver. Her husband has full-time employment. He is a lathe operator. Pha is asking for a loan of $500 to build a restroom for family use.

loans.use: To build a restroom for family use.

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en:
Hayat is a 58 year old widow who owns a bakery and works on a farm. She lives near Tyre and opened her shop last year. She is the only "saj" (thin pizza) baker in her town. She also makes special "katayef", a Ramadan season sweet.

At the beginning she had financial problems but the fact that she is an expert in her domain and that she works on a farm as well allowed her to provide herself with a more secure living. 

This is her first loan. She is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to buy a bakery machine and tools to open a new branch, as well as for maintenance costs in her shop. In the future, she wishes to open a big bakery and reach a larger number of clients.

loans.use: to buy a bakery machine and tools to open a new branch

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is 42 years old, married to Joseph Kamau and they have seven children. She has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last year. She was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Lydia hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu is a married woman with six children, five boys and one girl, five of whom attend school. They own a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past eight years, she has operated a business selling makuti (palm leaves). She also sells mangrove trees to her local villagers. Mesalimu faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during rainy season when transportation becomes difficult. She dreams of becoming a leading mangrove supplier in the area. 

With the Kshs 80,000 loan, she wants to purchase palm leaves for house roofing and mangrove trees for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase palm leaves for house roofing and mangrove trees for sale

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Mrs. Yun is a 54-year-old farmer who lives in Prey Chor district. She is married to Mr. Bou, age 61. This couple works together in the crop-planting business.  They have been blessed with eight children: three of them are married and five are still single. Three of their children are employed in various occupations to make money. This family is be able to generate an income of approximately $3 a day. 

In a short time ,of their children will marry, but they do not have enough money to hold the ceremony. So Mrs. Yun would like to request a loan from Kiva in order to hold the wedding ceremony for her child.

loans.use: hold a wedding for her child

loans.name: Jorito

texts.en:
Jorito is a 32-year-old fisherman living in Talibon, Bohol. Jorito works hard to support his wife and seven children. He hopes to earn better and be able to sustain his children's education.

Jorito is asking for a loan to to buy hooks, nets and other fishing materials. This loan will help him catch more fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy hooks, nets and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Suad

texts.en:
Suad and her husband have a perfume store selling perfumes that are produced from perfume oil. Suad has three sons. Suad and her husband want to expand the store and start selling accessories. They are maintaining a good reputation and they want to seize the opportunity and attract more clients by starting to sell accessories.

Suad's husband is photographed in the store, as she is a conservative woman from Jabalia Refugee camp.

loans.use: to purchase accessories to sell

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is married and has five children. All five of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.

Milly makes brushes and works six days a week. She has been in this business for the last 30 years. She sells the brushes to schools and to shops around the area. Milly is a teacher by profession. She does part time teaching in nearby schools and this brings some side income, apart from making brushes. 

Milly has requested for a loan of 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more raw  materials for making brushes. Her major business challenge is ever increasing prices of raw materials for making brushes and lack of enough markets for her brushes. She resides in a rented house and her family has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for making brushes.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 20 years old, single and lives with two family members, one of whom works.

Mohamad has had a barber shop since 2006. He has more than eight years experience and has a deep understanding of the local consumer. He is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $1350 loan to renovate his shop. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: To renovate his shop.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 28 years old and single with no child with him. He runs a general merchandise store in Lumley near a neighborhood in Freetown.

Samuel has owned this business for three years and sells soft drinks, bottle wined, Heineken and Cody’s in his store. His business is the only source of income he has. He says that the main challenge to his business is the lack of electricity/power supply.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more items like soft drinks, Heineken and bags of rice. Samuel says that the extra income from this loan will help him increase his savings and maximize profit. In the future, he would like to open a supermarket.   .

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks, Heineken and bottled wine.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 43 years old, married to Francis, and they have three school-going children.  

She has practiced farming for the last eleven years. She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, she hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sumac Maki Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SUMAC MAKI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Katia Marilyn; ella es soltera y tiene 32 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio D. venta D. artesanía, ella hace trabajos D. lana como chalinas, chompas y polos, ella venD. en forma ambulatoria, la socia trabaja desD. las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio D. venta D. artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía al por mayor y también para comprar lana para tejer las chompas y chalinas.


Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio D. venta D. artesanía, negocio D. taller D. mecánica, negocio D. venta D. frutas, negocio D. venta D. maquinaria, negocio D. tienda D. abarrotes.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the group called “Sumac Maki” which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

Sra. Katia Marilyn is 32 years old, single, and has two children. She works in her own crafts business where she makes articles out of wool such as scarves, sweaters, and shirts. Katia sells her goods as a street vendor and works between the hours of 8am and 7pm. Through her business, she has been able to help her children move forward. Katia wants to expand her business of selling crafts, so she is requesting a loan to buy handicrafts in bulk. She will also buy wool for knitting sweaters and scarves.

The other members engage in businesses such as selling handicrafts, operating an auto repair shop, selling fruit, selling machinery, and selling groceries.

Katia is grateful for being part of her group and for being able to fulfill her dream in this manner. She promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts in bulk to sell and wool for knitting sweaters and scarves.

loans.name: Chinzorig

texts.en: Chinzorig is 44 years old and lives with his three children and wife in Tosontsengel in Mongolia. His wife helps the family business and also plants vegetables. He started his family business in 2009 with his wife by selling retail goods and materials. He and his wife used to manage different types of service and micro- businesses. His current family business, a carpentry business, is stable. He is planning to expand his business and to build his own house. He is a diligent and calm man who says, "My eldest daughter is becoming a college student. I need to pay her tuition fee." In the future, he is planning to expand his wife's business by opening a vegetable shop. He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to buy more wood to make furniture.

loans.use: To buy more wood.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca tiene 31 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Alfredo de 32 años y sus 04  queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Rebeca y su esposo lograron que sus parcelas sean áreas verdes, rodeado de árboles frondosos, pues es ahí donde cultiva plantas de cacao y café, actividad que lo ejecuta durante 10 años, asimismo en este trabajo se apoya de los joranleros que contrata o en ocasiones de la ayuda de su familia. Ell desde muy niña aprendió a labrar la tierra, gracias a la enseñanza de sus padres. Su producto más rentable es la venta de café, porque los vende en cantidad  y a un buen precio, y con las ganancias adquiridas logró comprar muchas utilidades para su hogar. La temporada de invierno no es de su agrado por la abundancia de insectos y precipitaciones de lluvia razón por la cual acude a la entidad Financiera para tramitar un crédito y llevar consigo uno de sus propósitos que es combatir la plaga de insectos y cuidar las florecillas de sus plantaciones. Los planes que tiene en mente es seguir sembrando y adquiriendo más espacios de terreno para así sobresalir de la pobreza que convive su familia. Este será su séptimo crédito con MFP, espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, ya que no quiere causar problemas a la entidad financiera y a los socios de su banco comunal  y agradece a los prestamistas por apoyarle en el progreso de su trabajo. Con el dinero que solicita, comprará insumos naturales para combatir la plaga de insectos que perjudica sus sembríos.
texts.en:
31-year old Rebeca is a loving and hardworking mother. She lives in her own house with her 32-year old husband Alfredo and their four beloved children for whom she wishes to provide a better quality of life.

Rebeca and her husband have succeeded in making their land fertile and surrounded by lush trees. This is where she grows cocoa and coffee, work she's been doing for ten years. She also gets help from time to time from labourers who work on contract. Ever since she was little, Rebeca learnt about the land from her parents.Her most profitable crop is coffee as she sells it in large quantities and for a good price. With the money she earns, she has managed to buy many useful items for the home. 

The season she likes the least is winter because of the number of insects and the large amount of rain. This is why she has approached the institution Financiera for a loan to try to overcome the insect infestations and safeguard the blossoms on the crops. 

Rebeca's plan for the future is to continue farming and acquire more land so that she can overcome the poverty in which her family lives. She does not want to cause any problems for the financial institution or for the members of her community bank. She is grateful to the donors for their help with her work. With the money from the loan she plans to buy natural insecticides to overcome the insect infestations which harm her fields.

loans.use: to buy natural insecticides to overcome the insect infestations which affect her fields

loans.name: Onalhan

texts.en:
Onalhan is 45 years old and lives with his children and wife in a ger, a tradiional Mongolian yurt, in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. Two of his children are high school students. His wife has a job. Their other child goes to the kindergarden. 

He started his business in 1995 by selling food and other products at the local market. He is already well positioned in the market. His working capital was increased. He never took a loan from the bank. In 2010, he spent a significant amount of money for medical care. 

He is a diligent man who says "I want to expand my business and increase my turnover." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to buy products for his business.

loans.use: To buy products to sell

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine, 33 years old, is married and supports five people. He does mixed farming, rearing livestock and wheat farming. He has been doing this for the past five years.

He learned about KADET LTD, through a KADET staff. He has applied for his first loan which he plans to  buy seedlings and farm inputs

He hopes to make profit and use it to educate his children. He dreams of expanding his farming.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and farm inputs.

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en: Rodah is a hardworking businesswoman who is 59 years old. She is married and blessed with one child. For the last five years, she has been selling honey to make a living. Her potential customers are passerby and people living in that area. In the next five years, she wants to establish a wholesale business. Rodah is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy honey for resale.

loans.use: To buy honey

loans.name: Nadia

texts.es: Nadia, de 35 años, es una mujer alegre y muy dinámica. Convive con su pareja con quien tiene tres hijos de 7, 5 y 2 años. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. EL trabajo de Nadia, consiste en la venta de comida, ella desde muy temprano sale al mercado a comprar los ingredientes para la elaboración de sus alimentos, ya por las tardes sale a la vereda de su casa y empieza a ofrecer los deliciosos y muy bien preparados Juanes, tacachos, asados de pollo y cerdo. Tiene dos años realizando este trabajo,  y lo hace sola ya que sus hijos aún son muy pequeños y su pareja llega de trabajar tarde. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite dar un tiempo a su hogar, es decir puede cuidar a sus hijos, ya que están en una etapa que necesitan mucho cuidado. Le esta yendo bien en su trabajo pues a diario vende mucho y espera poder mantenerse y poco a poco implementar su negocio. Este será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, espera ser muy puntual en sus pagos y no dejar mal a sus nuevas compañeras de grupo. Desea seguir trabajando juntos para así tener un respaldo económico y también poder ampliar su inversión mas adelante. Con el monto solicitado 600 soles, comprará materiales (mesas, sillas, manteles) y algunos ingredientes para seguir trabajando en su negocio.
texts.en:
Nadia, 35, is a cheerful, dynamic woman.  She lives with her spouse and three children who are 7, 5 and 2 years old in their own house.  Nadia’s work consists in selling food.  She goes to the market very early to buy the ingredients to prepare the food because in the afternoon she goes out into the street in front of her house to start selling her delicious and well prepared Juanes [made with rice, pieces of poultry meat, eggs, olives, aromatic herbs and spices, all wrapped up in "bijao" (plant from the jungle) leaves and boiled in clay pots], Tacachos [hash-like dish of plantain and pork or chicken] and roasted pork and chicken.  She’s been in this business for two years and works alone since her children are still too young and her spouse returns late from work.  What she likes about her work is that it leaves her with time to tend to her household, that is, she can care for her children since they are at a stage where they need much attention.  She is doing well in her work because she sells quite a bit every day and she hopes to stay in business and gradually equip it.

This will be her first MFP loan.  She expects to be very punctual with her payments and not disappoint her fellow group members.  She wants to continue working together to have economic support and also to expand her investment later on.  She will use the requested 600 soles to buy tables, chairs and tablecloths as well as some ingredients needed to continue working.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and raw materials for her food preparation.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es: El señor  Joaquín es artesano costurero; su esposa se fue a trabajar al extranjero para ayudar económicamente a su familia. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una maquina bordadora, así podrá mejorar la calidad de sus productos con un terminado perfecto que atraiga al cliente. Vive en casa de sus suegros la misma queda ubicada en la zona  Rió Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto; es casado y tiene tres hijos. Esta es la segunda vez que su solicitud de crédito se canaliza a través de los financiadotes en Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Joaquín is a sewing artisan. His wife works abroad in order to help their family financially. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy an embroidery machine so that he can improve the quality of his products. By perfecting the finishing touches on his goods, he will be able to attract customers. Joaquín lives in the house of his in-laws in the District of Rió Seco in the city of El Alto. He is married and has three children.

This is the second time that his loan is being referred to the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Danila

texts.es: La socia Daniela; actualemnte sigue con el negocio de los cueros, ella produce cartearas, bolsos, monederos, carutcheras, billeteras, la socia trabaj comprando cuero al por mayor y en todo grosor, la socia tambien compra cuero ya trabajado como los de color entre otros materiales para poder fabricar, carteras, la socia en esta ocasion desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de carteras, monedoros entre otros articulos, la socia es ambulante y ella desea tener un talelr bien implementado y poder tambien exhibir su mercaderia, ella trabaja muy duro para apoyar en casa a la educacion y a la mejor calidad de sus hijos. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la elaboracion de carteras, monederos, billeteras entre otros productos en base a cuero.
texts.en:
Daniela continues with her leather business. She manufactures small bags, bags, coin purses, pencil cases and wallets. She buys wholesale leather of various types, as well as processed and dyed leather and other raw materials for manufacturing her bags. 
This time, Daniela wants to use her loan for purchasing the materials needed for manufacturing bags, purses and other products. She is a street vendor but wants to have a fully set workshop where she can also exhibit her products. She works very hard in order to support her children's education and quality of life. 
Daniela is asking for this loan to purchase raw materials needed for manufacturing leather bags, purses and wallets.

loans.use: purchase raw materials for manufacturing bags, purses, wallets and other products made of leather

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a 39-year-old married man with 6 children. He lives in Hioma, Uganda. He is in the transport business and has been operating the business for 3 years. He is faced with a challenge of high fuel and transportation costs. His business goal is to expand into new markets, and his personal goal is to educate his children.

Christopher intends to use the loan to buy another vehicle for transport.

loans.use: to buy another vehicle  for transport purposes.

loans.name: Maria Linda

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de panes, tiene dos hijos de 3 y 5 años de edad, tienen casa propia, lleva un año vendiendo panes pollo y bebidas, este negocio surgió por la necesidad de mantener una ocupación que le generará ganancia, hasta el momento este negocio ha sido provechoso para ella y su familia.

Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de materiales y tener disponibilidad de dinero para el negocio, por el momento comprará pan de barra, pollo, condimentos, repollo, y gaciosas, con esto logrará incrementar el negocio y tener la disposición para la venta que realiza a diario ella espera trabajar fuertemente para darle una larga vida a este negocio ya que depende de su familia.
texts.en:
María sells bread. She has 2 children aged 3 and 5 years. She has her own house. She has been selling bread, chicken and beverages for the last year. This business arose due to need to have a job that generated profits. Up until now the business has been very profitable for her and her family.

Currently, she is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of raw materials and to have disposable income for the business. For the moment she will buy bread, chicken, seasonings, cabbage and soft drinks. With this she will manage to grow the business and have increased provisions for the sales she makes on a daily basis. She hopes to work hard so that the business will last a long time as her family depends on it.

loans.use: to buy sliced bread, chicken, cabbage and soft drinks.

loans.name: Jose Uriel

texts.es: Con dos años de experiencia, el señor José Uriel se dedica a la venta de dulces y mangos a las afueras de un colegio del norte de la ciudad de Medellín, actividad que surgió de la necesidad de conseguir los ingresos necesarios para su sostenimiento y el de su esposa luego de quedarse sin empleo. A sus 59 años, el señor José Uriel necesita de la compra de surtido en mangos y dulces que pueda vender y así mejorar sus ventas. El sueño del señor José Uriel es tener su propia tienda en la cual poder emplear jóvenes de su comunidad.
texts.en: Mr. José Uriel has two years' experience selling sweets and mangos outside a school on the northside of the city of Medellín.  His business arose out of a need to obtain enough income to support himself and his wife when he lost his job.  At age 59, José Uriel needs to buy a variety of mangos and sweets to improve sales.  His dream is to have his own store and employ youth in his community.

loans.use: To buy a variety of mangos and sweets.

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar is a 25 year old married woman who has three children. One child is in school. Yar has a business of selling food in a stall in Bor, South Sudan for one year.

Yar is requesting this loan through BRAC, South Sudan to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Olouwatobi Pk10 Group

texts.fr: OLOUWATOBI PK10 est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sourou T. Fernande (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 30 ans. Sourou T. Fernande est mariée à un conducteur du nom de Moïs. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Sourou T. Fernande et son mari. Pour cette raison, Sourou T. Fernande vend des condiments de façon ambulante depuis treize ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. De façon secondaire, Sourou T. Fernande vend aussi du pétrole. Sourou T. Fernande s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Sourou T. Fernande sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe OLOUWATOBI PK10, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des condiments et du pétrole.

loans.name: La Gloire Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LA GLOIRE est composé de trois personnes qui résident  dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Joelie (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 33 ans a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Joelie est mariée a un mécanicien du nom de Yawonde. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Joelie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour ce faire, Joelie vend des mèches et les produits cosmétiques depuis cinq ans. Joelie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Joelie ensemble avec les membres du groupe LA GLOIRE sollicite pour la première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des produits cosmétiques et des mèches.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of charcoal business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her buying and selling of charcoal business.

Jenelyn has been in this business for seven years. Jenelyn earns more income from farming rice and a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Jenelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Fifty-nine-year-old Margaret has no academic papers to show off but she is an accomplished farmer who hails from the remote village of Kamplamai, in the Kitale area of Kenya. She is happily married and, together with her handsome husband, is blessed with eight adorable children. Despite her considerable age for the past 30 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, farmers come to seek advice from her. Margaret is the breadwinner of her family, and this really pushes her to work hard so that her children will have a bright future and her parents will have a comfortable life.

Although she makes a profit from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals. Kenya's Kitale area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Margaret could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there. 

Accessing funds has been a challenge for Margaret, but she now feels relieved, because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Margaret believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Margaret to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.She dreams of building a modern house and moving from the mud house where she currently stays in.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy is 45 years and a mother of 2. She sells her merchandise in the main market. She has done this business over the last 8 years. The merchandise includes suiting materials for both men and women as well as children. She also deals in ready-to-wear dresses for children. The recent Christmas season gave her very encouraging sales.  Therefore she would like to add other items like mensware and shoes. She therefore seeks KIVA\'S assistance to diversify the product line. She completed the TEACH sessions last November from KRABAN SUPPORT FOUNDATION.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Susan Nyambura intends to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mukhtor

texts.en:
Mukhtor is a cook. He had worked more then 8 years in a restaurant in Russia. For two years he was a cook during military service. In 2005 he came back Tajikistan and opened his own café. He is renting a premises in the center of Istaravshan. He has 5 assistants. His last loan he used for a new grill and one more refrigerator. Mukhtor says that he is a successful entrepreneur and considers that to get progress in business a person should to be diligent, honest, and respect his clients.

His dream is to have a son; now he has 3 girls. His current loan request is for construction of a summer café near his present café.

loans.use: Open a summer cafe

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary O. is 36 years old. A native of Okpanamu, a town in Delta State, she is the leader of a LAPO group.  She has 2 years' experience in her business, i.e., in the sales and rental of video CDs. Mary is requesting a loan of $625 to purchase more CDs and expand her little micro-business.

loans.use: To buy more CDs for her inventory

loans.name: Chhim

texts.en: Mrs. Chhim N., aged 49, is a farmer who earns $1 per day. She is a widow with 4 children, 2 of whom work at a garment factory earning $70 per month each and 2 of whom are students. They rent the stereo equipment in the picture to neighbors for parties and weddings. She would like to borrow $500 to buy pigs to raise extra income for her family.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise extra income for her family.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
David and Vilma, a hard working married couple, have great dreams to proviD. the best to their three small children. David is a master construction worker, very well known and sought-after and respected by his work community for the excellent and professional work that he provides, with Vilma his wife by his siD. and his four laborers. They do their work every day from 8 a.m. until 6p.m. every night, with the only goal of saving enough money to purchase a small piece of land where they can build a house and therefore offer their beloved children a propper and safe life. The dream of this hard working couple is to purchase a roofing machine, equipment that will facilitate and help David in his work. For this they already have a small amount of money saved but it's still not enought to purchase the equipment they need; for this reason they are applying for a loan that they plan on repaying within a 6-month term. "Let's support the drive and efforts of this young couple to prosper in their life".

David y Vilma, pareja D. esposos muy trabajadores, con grandes deseos D. brindarles lo mejor a sus tres menores hijos, David es maestro D. obras, muy solicitado, conocido y respetado dentro D. su entorno laboral por los excelentes y finos trabajos que realiza, siempre acompañado D. su fiel esposa Vilma y D. sus cuatro trabajadores. Ellos desempeñan su labor diaria desD. las 8:00 D. la mañana hasta las 6:00 D. la tarD., con el único objetivo D. ahorrar lo suficiente para adquirir un terrenito y construir su casita y así ofrecerles a sus queridos hijos una morada propia y segura.El deseo D. esta emprendedora pareja es comprar una máquina D. techo, herramienta que le facilitará y agilizará el trabajo a David, para esto ya tienen ahorrado un dinerito pero aún no es suficiente para adquirir su tan deseada herramienta; es por esa razón que solicitan un préstamo y se comprometen en reembolsarlo en un lapso D. seis meses. “Apoyemos el ímpetu y esfuerzo D. esta joven pareja por prosperar en la vida”.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Loan is required to acquire new construction equipment that will facilitate the work and increase the work load.

loans.name: Iyos

texts.en: Iyos is 36 years old whose husband, S., has no fixed income. So she helps her husband provide the family needs by selling some foods at her house such as blended ice, fried snacks, etc., and usually earns US $2.50 - $3.50 per day. Iyos is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan to buy more goods and provide tuition for her children. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Lesly

texts.en:
Lesly T. Z. has a store selling groceries in the town of San Juan, district La Banda de Shilcayo, province and department San Martin.  She started the store three years ago from her house with S/. 500.  Over time, the business has grown and she has been able to provide a better service for her community.  Lesly says that she is always friendly and flexible with her customers.

Lesly is 40 years old and married with no children.  Her husband is very supportive and helps her with manual labor. Lesly never had the opportunity to study so she loves running her business because she says it make her feel good.  Before she started her business she spent her time doing house work and working out in the fields.  

Lesly is part of the community bank Las Margaritas and is requesting a loan of S/. 1,000 so she can restock her shelves and invest in new products her clients frequently ask for. She will repay the loan in four months. She is confident that repaying this loan will not be a problem as she already has many loyal customers.

loans.use: To restock her shelves and invest in new products

location.town: La Banda de Shilcayo - San Martín

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es:
Mirtha is a cook with good tasting food. That is what her most zealous lodgers said. Everyday they attend her cozy dining room to sample the succulent dishes that she prepares. She has been selling food for two years in order to help her dear husband with the household expenses and the education of their two small children which want an opportunity to improve themselves and be able to acquire a good, solid education. Being this goal a great need and wish of this family, they are requesting a loan to set their place and build a small grocery store where the lodgers can get diverse consumer products. Remember that your support is important for the well-being of this family

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Mirtha, es cocinera con muy buena sazón, así lo confirman sus más fervientes pensionistas que día a día acuden a su acogedor comedor a degustar D. sus apetecibles platillos.Ella desD. hace dos años venD. comida para poder ayudar a su querido esposo con los gastos del hogar y la educación D. sus dos pequeños hijos, los cuales tienen deseos D. superación y gran necesidad D. poder formarse cognitivamente.Siendo esta una gran necesidad y deseo D. su familia requiere D. un préstamo para ambientar su local e instalar una bodeguita en donD. sus pensionistas puedan adquirir diversos productos D. consumo.Recuerda que su apoyo es importante para el bienestar D. esta familia.

loans.use: Buying better utensils to improve the service to her customers and their comfort.

loans.name: Rukia's Faith Group

texts.en:
Although Rukia A. is only 19 years old, she already shoulders plenty of responsibility. She and her husband are responsible for caring for a 63-year-old family member. To help support her family, Rukia works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day selling food at a local store in her city of Dar es Salaam, Tanzania.

Rukia hopes to buy a freezer and more supplies for her business, which is why she's applied for a group loan of $275 U.S. dollars. Her loan partner is Zaina I., who earns a living by selling pillows. Zaina also wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy a freezer for a food vending business

loans.name: Asha's Hiari Ya Moyo Group

texts.en:
Asha is 25 years old and is married with 1 child, age 10 months. She and her husband also take care of two other children, ages 14 and 12 years. Asha owns a small stock of animals. She started her business in 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm, and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more animals to increase her stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Rehema, who has her own business.

loans.use: To increase her animal stock.

loans.name: Fatou Gogo

texts.fr:
Fatou Gogo N. is a woman who lives in the Tenth district in Thies; she is married and the mother of three. Her main business consists of buying and reselling second-hand clothing. She has been in this business since 2005, and with this loan, she proposes to increase her inventory with the goal of improving her revenue.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

FATOU GOGO NDIAYEest une femme qui habite au quartier dixieme à Thies ; elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants; son activité principale consiste à acheter et à revendre de la fripperie ; elle fait cette activité depuis 2005 et avec ce prêt elle compte augmenter son stock dans le but d'améliorer ses revenus.

loans.use: Inventory of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Sabado Samuel

texts.pt:
Sabado is 39 years old and she is from the province of Gaza. Sabado has 7 children with two different wives -- 5 of them are from the same mother and their ages range from 8 to 18 years old. His children from the second wife are 13 and 16 years old. Out of the 7 children, only the oldest one does not go to school anymore. Besides his children, Sabado also supports his mother who lives in Chokwe by sending her a monthly allowance. Sabado went to school until the 4th grade and he says he did not continue his education because he traveled during his vacation to another province and once he returned his spot in the school was not available any longer. In 1980, right after his father death, he moved away from the province of Gaza and relocated to Maputo to look for a better life. In 1981 he worked for Vetagro-Boane and between 1995 and 1997 he worked as a security guard when there were many lay-offs and he was also let go. In 1998 he tried following his friend's steps by opening up a chicken raising business but he had to abandon that activity due to a lethal epidemic that killed many of his hens. Sabado lives in his own home. Sabado learned the trade by watching his friends do it since 1998. He has a permanent location on Namaacha Avenue in the town of Mazanbanine and its normal hours of operation are from 7:00am to 9:00pm -- these hours can be longer if there is a great influx of business. He has been engaged in this field for 6 years and with help from two employees he has been able to sell beer for 25,00mt, juices for 10,00mt and semea for 120,00 per bag. Sabado's income varies between 300,00mt and 1000,00mt per month and, depending on the business volume, it could reach as much as 2500,00mt. It is a goal to Sabado to expand and keep his business growing. His plans for the near future are open up more establishments in the town where he lives and expand his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Sabado tem 39 anos de idade e é natural da província de gaza. Sabado é pai de 7 filhos com duas esposas sendo 5 filhos de uma mesma pessoa, com idades variando entre 18 e 8 anos de idade. Com a outra esposa Sabado tem dois filhos de 16 e 13 anos. Dos 7 filhos o mais velho já não vai a escola e os outros estudam. Para alem dos filhos Sabado sustenta a sua mãe que se encontra em Chokwe enviando valores monetários para ela. Sabado estudou ate 4ªclasse e diz que não continuou por ter perdido a vaga quando nas ferias do fim do ano viajou para outra província e quando voltou já não havia vaga. Em 1980 mudou-se da província de Gaza para Maputo a procura de melhores condições de vida, logo apos a morte do seu pai. Em 1981 trabalhou no Vetagro-Boane, em 1995 trabalhou como segurança até 1997, ano que demitiram trabalhadores e ele foi atingido. Em 1998 tentou seguir os amigos abrindo um negocio de criação de frangos que só veio deixar o mesmo em 2002 quando teve a quebra de morte dos pintos. Sabado vive na casa própria. Sabado aprendeu o negocio copiando aos amigos desde 1998. Tem um estabelecimento permanente sita na AV. Da Namaacha no bairro Mazanbanine. Exercendo atividades comerciais ha 6 anos, o estabelecimento funciona das 7:00h até 21:00h excluindo os dias de muito movimento. Sabado tem dois empregados e tem vendido mais cerveja por 25,00mt, refresco por 10,00mt e semea por 120,00mt o saco. Sabado tem um rendimento entre 300,00mt e 1000,00mt por mês dependendo do movimento, pode ate fazer 2500,00mt por mês. Assim constitui como desafio para Sabado expandir ou manter o seu negocio. Para Sabado é o segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva e nunca teve empréstimo em outras instituições. O primeiro foi de 15000,00mt com qual comprou mercadoria aumentando o seu stock. Assim com este empréstimo Sabado quer comprar novamente mercadoria para de novo aumentar o stock e assim espera melhorar o seu negocio. O plano com o negocio daqui em diante é abrir mais estabelecimento no bairro onde ele reside bairro 07 e futuramente ampliar os negócios.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase stock.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima, 47 years old, is single and lives in a small village in the South of Lebanon. Her goal is to have a regular revenue stream and to provide for the basic needs of her family. Rima produces home-made mouneh (Arabic: food that is stored for later consumption, such as pickles, jams, tomato paste, etc.) She named her business Al Khayr (Arabic: good fortune).

Rima needs a loan of US$500 to purchase more ingredients and thereby expand her business. Rima has been a micro-credit client of Al Majmoua for two cycles and has repaid her loans on time.

loans.use: Purchase of raw material to ensure food items production

loans.name: Gisela

texts.en:
Gisela is 29 years old. She is married with three children, aged eight, six and four. She has owned and run a small shop since 2004. Every day, she works from 6am to 12:30pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $450 from her sales.

Gisela will use her loan to purchase more inventory.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Mrs. Kunthea P., 27, and her husband, Mr. Sambath Khan, 42, who live on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2002 and have two children: one son and one daughter.

Mrs. Kunthea has been a silk weaver for 15 years, a skill she learned from her aunt. She also has taught her husband to become a silk weaver as well. Besides weaving, he is also a musician. The couple sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh.

Kunthea is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk materials for her weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Hul

texts.en:
Hul S., 51, is married and lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Currently, she is employed as a marketing officer and makes US$1 each day, while her husband is a traditional musician, earning US$1.50 each day. The couple has three children, two of whom are not living at home.

Hul S. is asking for a loan of US$500 to breed a cow. Leftover funds will be used to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a motor-taxi for extra profit.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah M., 68, sells sarongs and homemade ice cream at the local market. Her daughter-in-law assists her in making the ice cream at her home. She has been in this business for the past two years. Sarah is married and has three children.

She is requesting the loan to purchase more sarongs and ingredients for making ice cream. She thanks Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients for ice cream and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Soutara Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe soutara sont des femmes mariées vivant en général dans des foyers polygames avec en moyenne cinq (5) enfants. Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et résident toutes à sélengué (sous prefecture de Yanfolila dans la 3e région administrative du Mali).
Pour insuffler une nouvelle envergure à leurs activités, elles ont décidé de faire recours au service de l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt et le prémier prêt a été bien remboursé.
Elles s’pprovisionnent sur place et vendent sur place à l’étale ou en ambulant. Avec ce pret les femmes du groupe soutara comptent acheter 400  kilogrammes de graines d’arachide et beaucoup d’articles divers pour réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 36.000 FCFA par membre destiné à couvrir les dépenses familliales.
texts.en:
The members of the group Soutara are married women living generally in polygamous households and who have five children on average. They know one another by ties of community, and they all reside in Sélengué (sub-prefecture of Yanfolila in the third administrative region of Mali).

To infuse a new significance into their business, they decided on turning towards the services of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their second loan, their first loan having been repaid.

They get their supplies locally and sell their goods either through their displays or by going door-to-door. With this loan, the women of the group each intend to buy 400 kg of peanuts and many items of different sorts in order to realize an average monthly profit of 36,000 francs CFA for covering family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanuts, tubers, and various items

loans.name: Astou's Group

texts.fr: Ces femmes agées entre 25 et 46 ans habittent toutes dans un quartier de mbour a côté de la mer.Elles sont toutes mariées et mere de plusieurs enfants .Pour combattre l' inactivité et chômage qui frappent les femmes ,elles menent au sein du quartier des activités de transformation  et de vente des produits halieutiques .Pour accroitre leur capacite de production ,elles sollicitent un pret.
texts.en:
These women are between 25 and 46 years old and live next to the sea in a neighborhood of Mbour. They are all married and the mother of several children. To fight idleness and unemployment that affects women, they run several businesses in the heart of their neighborhood, in the sector of fish transformation and sale. To increase their capacity of production, they are seeking this loan.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase their capacity of production

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Juan José G. le está haciendo falta el piso de concreto de un cuarto para tenerla ya terminado y así sus tres hijos tengan su propio espacio ya que están en edad escolar.
 Don Juan José G. trabaja en una maquiladora en el aria de técnico de calidad este es su ingreso familia y con el desea pagar este crédito. 
El día que fuimos a ser la visita del domicilio del señor Juan José G. no se encontraba estaba en su trabaja es por eso que en la foto aparece su esposa la señora  Juana María Hernández.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan José G.’s home needs a concrete floor in a room to finish it so his three children may have their own space as they are now school-aged. Juan José G. works in a factor as a quality technician and this is his family’s income with which he will pay back this loan. The day we went to visit Juan José G. in his home he wasn’t there as he was at work so his wife, Juana María Hernández, appears in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Concrete floor

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en: Chuon S. is 25 years old and lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Chuon has a motorbike and trailer and every day he transports wood to earn a living. He is able to make $4 profit per day.
